DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
We have a
[special prosecutor, Robert Mueller to investigate possible collusion](http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/article/2017/may/17/who-robert-mueller-new-special-counsel-leading-rus/)
between the Trump camp and Russia, one everyone agrees is the best possible choice. Hallelujah. Thanks to Rod Rosenstein who opted to take this step, wisely opting
[not to consult with the White House or Jeff Sessions on it?first](http://www.latimes.com/politics/washington/la-na-essential-washington-updates-former-fbi-director-robert-mueller-1495058507-htmlstory.html)
.
We got here in part because Rod Rosenstein did absolutely the wise and right thing, of course.?But also because you called on your congresspeople:
to keep their eyes on Flynn;
to question apparent ties to Russia;
to get Jeff Sessions to recuse himself from anything related to Russia;
to question the timing of Comey's firing;
and now, to call for a special prosecutor.
Good job!
...so let's keep going
As MN Senator Amy Klobuchar said
[this morning on Morning Edition](http://www.npr.org/2017/05/18/528900007/sen-amy-klobuchar-on-what-she-wants-to-hear-from-rosenstein)
, the special counsel is great and needed, but Robert Mueller's role is to answer one specific question: Did Trump actually collude with Russia to throw the election? In other words, everyone knows Russia meddled, but what is not known is the extent to which Trump knowingly participated.
Regardless of Mueller's?findings, there are other, different steps that need to be taken to safeguard?against this situation in the future. We need laws and?protocols?to protect?campaigns against this kind of information, as well as?to guide campaigns and media on how to treat leaked/hacked?information when presented with it. We need, Klobuchar and others suggest, an independent 9/11-style commission, which will be able to provide recommendations to that end.
Your task
Check
[this article](https://news.vice.com/story/here-are-all-the-members-of-congress-calling-for-an-independent-investigation-after-comeys-abrupt-dismissal)
to see whether your Senator previously called for a special prosecutor or not (quickest way is to search your state or your Senator's name). Call
[your Senator](http://govtrack.us)
.
If your Senator DID call for a special prosecutor:
My name is _____ and I live in ____. I am calling to thank Senator ____?for calling for a special prosecutor to be appointed to investigate possible collusion between the Trump camp and Russia.?Rod Rosenstein did the best thing he could have done by appointing Robert Mueller to be special prosecutor.
I am also calling to ask Senator ____ to call for a special commission to investigate the issue of foreign interference in our elections.?Regardless of whether President Trump had a role in the interference, everyone agrees the interference was there and?plagued?our elections. A special commission can?come up with recommendations for?laws and protocols to protect campaigns from foreign interference and stop them from using ill-gotten information against each other. Can I count on Senator ______ to support a special commission to investigate what happened in order to guard against similar situations in the future?
If your Senator did NOT call for a special prosecutor:
My name is _____ and I live in ____. I am calling to say Rod Rosenstein did absolutely the best thing he could have done by appointing Robert Mueller to be special prosecutor to investigate possible collusion between the Trump camp and Russia. This move?is being praised by Congresspeople?of both parties.?Can you tell me why Senator ______ did not support the appointment of a special prosecutor before?
[Wait for answer.]
The appointment?fosters bipartisanship, reestablishes trust, and frees up a whole lot of energy and attention for Congress and or the American people. If there was no collusion, great. Now we can know for sure. I am disappointed that Senator ______ did not have the courage to call for a special prosecutor before.
I am calling for a related reason as well. Regardless of whether President Trump had a role in the interference, everyone agrees there definitely
was
foreign interference in our elections. I am therefore asking Senator ____ to call for a special commission to investigate this issue. A special commission ?can come up with recommendations for laws and protocols to protect campaigns from foreign interference and stop them from using ill-gotten?information against each other. A responsible investigation to help us make our elections secure will help every American, Republicans and Democrats alike. Can I count on Senator ______ to support a special commission to investigate what happened in order to guard against similar situations in the future?
Sources
www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/article/2017/may/17/who-robert-mueller-new-special-counsel-leading-rus/
http://www.latimes.com/politics/washington/la-na-essential-washington-updates-former-fbi-director-robert-mueller-1495058507-htmlstory.html
www.npr.org/2017/05/18/528900007/sen-amy-klobuchar-on-what-she-wants-to-hear-from-rosenstein
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 18, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello!
It's working...
Trump is
[certainly taking heat](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/16/us/white-house-staff.html)
, but it's really Trump who brought this on himself.?But the strong attention being paid by people like you has helped generate the press's responsiveness and the congressional democrats' spine.
...so let's keep going
It's important not to get sucked into wish fulfillment fantasies. With this Congress and with
[Trump's core supporters still strongly behind him](http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-trump-republicans-dilemma-20170516-story.html)
, it's not likely Trump will be impeached and even less likely he'll be removed. It's true that
[this morning Jason Chaffetz, the head of the House Oversight Committee, subpoenaed the Comey memos](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2017/live-updates/trump-white-house/trump-comey-and-russia-how-key-washington-players-are-reacting/jason-chaffetz-lets-see-how-real-these-memos-are/)
describing Trump's attempts to influence him, but I have complete confidence that Chaffetz will use his committee's power to try to neutralize Trump's actions, not bring them to accountability.
Meanwhile, right-wing policies are getting passed even as this summer blockbuster unfolds. Let's address one of those today?an attempt to open up our protected public lands to drilling and other industry.
Today's action is inspired by
[My Civic Workout](http://mailchi.mp/mycivicworkout/lean-green-resisting-machine-233891?e=732111aa91)
. They're awesome. Their words: "The administration is 'reviewing the status' of 27 public lands designated as national monuments: this is their euphemism for seeking to allow drilling and other destructive activities on some of America?s most beautiful wild lands. These monuments also protect wildlife and support the economies of nearby towns by bringing in tourists. The administration is trying to shut out the public by having an absurdly short notice and comment period?only 15 days." Read more about the Antiquities Act, the economic and cultural importance of national monuments, and the harm that will be done of this historic rollback
[here](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/26/climate/antiquities-act-federal-lands-donald-trump.html)
.
Your task
Post a comment TODAY, as there is a very short comment period.
[Here](http://www.regulations.gov/comment?D=DOI-2017-0002-0001)
is the link to the site.
Take a look at the monuments currently being targeted
[here](https://www.regulations.gov/document?D=DOI-2017-0002-0001)
. Take a look at the rest of the monuments in the U.S.
[here](https://www.nps.gov/archeology/sites/antiquities/monumentslist.htm)
. Take a look at your state's protected areas
[here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Protected_areas_of_the_United_States_by_state)
. ?Don't forget to consider nearby states; for example, Chicago, my place of residence, is just a few hours from incredible beauty in Indiana, Wisconsin and Michigan.
Again,
[here](https://www.regulations.gov/comment?D=DOI-2017-0002-0001)
is the comment site where you will post your comment.
Write of course whatever you like. Here are some ideas:
[Either]
I grew up around/I live near/I frequently visit ______. Because of this monument, I [learned to appreciate the beauty around us; experienced incredible family bonding time that lasts to this day; was inspired to follow my career of ____; learned to hunt and fish/hike and camp/bird and botanize, activities I cherish]. [____ has vilatized the areas nearby fostering small businesses and providing jobs a the monument itself.]
OR
I often frequent [such and such publicly protected place], a place similar to the national monuments under review, and similarly protected. I understand the value of natural areas on the mind, body and soul.
[Appreciating quiet and beauty; experiencing family bonding by doing ___ with my ___; exploring the mysteries of ____; learning to hunt and fish/hike and camp/bird and botanize, activities I cherish] has been an essential part of my/my family's experience.
[Then in either case add]
It is simply not up to us to use up everything around us. The world is moving forward with new kinds of industry and energy policy, and if we open up our monuments to development today, we leave nothing for our children, or for other creatures in the world, tomorrow. States do not have the capacity to protect and manage lands on their own. Considering a change in status of these monuments is tragically short-sighted. I implore you to retain the protection of ____, other national monuments, and other public protected lands.
[Consider incorporating some of all of a
[Teddy Roosevelt quote](https://en.wikiquote.org/wiki/Theodore_Roosevelt)
:]
"I ask nothing of the nation except that it so behave as each farmer here behaves with reference to his own children. That farmer is a poor creature who skins the land and leaves it worthless to his children. The farmer is a good farmer who, having enabled the land to support himself and to provide for the education of his children, leaves it to them a little better than he found it himself. I believe the same thing of a nation."
"Of all the questions which can come before this nation, short of the actual preservation of its existence in a great war, there is none which compares in importance with the great central task of leaving this land even a better land for our descendants than it is for us, and training them into a better race to inhabit the land and pass it on. Conservation is a great moral issue, for it involves the patriotic duty of insuring the safety and continuance of the nation. "
Sources
https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/16/us/white-house-staff.html
www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-trump-republicans-dilemma-20170516-story.html
https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2017/live-updates/trump-white-house/trump-comey-and-russia-how-key-washington-players-are-reacting/jason-chaffetz-lets-see-how-real-these-memos-are/
https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/26/climate/antiquities-act-federal-lands-donald-trump.html
Also
http://www.pbs.org/nationalparks/people/historical/roosevelt/
https://www.grandcanyontrust.org/sites/default/files/GGCHNM_Proposal_Brief.pdf

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
...because the Trump regime is inspiring the brilliance of
[Randy Rainbow](https://www.facebook.com/RandyRainbowOfficial/)
. That guy is a national frigging treasure. If we stay focused, we will emerge from this dark time with far more civic engagement, a strong?regard for the importance of stewarding?democracy, and some break-out comedic/creative talents.
...so let's keep going
The other day Trump said
["I get great intel. I have people brief me on great intel every day"](http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/trump-revealed-highly-classified-information-to-russian-foreign-minister-and-ambassador/2017/05/15/530c172a-3960-11e7-9e48-c4f199710b69_story.html)
and then proceeded to tell two Russian diplomats, their aides, and the Russia Today journalist in the room highly classified espionage information.
This is who our president is.
This man is catastrophically?unqualified and unprepared for his job?and, just as bad,?he would never ever ever admit it or accept help, so we are burdened?with the corresponding consequences. A not-particularly-accomplished?high school student could do better. A lot of people are making a big deal out of the fact that he blabbed these secrets to Russians. I think that's sort of immaterial. That he did this with
any
person at
all
is
unbelievably amateurish, immature, stupid, and dangerous

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 16, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Did I mention the Planned Parenthood fundraiser I helped out with last Sunday? My very talented and amazing jazz musician friend gathered all
her
jazz musician friends at a restaurant for a three-hour rotating cast of music, with raffle prizes and a small silent auction. We raised $3000 in small donations!! It was an amazing success. At one point I ventured out to the?part of the restaurant not reserved for the fundraiser?to see if anyone wanted to purchase tickets, which was scary, but people were very receptive, including young men there with their friends. The fight to retain/strengthen?reproductive and economic rights cannot be one that only women fight.
[If men remain passive](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ydHjbKaL5A)
, everyone will lose.
...so let's keep going
[Yesterday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-may-14-2017)
we?re-visited some important actions that might have gotten lost among the Comey stuff. Please look at those if you haven't done 'em. Today I'd like to review an action?from the week?before that might have gotten lost in the health care vote:
Trump has recently selected a prominent anti-choice activist,
[Charmaine Yoest](http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/trump-names-anti-abortion-leader-charmaine-yoest-high-post-hhs-n752836)
, as?assistant secretary of public affairs at the Department of Health and Human Services. He has also appointed
[Teresa Manning](http://www.newsweek.com/trump-contraception-abortion-family-planning-funding-592942)
,?a person who does. not. believe. in. contraception. to head Title X,?our country's only federal?family planning program, which targets?teen pregnancy.
Neither of these are elected positions. Trump has appointed them. They are in charge of our country's direction on family planning now.
Your task
Email, fax, write,?or phone?the
[White House](https://www.whitehouse.gov/contact)
,
[Tom Price](http://Secretary@hhs.gov/)
at Health and Human Services, and
[all three of your congresspeople](https://www.govtrack.us/)
. Post your letter/script on your social media or forward it and ask others to email them too.
Script (if you are emailing/faxing, delete the notes to you before sending):
I am deeply disturbed by President Trump's appointment of Charmain Yoest to HHS and Teresa Manning to Title X.
[add some or all of the following]
The decision to get?an abortion is between a person, her faith, and her family. One doesn't have to believe she or he would ever get an abortion to still support the notion that others might choose differently. People get abortions for all sorts of reasons;?to think a person is?not making a careful decision based on her personal circumstances is to disrespect her capacity for independent thought and her?right to self-determination.?It is a deeply?inappropriate decision to legislate.
[and then add this]
Moreover, both Yoest and Manning's stance against birth control is completely counter to their stated goal of eliminating abortions. There is ample evidence from the U.S. and abroad that access to birth control reduces abortions. We can look at our own state of Colorado for their successful birth control programs,
[which have reduced teen?pregnancy,?reduced abortions, and saved taxpayer money all by startling margins](http://www.snopes.com/colorado-birth-control-facts/)
.
[Last paragraph for the White House and Tom Price]
I strongly condemn both of these appointments and will fight every step of the way to retain access to reproductive rights, rights that safeguard opportunity and health for men, women, children, and entire families.
OR
[Last paragraph for your congresspeople]:
I strongly condemn both of these appointments and expect _______ to fight every step of the way to retain access to reproductive rights, rights that safeguard opportunity and health for men, women, children, and entire families
.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 14, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Sorry for the typo yesterday. Of course I meant Marine Le Pen. Maine Le Pen is busy catching lobsters or something.
It's working...
Trump has
[delayed making his decision on the Paris Climate Agreement](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2017/05/09/donald-trump-paris-climate-deal--g-7-summit/101475462/)
, which you may remember he had staunchly pre-decided was terrible and should end.
...so let's keep going
Jeff Sessions' behavior has shown he is simply unfit for his role. Tuesday, he advised on a matter that he is supposed to have recused himself from. Does this not open him to legal trouble? Then Friday he released a two-page memo
[urging prosecutors to maximize severity of charges and punishment](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/sessions-issues-sweeping-new-criminal-charging-policy/2017/05/11/4752bd42-3697-11e7-b373-418f6849a004_story.html)
, despite bipartisan agreement that such practices are unhelpful. Decades of research show that this type of justice policy
[does not deter crime](http://www.economist.com/blogs/freeexchange/2016/03/criminal-justice)
, especially
[drug crime](http://www.npr.org/2014/12/16/370991710/judge-regrets-harsh-human-toll-of-mandatory-minimum-sentences)
, and that
[from its origin](http://www.cnn.com/2016/03/23/politics/john-ehrlichman-richard-nixon-drug-war-blacks-hippie/)
to
[now](http://fivethirtyeight.com/features/from-wallace-to-trump-the-evolution-of-law-and-order/)
it is absolutely intended to cripple black and brown communities (not because people of color commit more crimes but because
[policing, hearings and sentencing are all much harsher in communities of color](http://thenewpress.com/books/no-equal-justice)
than in white communities). What it does is
[fill prisons](http://www.nationalreview.com/article/424059/mass-incarceration-prison-reform)
(we have the
[highest incarceration rate in the world](http://www.nationalreview.com/article/424059/mass-incarceration-prison-reform)
by far) and
[the private prison industry has benefited mightily from this](https://www.marketplace.org/2017/05/12/business/private-prisons-benefit-new-trump-rules)
. Former attorney general Eric Holder offered a withering condemnation of Sessions' new policy. Jeff Sessions is stuck in pre-Civil Rights America and wants to pull America back to that time. Eric Holder, the Obama's? attorney general, made an incredible
[statement condemning Sessions' decision](https://twitter.com/EricHolder/status/863058742522388480)
.
We knew this was coming, but it still makes me sick to my stomach. In fact, it's difficult to write a five-minute task, as there seems no adequate response to this gleeful re-dedication to oppression.
Today, register your grave concern about Jeff Sessions' outdated and willfully ill-informed rollback in criminal justice policies.
Your task
Write or call the ACLU, your members of Congress, and the Department of Justice:
Your local ACLU affiliate can be found
[here](https://www.aclu.org/about/affiliates)
.
Members of Congress can be found
[here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members)
but I certainly hope they're in your phone contacts.
DoJ comment form can be
[here](https://www.justice.gov/doj/webform/your-message-department-justice)
, comment line phone number is 202-353-1555. You can also submit a civil rights complaint againt a DOJ employee (that would be Jeff Sessions) through an online form or phone call
[here](https://oig.justice.gov/hotline/contact-doj.htm)
.
Say:
I am appalled by Jeff Sessions' rollback of criminal justice reforms and specific instruction to intensify the harshness of sentences. Decades of research show this policy does nothing to make communities safer, and efforts to get away from this kind of policy have been fully bipartisan. There is no rational reason to return to these policies. [Add one of the following:]
[For the ACLU:] This issue is an important one for me for organizations like you to focus on. Thank you for your hard work.
[Congress:] Please work with your colleagues across the aisle and within your own party to pass measures that will neutralize this backward and unproductive decree.
[AG/Assistant AG:] I urge the Department of Justice to reconsider this unhelpful policy, which has been shown to destroy families, ruin lives, and eliminate stability for children.
It seems to me that local municipalities are really important here for resisting this kind of law enforcement, but that will have to be a five-minute action for another day.
Sources

thenewpress.com/books/no-equal-justice

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 13, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
Sorry for the late letter. Sometimes I need a minute to let our reality sink in, and sometimes I need like eight hours. Okay:
It's working...
Last week, French people looked at Brexit, looked at the U.S., ignored some hacked emails leaked by Russia, and voted using their reason.
[Centrist Emmanuel Macron soundly beat Trumpist far-Rightwinger Maine Le Pen](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/07/world/europe/emmanuel-macron-france-election-marine-le-pen.html)
in France's presidential election. PHEW. This bodes well for the French people, for the economy and integrity of the EU, and for the world.
...so let's keep going
Trump continues to make his actions
[more and more indefensible](https://corrupt.af/)
, and the Republican leadership

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 12, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Gday!
It's working...
Remember that rollback in methane regulations the House passed in their giddy zeal to undo everything Obama had done while encouraging total hostility toward any innovation in the energy sector? Inexplicably,
[the Senate failed to pass this rollback](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-congress-idUSKBN18620F)
. Three Republicans, Collins, Graham, and McCain, voted No. It might have been that it would lose the Treasury $800 billion per year, it might have been your and my phone calls, it might have been something else, but it is a rare win for the environment in this era. Yay!
...so let's keep going
We need to keep the noise up about the highly unusual and highly problematic firing of James Comey. If you don't understand why this is a big deal, read
[this](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/05/two-dead-canaries-in-the-coal-mine/526230/)
. Or
[this](https://www.bloomberg.com/view/articles/2017-05-10/after-comey-justice-must-be-served)
. Or
[this](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/10/opinion/james-comey-fired-fbi.html?_r=0)
, or
[](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/10/opinion/james-comey-fired-fbi.html?_r=0)
[this](https://www.washingtonpost.com/amphtml/politics/how-trumps-anger-and-impatience-prompted-him-to-fire-the-fbi-director/2017/05/10/d9642334-359c-11e7-b373-418f6849a004_story.html)
, or
[this](http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/10/politics/james-comey-donald-trump-firing-tick-tock/)
. There is a real danger that this authoritarian intolerance for independent thought will be aggressively explained away and any pursuit neutralized or trivialized. It is up to Congress to prevent us from sliding into authoritarianism. I'll add that if, as Trump claims, the timing was unintentional and he had no idea this would cause concern, he is unacceptably and dangerously ignorant. The incredibly unwise incident yesterday, where Russian media was allowed into the private meeting between Trump and two Russian ambassadors, confirms this assessment. Trump's combination of authoritarian bent and profound ignorance is too dangerous to go on.
Your task
Be advised These scripts are really long. I want to provide you with arguments supporting your concern in the case of a Trump-enabling congressional office. I also want to address both the firing and the Russian media issue. If you don't have time to call all three members of Congress right now, just do one. Maybe you can do the others later.
First,
[check this list](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/05/10/us/politics/congress-statements-comey.html?_r=0)
to see how your members of Congress have reacted to the Comey firing.
If your congressperson has expressed concern about the firing, say:
My name is ____ and I'm calling from _____. First, I want to thank ____ for expressing concern about the timing [and nature] of Trump's decision to fire Comey. It is up to Congress to rein in the executive branch's overreaches, whether the overreaches are made through ignorance, power-grabbing, or incompetence. Congress must ensure an independent person with integrity and knowledge become the new FBI director. Congress must censure Jeff Sessions for being involved in the Comey matter. Congress must find a means to have an independent investigation conducted. Congress is the check-and-balance here. I am begging them to do their job.
I am also extremely alarmed that
[American press was not let into the meetings between Trump and the Russian ambassadors yesterday but Russian press was](http://www.cnbc.com/2017/05/11/russian-photographers-visit-to-oval-office-raises-security-concerns.html)
. If it was an accident, as the White House says, then the people in the White House are exceedingly irresponsible and ignorant and are putting us in danger. This is not a joke. This is our country. And if it was not an accident, that is cause for grave alarm regarding our first amendment rights and our nation's sovereignty.
What more is ______ planning on doing to address the gross incompetence and authoritarian predilections of? the Trump administration? [Listen for answer] And how will _____ hold his/her colleagues in Congress responsible for aiding and abetting this president's overreaches?
And if your congressperson is fine or neutral with the firing:
My name is ____ and I'm calling from _____. I read that _____
[supports/has not commented on/is neutral about](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/05/10/us/politics/congress-statements-comey.html?_r=0)
the president's firing of James Comey, is that correct? [Wait for answer.] Isn't _____ concerned about the timing? [Wait for answer.] It is the job of the FBI to investigate troubling actions and Trump, who was the subject of an investigation, fired the person in charge of the investigation. Doesn't that concern ____? [Wait for answer.]
Trump had previously enthusiastically referenced Comey's actions to lead crowds to chant "Lock her up." You tell me -- doesn't it strike you as highly unlikely that Trump would suddenly be concerned about Clinton's treatment? He may not like things Comey did, but doesn't that particular thing seem out of character? [Wait for answer.]
[If the aide says something about how Democrats wanted Comey fired:] You don't expect me to believe Trump is doing something because Democratic congresspeople told him to, do you? Also that is irrelevant. What we have here is a president who fired the person in charge of investigating him, in the middle of the investigation.
[If the aide references Rosenstein's letter:] It seems clear from various reports that Trump grew frustrated with Comey and so
[asked the DOJ to come up with reasons to fire him](http://www.washingtonpost.com/amphtml/politics/how-trumps-anger-and-impatience-prompted-him-to-fire-the-fbi-director/2017/05/10/d9642334-359c-11e7-b373-418f6849a004_story.html)
. And Rosenstein does not recommend firing Comey in his letter.
[continuing your phone call...]It is up to Congress to rein in the executive branch's overreaches, whether they are a matter of malice or bad timing. That ______ is covering for Trump's bizarre actions looks very very bad. Here are my requests: If ____ wants his/her constituents to have any trust in him/her, it is crucial that she/he fight for an independent person with integrity and knowledge to become the new FBI director. She/he should also censure Jeff Sessions for being involved, despite his supposed recusal from all matters related to Russia. And ______ must support an independent investigation. Congress is the check-and-balance here. I am begging ___ and his/her colleagues in Congress to do their job.
I am also extremely alarmed that
[American press was not let into the meetings between Trump and the Russian ambassadors yesterday but Russian press was](http://www.cnbc.com/2017/05/11/russian-photographers-visit-to-oval-office-raises-security-concerns.html)
. If it was an accident, as the White House says, then the people in the White House are exceedingly irresponsible and ignorant and are putting us in danger. This is not a joke. This is our country. And if it was not an accident, that is cause for grave alarm regarding our first amendment rights and our nation's sovereignty.
What more is ______ planning on doing to address the president's mistakes and overreaches? [Wait? for answer.]
Thank you. I am very concerned about Congress's role in enabling the overreaches of this administration, and I am paying attention.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 11, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
And by "It" today I mean our
[journalistic media](https://www.propublica.org/article/how-were-learning-to-do-journalism-differently-in-the-age-of-trump)
. Let's hope they, and We the People, can force the Republicans in Congress to adhere to our Founders' system of checks and balances. What we have on our hands today is the distinct possibility of a
[Constitutional Crisis](https://constitutioncenter.org/blog/is-the-comey-firing-causing-a-constitutional-crisis)
.
...so let's keep going
Um.
So! Yesterday, Trump
[fired FBI Director James Comey suddenly](http://www.npr.org/2017/05/10/527744909/suspicious-timing-and-convenient-reasoning-for-trumps-firing-of-comey)
. The purported reason was that Comey was unfair to Clinton in July in re her emails. Once you stop laugh-weeping about that incredibly disingenuous rationale, peruse
[this article](http://www.nationalreview.com/corner/447463/trump-fires-james-comey-krauthammer-calls-it-inexplicable-do-may)
which recounts how incredibly mystifying the firing is from a conservative's perspective.
Also, Trump fired Comey on the advice of Jeff Sessions.
[You might recall](http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/what-you-need-know-about-trump-comey-russia-probe-n757191)
that Comey is investigating the Trump campaign and administration for their ties to Russian agents, and Sessions had to recuse himself from any such investigations because of his own dealings with Russian agents. So the guy who was forced to remove himself from the situation has advised the president to fire the person who is investigating the situation.
Today, bizarrely,
[Trump is hosting Russian ambassadors Sergey Lavrov and Sergey Kislyak at the White House](https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2017/05/10/us/politics/ap-us-united-states-russia.html?_r=0)
. If nothing else, this looks really really bad. Is all this deliberate self-sabotage, tremendous incompetence, or boundless hubris?
Your task
Call
[your members of Congress](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members)
today. Right now.
And say:
I am beyond alarmed at the events of the last 24 hours or so regarding the firing of James Comey. Trump's rationale is patently false; it contradicts every word Trump has spoken about Comey and Clinton's emails ever. Jeff Sessions is inappropriately involved, and now
[Mitch McConnell is insisting that there is nothing to see here and let's move along](http://www.politico.com/story/2017/05/10/mcconnell-rejects-call-for-special-prosecutor-238206)
. Obviously there must be a fully independent thorough investigation into the whole matter.
[If your member of Congress is Republican:]Charles Krauthammer of the National Review calls the Comey firing "inexplicable" and completely destroys Trump's rationale.
[I can send you the link if you like](http://www.nationalreview.com/corner/447463/trump-fires-james-comey-krauthammer-calls-it-inexplicable-do-may)
. It just does not add up, given Trump's previous stances on Comey and Clinton and given the fact that the FBI is investigating the Russia ties. If the Republicans want to retain any credibility at all, they must immediately and genuinely work to resolve this Constitutional crisis by agreeing to an independent investigation and not meddling in it.
[If your Republican member of Congress repeats
[Trump's b.s.](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-comey-replacement-idUSKBN1861HK)
about how the Democrats derided Comey up til now:] Of course the Democrats felt his public handling of the Clinton emails was unfair. But Comey has been conducting a responsible investigation into the ties to Russia, and we are capable of differing analysis of two different issues. Aren't you?
ALSO:
There are
protests
happening
today
around the country regarding the Comey firing.
1) FIND your local Senate office
[here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Jv6jjobRX3298lAhEv78NzSAupSxfRO8gpLjrhlV1Es/edit#gid=897186940)
.
2) FIND your local FBI office
[here](https://www.fbi.gov/contact-us/field-offices)
.
3) SHOW UP at 5pm.
4) SPREAD THE WORD. If you can't go, maybe others who learn about it from you can.
Thank you, Five-Minutesers!

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Action Alliance is a collective of call-to-action websites, apps, and letters.
[Look](https://www.actionalliance.co/#members)
how many groups there are, in so many forms! Websites! Letters! Apps! It's incredible.
...so let's keep going
Do you remember a few years ago when
[Obama moved to reclassify the Internet](https://www.cnet.com/news/net-fix-title-ii-the-two-words-that-terrify-the-broadband-industry/)
under Title II of the FCC? This move assured protection an open and "neutral" Internet, where all sites may be accessed with equal ease. Public goods such as water and utilities are classified this way. The Republicans, serving their broadband-multinational overlords and hell-bent on their mission to obstruct everything Obama tried to do, fought mightily against this change, but failed.
Now, with Trump as president and an Ayn-Rand-Republican FCC head, the Republican Congress is gleefully
[taking an axe to net neutrality measures](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/05/business/dealbook/fcc-broadband-cable-trump.html)
. If you have 20 minutes, please watch
[this excellent newJohn Oliver segment on net neutrality in 2017](https://youtu.be/92vuuZt7wak)
and on what you can do to fight against threats to net neutrality. (Editorial side note: Oliver is so, so gifted at making technical/wonky issues clear and plain as day.)
Your tasks
First, go to
[the relevant proceedings on the FCC comment website](https://www.fcc.gov/ecfs/search/proceedings?q=name:((17-108)))
* and leave your comment asking the FCC to? preserve net neutrality and the Title II broadband FCC classification:
1.
[Go here.](https://www.fcc.gov/ecfs/search/proceedings?q=name:((17-108)))
2. Click "Express."
3. Complete the fields and leave your comment.
4. Tell everyone you know to do the same please!
Next, call your three members of Congress and say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is ________. I am calling to say I support net neutrality and I want the Internet to remain classified under Title II. This is very important to me. I am asking _______ to block any efforts to eliminate these net neutrality guarantees.
*This initiative, which the?Republican Congress calls "Restoring Internet Freedom," of course does the very opposite. The "freedom" granted would be the freedom for broadband companies like Verizon and Comcast to manipulate your use of the Internet by obstructing some sites in favor of others. By doing this, they can channel money to themselves and their partners? by making competitors' sites slower/more cumbersome/inaccessible, obliging you to only use the sites that they want you to use.

Among?the first things that happen?under authoritarian rule are the controlling of information and the silencing of dissenters. We saw examples of both this week:

[is investigating Stephen Colbert](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/05/arts/television/fcc-will-review-complaints-about-colbert-joke-chairman-says.html)
for a crude joke he made about Trump, which was bleeped out as is convention,?during his post-prime-time late-night program. To single Colbert out and threaten him in this way is an intimidation tactic, period.

. The request was complied with fully for a short period of time and then modified?half?the televisions now show CNN and the other half show Fox. In my book, that means?this intimidation tactic did work.
We are watching the manipulation and muzzling of free speech and freedom of expression. Period.

is also hell-bent on destroying net neutrality but that is a topic for another letter.)

Write the
[White House](http://whitehouse.gov/contact)
and?the FCC (cc?Ajit Pai, Chairman?Ajit.Pai@fcc.gov,?Mignon Clyburn, Commissioner

.
Say:
I am extremely concerned about the FDA's targeting of Stephen Colbert for insulting the president. This is what dictators do. I am extremely concerned about the letter to the FDA requesting they?turn all television channels to Fox. This is what dictators do.

And I am extremely concerned about the?Jeff Sessions-led?indictment of?Desiree Fairooz?for her perceived insult to Jeff Sessions. This is what dictators do.

The Trump administration's efforts to muzzle the First Amendment through silencing and intimidation?are?completely unAmerican and of grave concern.

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
I am choosing to see the health care mess as a good sign. It is inevitable that we will end up with single payer. There is no other viable choice. Trump, in his miserable unprincipled ignorance,
[said it himself, to Bernie Sanders' spontaneous?delight;](https://twitter.com/allinwithchris/status/860289930722811906)
Sanders?was quick to?assure?to Trump that his words?will never be?forgotten.
...so let's keep going
Yesterday
[Trump signed a misnamed?"religious liberty" order](http://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-39798989)
that allows people to discriminate against...anyone, really, so long as the discriminators?claim?it's because Jesus told them to. The people most vulnerable?under this law are LGBTQ people, Muslims and other "non-Christian looking" brown people, and?women. Part of the order allows companies to withhold insurance benefits for birth control. We. are. still. fighting. for. access. to. birth control. Another part of it loosens rules against?religious groups that do political activity.
Your task
Please call or email
[Trump](http://whitehouse.gov/contact)
,
[Pence](https://www.facebook.com/mikepence/)
[timesuck warning: I can't find a separate WhiteHouse.gov?contact for the VP, so this link is his Facebook page],?and your congresspeople:
I am writing/calling to say I am deeply disturbed by the misnamed "Executive Order on Promoting Free Speech and Religious Liberty." This is simply an allowance to discriminate, period. It is a sanctioned way for people to act with damaging prejudice in ways that hurt others who are doing nothing wrong. The damage is ?economic, social, health-related, and safety-related.
And/or please tweet Trump, Pence,?and your congresspeople (for Congress,?take out the Trump and Pence handles for space):
#Religiousliberty order a heinous assault on rights of women, gay people, non-Christians - a majority of our country.
@realdonaldtrump
@vp
#Religiousliberty order is a license to discriminate, will hurt ppl who've done nothing wrong. Shame! Shame! Shame!
@realdonaldtrump?@vp
History will not look kindly on the discriminatory and unconstitutional misnamed #religiousliberty order.
@realdonaldtrump @vp
Sources
https://twitter.com/allinwithchris/status/860289930722811906
www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-39798989
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 5, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon.
Today was hard to write. I just feel like giving up. But then I saw that there are?un-ignorable actions that simply have?to be done,?plus then I wrote the It's Working part, and so then I?deleted?the despairing remarks I had originally put in those sections, so here we are. With hope,?action, shared grief, and shared outrage. Solidarity.
It's working...
Though it really doesn't feel like it right now,
[here's](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/updates/can-lefts-grassroots-activists-curb-trumps-influence/)
an article about how strong we really are. We just need to stay focused and use the disappointments to make us stronger and savvier.
...so let's keep going
The health care vote in the House is not acceptable. The House reps need to hear deep anger and strong rebuke. They need to be held to account by their bosses, us. (There is a really great Twitter series on this I read last night that I can't find anymore to put down as a source!?I'll keep looking).
Your tasks
Task 1) Look?at
[this floor vote](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/05/04/us/politics/house-vote-republican-health-care-bill.html)
. If your rep voted AYE, say:
I am outraged and scared that the AHCA passed. This is a bad bill that will literally?bring poverty and sickness into the houses of millions and millions and millions of Americans. I am holding Representative _______ directly responsible for the passing of this cruel, counterproductive bill. I will never forget this.
If your rep is a?Republican and?voted NAY, say:
I am calling to thank ____ for his/her brave No vote on the health care vote.?I am outraged and scared that the AHCA passed. This is a bad bill that will literally?bring poverty and sickness into the houses of millions and millions and millions of Americans.??I am also calling to demand?that Representative _______ work as hard as possible to restore humanity to his/her colleagues. There is no excuse for inflicting a bill like this on American families.
If your rep is a Democrat (all voted Nay), say:
I am calling _____ to thank him/her for voting against
the Republicans' health care bill.?I am outraged and scared that the AHCA passed. This is a bad bill that will literally?bring poverty and sickness into the houses of millions and millions and millions of Americans.?I am also demanding that Representative _______ work with his/her colleagues to come up with PROACTIVE BILLS that counter the Republicans' many extreme measures. If the Democrats just wait for the Republicans to come up with things, of course they will eventually prevail, because they are in the majority. We MUST here progressive voices in the ring.
Task 2) Please be on the lookout for spontaneous rallies and protests tonight. Please attend.
May the 4th be with you.
(Re)Sources
Our inner resolve
Our capacity for taking the long view
www.pbs.org/newshour/updates/can-lefts-grassroots-activists-curb-trumps-influence/
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 4, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
This time by "It" I mean "common sense and basic reasoning skills." Looks like our Defense Secretary, James Mattis,
[acknowledges climate change](https://www.propublica.org/article/trumps-defense-secretary-cites-climate-change-national-security-challenge)
and the enormity of its effects, and has long advocated for reducing dependency on fossil fuels. From his lips to...every other administration and congressional officials' ears.
...so let's keep going
Our tasks have?been somewhat?repetitious the past week or two, but the health care thing is of primary importance right now, so it's with good reason. As of today, the?Republican leadership has thrown a bone to Republican moderates that might allow them to accept this unacceptable bill if they think their constituents aren't paying attention.
Please urge ALL?your people to call their reps.
Folks with Republican reps need to
demand a No vote on the AHCA
. People with Democratic reps need to reiterate that and also
demand alternative, Democrat-sponsored?bills
strengthening the ACA?so the Republicans are not allowed to continually be the only voice in the room on this subject. Thanks to
[Re:Act letter](http://mailchi.mp/reactletter/trumpcare-deportations-paris?e=02ce18aa8c)
for the first?script and informational links?below.
Your task
Email/post the following to
your friends and family with Repub reps
:]
The Republicans' ACA (Obamacare) replacement will leave millions of people with inadequate health care or no health care?at all. The people most affected will be children and the elderly.?The ACA needs to be modified so it will work better;
t
he answer is not to go back to a time when families go bankrupt and?people die because they don't have health care insurance
.?Check out
[this count of expected votes](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/05/01/us/politics/health-care-whip-count.html)
and see where your Republican rep stands. Then?call your Republican House?rep (number
[here](https://contactingcongress.org)
) and say:
?Hello, my name is [X] from [CITY]. I am urging [REPRESENTATIVE ] to oppose the updated version of the American Health Care Act, which does nothing to address coverage losses, and still puts people with pre-existing conditions at risk. The Upton Amendment doesn?t come close to solving the problem. I implore?[REPRESENTATIVE] to vote against, and publicly fight the updated bill.?
Email/post the following to
your
friends and family with Dem reps
:]
The Republicans'?ACA (Obamacare) replacement will leave millions of people with inadequate health care or no health care
at a
ll. The people most affected will be children and the elderly.?The ACA needs to be modified so it will work better; t
he answer is not to go back to a time when families go bankrupt and?people die because they don't have health care insurance.
But?the Democrats are not promoting any plan of their own. We need to hear the Democrats' ideas for advancing health coverage.?Please call your Democratic House rep (number
[here](https://contactingcongress.org)
) and say:
?Hello, my name is [X] from [CITY]. I am calling to thank?[REPRESENTATIVE] for?opposing?the updated version of the American Health Care Act. However, I am also calling to implore?[REPRESENTATIVE] and?his/her Democratic colleagues to make
their
voice heard loud and clear in the health care debate. It's not enough to just oppose the replacement bill, because if there are no alternative ideas, a Republican replacement will eventually prevail.?I know the Democrats are in the minority but
[they made a big difference?on the spending bill this week](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/daily-202/2017/05/01/daily-202-eight-ways-trump-got-rolled-in-his-first-budget-negotiation/590687f2e9b69b3a72331f09/?utm_term=.d9f257e67ae6)
despite being in the minority, so they can make a difference here too; plus, frankly, it's their job to find a way to represent the American people. Please ask [REPRESENTATIVE] to do more than simply oppose the AHCA, but to actually publicly and vocally promote ACA modifications and/or the single-payer bill, HR 676."
Then make the appropriate call yourself!
Thanks, Five-Minutesers. Onward!

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
[Calls?against the latest AHCA bill are working](http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/01/politics/republicans-continue-to-work-on-health-care/)
! Please keep calling and telling your congressperson you oppose the AHCA and support retaining the ACA, especially if you're in
[one of these districts](https://www.facebook.com/YourDailyAction/posts/427267124305274)
but really ALL of us need to,?and while you're on the phone urge your Dems to for godsake put something else in front of Congress and the American people so the AHCA doesn't keep resurfacing (
[see yesterday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-may-1-2017)
).
...so let's keep going
Trump has recently selected a prominent anti-choice activist,
[Charmaine Yoest](http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/trump-names-anti-abortion-leader-charmaine-yoest-high-post-hhs-n752836)
, as?assistant secretary of public affairs at the Department of Health and Human Services. He has also appointed
[Teresa Manning](http://www.newsweek.com/trump-contraception-abortion-family-planning-funding-592942)
,?a person who does. not. believe. in. contraception. to head Title X,?our country's only federal?family planning program, which targets?teen pregnancy.
Neither of these are elected positions. Trump has appointed them. They are in charge of our country's direction on family planning now.
Your task
Write (or phone) the
[White House](https://www.whitehouse.gov/contact)
,
[Tom Price](http://Secretary@HHS.gov)
at Health and Human Services, and all three of your congresspeople. Post your letter on your social media or forward it and ask others to email them too.?Script (delete the notes to you before sending):
I am deeply disturbed by President Trump's appointment of Charmain Yoest to HHS and Teresa Manning to Title X.
[add some or all of the following]
The decision to get?an abortion is between a person, her faith, and her family. One doesn't have to believe she or he would ever get an abortion to still support the notion that others might choose differently. People get abortions for all sorts of reasons;?to think a person is?not making a careful decision based on her personal circumstances is to disrespect her capacity for independent thought and her?right to self-determination.?It is a deeply?inappropriate decision to legislate.
Moreover, both Yoest and Manning's stance against birth control is completely counter to their stated goal of eliminating abortions. There is ample evidence from the U.S. and abroad that access to birth control reduces abortions. We can look at our own state of Colorado for their successful birth control programs,
[which have reduced teen?pregnancy,?reduced abortions, and saved taxpayer money all by startling margins](http://www.snopes.com/colorado-birth-control-facts/)
.
I strongly condemn both of these appointments and will fight every step of the way to retain access to reproductive rights, rights that safeguard opportunity and health for men, women, children, and entire families.
[Last paragraph replacement?for your congresspeople]:
I strongly condemn both of these appointments and expect _______ to fight every step of the way to retain access to reproductive rights, rights that safeguard opportunity and health for men, women, children, and entire families
.
Note
Check out my
[post](https://elainesir.com/our-next-100-days/)
, riffed off my letter to youse guys last Saturday, featured on ElaineSir.com.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: May 2, 2017

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
[A spending?bill will be passed](https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/congress-reaches-deal-to-keep-government-open-through-september/2017/04/30/5f58e9d2-2df7-11e7-9dec-764dc781686f_story.html)
that will allow the U.S. to have a budget until September does not take funding away from science or health agencies, does not have money for a wall, and does not have poison-pill riders that kill public health and environmental protections. What?! Maybe this only shows how low the bar has gone that?I am incredibly relieved there's nothing catastrophic in it, but this seems amazing.
...so let's keep going
Your call will be two-fold today.
First, r
emember how decisive the CBO (Congressional Budget Office) was on
[the last AHCA attempts](https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2017-03-23/latest-cbo-score-shows-ahca-would-lower-savings-still-not-expand-coverage)
? Their?assessments of the costs and numbers of people who were going to lose their health care were pretty important. They haven't had time to assess the most recent repeal attempt. Let's demand it.
Secondly, there is a fundamental problem with congressional Democrats' health care stance. Nature?and Congress?abhor?a vacuum (even if the Republican?Congress doesn't believe in science),?which means the Republicans keep hammering on?health care in part because the Democrats aren't.
We all know the ACA (Obamacare) really needs improvements. It's been a frustrating and challenging?ordeal for a lot of people. Well? Democrats? Where are your bills suggesting improvements?
There is a single-payer health care bill in Congress now,
[HR?676](https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/676/)
;?have you heard of it? I hadn't before yesterday.
Democrats and progressives have?allowed the Right to dominate the language and activities for reproductive choice, for school privatization, and for corporate tax loopholes, and?now we are?allowing them to dictate the direction of evolution of our?health care. WHY? Let's ask them.
Your task
Call your House rep and say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I am calling about the latest proposed replacement for the ACA. The
[Macarthur-Meadows amendment](http://www.nationalreview.com/corner/447062/american-health-care-act-new-amendment-gains-conservative-support)
appears to only make?the bill
more
hostile to regular Americans like me. Regardless, there should be
no
floor?vote until the Congressional Budget Office has a chance to review and?comment on the amended bill.
[If your rep is a Democrat,
say
]: We all know the ACA needs to be supported and strengthened. Why haven't the Democrats pushed HR?676, and/or come up with additional solutions for strengthening the ACA??It looks to me that the Democrats are giving the?Republicans the opportunity over and over to push?their?awful bills because the Democrats aren't asserting?anything different and?aren't communicating any new ideas?to their constituents. The voters?need something we can get behind and vocally support. What is _____ doing to push HR?676 and?offer fixes to the ACA?
Note: You can
check to
[see if your rep is?a cosponsor of H.R. 676](https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/676/cosponsors)
. If they are, all the more reason they should be pushing it.

NAME: Your  five-minute action item today: April 30, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
First - an error correction?- subscriber MA pointed out that in
[a recent letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-19-2017)
I mentioned Jon Ossoff in the?Virginia 6th district?race run-off. Nope - Georgia. My bad. Those soft-g's and old-school ladies' names just melded those states together in my typin' fingers.?Thanks, MA!
It's working
The Republican House?leadership has
[delayed its health care vote until next week](https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/house-republicans-introduce-one-week-spending-bill-to-continue-budget-talks/2017/04/27/5157abee-2b3a-11e7-b605-33413c691853_story.html)
. This means they are facing resistance; yay. (But it also means they will be working very hard all this weekend and next week to change "moderate" Republicans'?minds through hook or crook so they can get the thing passed. Apparently there is nothing?
nothing
?more important than destroying Obama's legacy. Hence...)
...let's keep going
I'm exhausted. Are you? I'm frustrated and disillusioned, too. The GOP coming back again and again and again on?health care tells me
[they will not stop, they just](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KeniFoiT-0)
[will never?stop](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KeniFoiT-0)
.?This would be fine if
[their version](http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/politics/wp/2017/04/27/this-amendment-could-revive-the-gop-effort-to-reform-health-care-here-is-its-potential-impact-explained/)
filled in the weaknesses of the ACA, but it does the opposite. This latest amendment,
[decried by the AMA](http://www.ama-assn.org/ama-urges-congress-oppose-amended-health-care-reform-bill)
,?allows states to waive safeguards for people with pre-existing conditions. You might recall in the past being a woman was considered a pre-existing condition; having a family member diagnosed with cancer was considered a pre-existing condition; having ever sought counseling was considered a pre-existing condition. You might recall being grilled on the phone by a stranger who would determine whether your need for health care precludes you from access to health care.
It just makes me so angry and sad. And scared.
The only thing to do is to vote these people out. Forever. Forever. What are these forces doing in the governance of a
[liberal democracy](http://cs.mcgill.ca/~rwest/wikispeedia/wpcd/wp/l/Liberal_democracy.htm)
in the contemporary world??We resist and do damage control until 2018,?and then, that November,?they need Out. Out. Out. But of course that requires laying the groundwork, starting now.
Your task
I hope you called your members of Congress, specifically your House Rep, and you implored your friends in "moderate" Republican districts to do the same. If you haven't,
[please do so](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-27-2017)
. Oh! Daily Action put all the names and phone numbers of the Republican swing votes.
[Here they are](https://www.facebook.com/YourDailyAction/posts/425189901179663)
(time-suck wormhole warning: this link takes you to?Facebook).
Otherwise, do one of the following today:
Go to
[Sister District](https://www.sisterdistrict.com)
or
[Swing Left](https://swingleft.org)
and be assigned a district that needs you (or find an already-formed group near you), even if you don't plan on volunteering. Just so you know about it.
Donate money to Sister District, Swing Left,
[Flippable](https://www.flippable.org)
, or
[Indivisible](https://www.indivisibleguide.com)
. I know, I ask you to donate every other week or so.?It's maddening that money changes things. Campaigns should all be part of a fixed budget provided to each candidate by the administration of the office being run for,?where everyone gets the same money and donations are strictly forbidden. It's disgusting, our system now. But Republicans vastly outspending Democrats in races, especially local races, is what has?fueled their takeover, despite their agenda being far from what people want.
Flippable (or Sister District or Swing Left) and?find one of their focus districts. Call the campaign office of the Democrat running and tell them you support them and you are grateful for them. That's it. No money!
Okay. Happy Friday, Five-Minutesers.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 28, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
People are getting really good at demonstrating in the streets!?There's another march this weekend - the
[Peoples' March for climate, jobs, and justice](https://peoplesclimate.org)
. There are sister marches around the country and the world. If you can't attend, you can donate at the link above.
...so let's keep going
Now, more than ever. It's crucial that
[this amended AHCA health care bill](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-healthcare-idUSKBN17T2H3)
not pass. As noted
[yesterday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-apr-26-2017)
, it retains all the awful ?things in the previous Republican "replacement" for the ACA?extremely high rates for older people, many millions losing their health care, and program funding that essentially amounts to an enormous?tax break for wealthy people?while
adding
the option for states to decline to protect?people with pre-existing conditions.
Why would they think this?even more cruel bill would pass? Because now that it won't guarantee basic health benefits to anyone,?the Freedom Caucus,?a faction of radically?conservative, ideologically ultra-rigid?tea-party?Republicans in Congress, will support it.
That means passage or not comes down to a handful of "moderate" (it's all relative) Republicans.
Call your reps. But also call your friends.
Your task
Please call your reps again and repeat the appropriate?script
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-apr-26-2017)
. Even if you called yesterday. Call again. And if you didn't call yesterday, now's your chance!
But also, please spread the word. We need a massive NO resounding across the country. Please?look at the list of reps in the
[photo below](http://pic.twitter.com/AgtciKBrrM)
.
If you think you might have a friend in one of these districts,?PLEASE ask them to call their rep?and?say:
I am asking Rep. _____ to vote NO on the replacement health care bill that is up for a vote this week. It cuts coverage and spikes costs to tens of millions of people just like the previous replacement bills, only this time it also guts coverage for preexisting conditions. Rep ____ and his/her colleagues need to FIX the ACA (Obamacare), NOT try and force it to fail and NOT replace it with something that will hurt and even kill tens of millions of people.
AND/OR,?if you have a friend in any of these states, regardless of district, please ask them to pass this action on to
their
friends.
A reminder: There are big problems with the ACA.
Congress has
a real opportunit
y, in theory,
to strengthen and improve the ACA?fix its problems?and shore up its grounding?but instead they are hoping it will cra
sh and burn.
The initiative needs care and safeguards, since it relies on private insurers, but
Trump has threatened outright to neglect the ACA until it "
[explodes](http://www.latimes.com/business/hiltzik/la-fi-hiltzik-obamacare-next-step-20170327-story.html)
," and?there is nothing the Congressional Republicans would like better. But neglecting the ACA to death?will massively screw over scores of millions of people. It is just incredible to me that Congress's spite is so deep that that is all right with them.
Your call should include a "Fix what we have" component as well as a "Hell No, MacArthur Amendment" component. I don't think I put this in the scripts yesterday, but you can borrow from the last sentence in the script above.

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
You called on
[Monday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-24-2017)
to tell your congressfolk?Absolutely Not to Trump's threats to critically weaken the ACA and shut down the government unless the upcoming budget bill includes his wall. And
[Trump pulled back!](http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/congress-scrambling-fund-government-ahead-friday-deadline-n750401)
Any discussion of his wall is tabled til fall. Good job!
...so let's keep going
Trump's 100th day?in office is coming up Saturday. He got Gorsuch,?rolled back a bunch of Obama rules designed to protect workers and?children (
why???
),?terrorized undocumented people, and rattled war sabers,?but he has been
[unable to get major initiatives based on his campaign promises passed](http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2017/apr/24/donald-trump/how-do-donald-trumps-first-100-days-rate-historica/)
?health care, Muslim bans, his wall, tax reform?and he has had difficulty putting together a functional?administration. He is desperate for a win, and for some reason has picked health care (
["Nobody?knew it could be so complicated!"](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/video/2017/feb/27/trump-healthcare-complicated-budget-video)
) as his quick fix this week.
The Republicans are introducing
[a new amendment to the AHCA](http://www.politico.com/f/?id=0000015b-a790-d120-addb-f7dc0ec90000)
(that's what the?replacement for the ACA/Obamacare is called) in an effort to pass it this week.?It retains all the features of the first two plus also
[takes away protections for people with pre-existing conditions](http://www.vox.com/2017/4/25/15429982/gop-exemption-ahca-amendment)
. This is a bid to win over the tea party Republicans (Freedom Caucus) for whom the first two versions
[weren't draconian enough](http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/03/20/us/politics/health-care-whip-count.html)
.
This bill must be stopped.?There is a definite chance it could pass now
with the Freedom Caucus on board.
There isn't an official record of how your member of Congress was planning to vote the previous times because a vote wasn't called. Democrats are on record for saying No, but please keep up the pressure if you have a Democratic rep. Republicans are a mixed bag: Some moderate Republicans said No because the bill was?awful and some said No because it wasn't awful enough. Please take a look at

if you have a Republican representative so you can choose the best?script below.

even cruel
er and less feasible than the first two. It makes no sense at all to reduce access to health care for?people with pre-existing conditions.?Please ask Rep. _____ to explain to Paul Ryan, since he doesn't seem to understand, how insurance works: It's a pool with everyone in it. Thank you.
[Rank-and-file Republicans who supported t
he AHCA last time(s)
:]
Hello, my name is ______ and my zip is ______. I am calling to remind Rep. _____ how incredibly unpopular the replacements for the?ACA have?been and
demand that Rep. _____ reject this latest version. I can provide
[a simple explanation for how insurance works](http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/news/2013/11/why-a-childless-man-should-have-to-buy-maternity-coverage/index.htm)
if that would be helpful for Rep. ____ and Paul Ryan, since they don't seem to understand.
It's a pool with everyone in it. [Share an ACA story if you have one.]
I am demanding that my representative?vote No and I and all of my voting friends and family are paying attention.
[Moderate Republicans who did not support the AHCA:]
Hello, my name is ______ and my zip is ______. I am calling to remind Rep. _____ how incredibly unpopular the replacements for the ACA have been and?ask that (s)he?reject this latest version. This version is
even cruel
er and less feasible than the first two. It makes no sense at all to reduce access to health care for?people with pre-existing conditions.?Please ask Rep. _____ to explain to Paul Ryan, since he doesn't seem to understand, how insurance works: It's a pool with everyone in it. [Share an ACA story if you have one.] Thank you.
[Tea-party/Freedom Caucus Republicans:]
Hello, my name is ______ and my zip is ______. I am calling to remind Rep. _____ how incredibly unpopular the replacements for the?ACA have?been and?demand that (s)he reject this latest version. Why does Rep. _____?not want me and my family to have health care? Healthy people are?a basic building block of a healthy economy.?I can provide
[a simple explanation for how insurance works](http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/news/2013/11/why-a-childless-man-should-have-to-buy-maternity-coverage/index.htm)
if that would be helpful for Rep. ____ and Paul Ryan, since they don't seem?to understand.?It's a pool with everyone in it. There is no way around the fact that it is public good and that the need exists.?[Share an ACA story if you have one.]
I am demanding Rep. _____ vote No and I and all of my voting friends and family are paying attention.

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Some Republicans, at least, are recognizing?that aggressive and unethical?consolidation of Republican power will harm our democracy.
[A Republican?judge in North Carolina?retired early](http://www.charlotteobserver.com/news/politics-government/article146498979.html)
so as to mitigate a?power play on the part of the Republican legislature intended to?weaken the newly elected Democratic governor.
...so let's keep going
Today's task thanks to
[EarthJustice](https://secure.earthjustice.org/site/SPageNavigator/170425_Action_Riders_CallIn)
. The Republican Congress is aiming to pass a number of damaging anti-environmental?measures by including them as "riders" on must-pass bills?hangers-on that have nothing to do with the main bill?but that get passed into law along with it,?without having been?subject to any scrutiny. This is sneaky and wrong.?We deserve transparency from our elected officials, and we are right to demand?that they prioritize basic safeguards for?a healthy environment.
Your task
Call your members of Congress.
EarthJustice has a script
[here](https://secure.earthjustice.org/site/SPageNavigator/170425_Action_Riders_CallIn?utm_content=ResponsiveFooterLink&utm_source=crm)
, o
r?use mine:
My name is _____ and my zip code is ______. Right now?there are 148 riders on various appropriation bills?that, if turned into law, will badly damage basic environmental and public-health?protections. I?am calling to ask ______ to reject ANY spending bills or other legislation?that have such riders on them. We need healthy people to be a strong country! We need a healthy environment to have healthy people. And we the voters deserve transparency. Using riders to pass unpopular measures is sneaky and wrong.?Please let _____ know that (s)he must reject appropriations bills containing riders that weaken environmental safeguards. Thank you.

You know when the chemists ("We are part of the solution")?and the historians ("Because we know what the Dark Ages were like")?are carrying signs and marching, it is a mass movement. Yesterday's

and

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 23, 3017

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
[Exxon-Mobile was denied its request for a waiver](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/21/business/energy-environment/treasury-exxon-mobil-sanctions-waiver.html)
on U.S. sanctions against Russia so it could drill in the Black Sea.
Secretary of State Rex Tillerson contracted with Russia for the drilling in the first place in 2014 when he was the CEO of Exxon Mobile.
There are a lot of reasons their bid was rejected, to be sure, but people-led scrutiny of the Trump administration's relationship with Russia and
[people-led pressure on congressfolk for transparency](http://www.cnbc.com/2017/04/21/white-house-refuses-to-give-exxonmobil-special-waiver-to-drill-in-sanctioned-russia.html)
definitely helped.
This outcome shows the value of contacting our elected officials about Dow Chemical's request, as outlined in
[yesterday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-21-2017)
(even if the situation is different, since
Congress seems to care a lot more about national security than about people's health)
. So if you haven't done that action, go for it!
...so let's keep going
Today is Earth Day! And it's March for Science Day!
Heaven and Earth know we've never needed Earth Day more than we do this year. And the March for Science appears to be going strong and that is so exciting! See
[Thursday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-20-2017)
for more information about the march and ideas. Read
[this article](https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/the-march-for-science-is-just-the-first-step/)
for an interview with one of the organizers to learn more.
Your task
1) Tweet about the March or post on other social media:
#MarchForScience today - all around the world!
Our children need science as much as we do!?#MarchForScience
The world would be unrecognizable without science. That is why I #MarchForScience
Nearly everything I and my family do, from morning til night, is because of science. That is why I #MarchForScience
Love the world - love science?#MarchForScience
Love humanity - love science?#MarchForScience
Love not dying from a cut on your finger? Love science! #MarchForScience
Love having food in winter? Love science! #MarchForScience
Love refrigeration? Love science!?#MarchForScience
Love using the Internet? Love science!
#MarchForScience
Love your phone? Love science!?#MarchForScience
[I mean one could go on forever with those]
We have the freedoms we do because scientists have the freedom to research.?#MarchForScience
There is a reason life was short and miserable in the Dark Ages. Love science.?#MarchForScience
Now add a link to your tweet:
https://www.marchforscience.com
[your local march's url]
http://www.livescience.com/58767-2017-march-for-science-news.html
<--live updates!
Hashtag the march closest to you as well as/instead of the general tag.
[Here](https://www.marchforscience.com/satellite-marches/)
's a list of all of the marches but to find the tag most people are using just search "science march [city or state]" (no quotes) and see what comes up.
Note
It's Earth Day. Consider reviewing your earth-friendly policies in your own life.
[Here's](http://www.conserve-energy-future.com/151-ways-to-save-energy.php)
a list of actions small and large for reducing energy use (thanks
[My Civic Workout](http://mailchi.mp/mycivicworkout/lean-green-resisting-machine?e=732111aa91)
for the link).
[Here's](http://www.earthday.org/take-action/)
a collection of lifestyle and habit changes that will help Earth as we know it.
Enjoy the day!

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Finally, Democrats, progressives, and just-plain-not-extreme people are finding their voice. Remember that guy who shouted You Lie at Obama in a joint session of Congree? Joe Wilson, South Carolina Republican?That was among the first in what would be many, many dirty stabs of disrespect toward Obama on the part of the Republicans. I've never forgotten it. Apparently, neither have his constituents.
[At a recent town hall they drowned him out with chants of "You lie."](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/11/us/politics/joe-wilson-you-lie-obama-town-hall.html?smid=fb-nytimes&smtyp=cur&_r=0)
He was also booed throughout his town hall for his, well, lies, about how overturning health care and?supporting right-to-work measures would be good for constituents.
Yay for people finding their voice and fighting back against their elected officials'?unacceptable actions!
...so let's keep going
[Dow Chemical?wrote?letters to three Trump cabinet heads asking them to ignore scientific findings](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/pesticide-maker-tries-kill-risk-study/)
showing that a family of widely used pesticides harms critically threatened or endangered species. Dow Chemical underwrote Trump's inauguration with?a million-dollar check, and the chair and CEO is a close advisor of Trump. The studies amount to 10,000 pages of unequivocal evidence.
[This article](https://www.apnews.com/a29073ecef9b4841b2e6cca07202bb67)
has links to the letters themselves.
The agencies are the EPA (Scott Pruitt), Interior (Ryan Zinke), and Commerce (Wilbut Ross).
Scott Pruitt
[declined a ban on chlorpyrifos](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2017/03/29/trump-epa-declines-to-ban-pesticide-that-obama-had-proposed-outlawing/?utm_term=.b651ce1f7784)
,?which harm children's brains when they are exposed to even small amounts, earlier this spring.
Your task
Call, tweet, or write some combination of your members of Congress, the department heads, and/or members of the various committees in Congress who Dow cc'd on the letters.
For your members of Congress, say:

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 21, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello!
It's working...
The
[March for Science](http://www.accuweather.com/en/weather-news/march-for-science-nearly-500-communities-across-the-globe-will-partake-in-earth-day-rallies/70001358)
is coming up this Saturday and I cannot TELL you how excited I am for the signs. Science jokes are near the top of my list when it comes to?forms of humor. But I am also excited because
[masses of people are rising up against a political?culture of hostile?ignorance](https://www.bustle.com/p/30-funny-march-for-science-sign-ideas-51675)
that seeks to suppress science research and practice?masses of
scientists
are rising up. This is not a group known?for being politically riled.?Wouldn't it be amazing if this political era resulted in
stronger
scientific integrity?
Leave it to scientists to be brilliant about capturing results and establishing concrete next steps.?DC is having a next-steps forum the following day.?In Chicago, organizers have put together an expo at the march's endpoint,?so marchers can march right up to different tables to learn how they, too,?can?support and participate?in?scientific efforts around Chicagoland.
[What events are happening aroundyourarea's march](http://www.marchforscience.com/satellite-marches/)
?
...so let's keep going
It is absolutely okay to attend the march if you are not a scientist.
Are you glad scientists and the scientific method made such things possible
as?ice cream, long-distance trips,?weather reports, clean water, the Internet, music, and freedom from a huge array of deadly diseases? Then?you are welcome to attend.
Whether or not you plan to?attend, there are some simple five-minute things you can do today.
Your tasks
There are
[400](http://www.marchforscience.com/satellite-marches/)
[Marches for Science](https://www.marchforscience.com/satellite-marches/)
[all over theworld](http://www.marchforscience.com/satellite-marches/)
. Find the one closest to you and check out what it's all about by going to its website/Facebook page. Share the page with your social or email network.
Take a look at the
[March for Science pledge](https://www.marchforscience.com/marcher-pledge/)
(even if you are not marching).?Think about how you?can incorporate the items in the pledge?into your actions and words. Post the pledge to social media or email and invite friends to join you in taking the pledge.
[Donate money](https://www.marchforscience.com/donate)
. Help defray costs for the amazing volunteers who put this worldwide phenomenon together.
[Buy merch](https://www.marchforscience.com/store/)
. Wear your support while helping defray?costs.
THANKS, FIVE-MINUTESERS!
