NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 20, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
Did you make your calls from yesterday? If not,
[do it now](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-18-2017)
. We'll wait for you!
It's working...
I can't really claim this?overwhelmingly positive news, but
[Democrat Jon Ossoff forced a run-off](http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/national/article145331159.html)
in the Virginia 6th District special election. This isn't super awesome because?Democrats poured a ton of money and attention into this run and the Republican vote was split;?an outright victory looked very achievable. Nevertheless, a run-off is better than a Republican victory.
...so let's keep going
Trump Secretary of Education?Betsy DeVos recently
[rescinded two Obama-era laws that helped?students avoid defaulting on?their student loans](http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/betsy-devos-rolls-back-obama-era-student-loan-guidance-n745701)
. There is literally no good reason for this. The rationale?was about saving taxpayers money...it does not save taxpayers money to have people default on their loans.
She is a huge school-"choice" (school privatization) advocate. Charter schools, online schools, vouchers allowing students to go to private schools,?and similar programs are punctures?draining our?public school system, which is?already terribly?weakened by a refusal to acknowledge and address socioeconomic inequities, the follies of massive testing, and the continued devaluing?of teachers. There is
[no evidence](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/answer-sheet/wp/2017/02/27/devos-favors-private-school-vouchers-but-new-study-says-they-dont-offer-real-edge-over-public-schools/?utm_term=.8ed5ef276f6c)
that privatized school options benefit students.?Public schools are the backbone of our society, and
[market forces such as privatization?options will ravage them](https://www.theatlantic.com/education/archive/2017/04/is-school-choice-really-a-form-of-freedom/523089/)
.
Anyway, DeVos and the privatization?movement
[must be stopped](https://networkforpubliceducation.org/9121-2/?link_id=3&can_id=5d9ef3e02d7616fc44cc4e38ae26086e&source=email-congress-is-on-recess-a-great-time-for-your-rep-to-get-schooled&email_referrer=congress-is-on-recess-a-great-time-for-your-rep-to-get-schooled&email_subject=congress-is-on-recess-a-great-time-for-your-rep-to-get-schooled)
. It is an experiment that will yield even greater societal inequities and it will absolutely lower the schooling experience for huge numbers of students. When the bottom line is dollars, there is basically no incentive to provide anything more than the basics, to individualize or enrich instruction, to ensure anything more than the required minimum. There is every incentive to cut corners. Schools are also places needing maintenance, places that feed hundreds of kids, centers of community. All of these things, as well as, of course, the classroom instruction and atmosphere,?will suffer as we move our education system from one valuing public access to one valuing profit. Thanks to
[this action-items?site](https://www.solidaritysundays.org/action/)
for some of the language in today's script.
Your task
Call Secretary DeVos at?1-202-401-3000. Call your members of Congress as well. Say:
My name is ______ ?and I'm calling from ______.?I'm calling because I am concerned about the rollback in the student-loan regulations. Our country is?alone among?our peers in how we?saddle our young adults with huge loans in the first place; the very least we could do is provide education and support to help them pay it off. ?I am also very concerned about this administration's enthusiasm for?school privatization measures such as charters, vouchers, and other market-driven?programs. Schools should simply not be places to experiment with?market forces. The
only
bottom line?should be children's education and development. Secretary DeVos and others who support this supposed school "choice" are killing our public schools rather than giving them the help they need. Public schooling is?a backbone of our democracy and a vehicle for the American dream we all cherish.
Please pass my comments along to ______.
Sources
http://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/national/article145331159.html
http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/betsy-devos-rolls-back-obama-era-student-loan-guidance-n745701
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/answer-sheet/wp/2017/02/27/devos-favors-private-school-vouchers-but-new-study-says-they-dont-offer-real-edge-over-public-schools/
https://www.theatlantic.com/education/archive/2017/04/is-school-choice-really-a-form-of-freedom/523089/

[Wait for an answer.] I would like an answer [Wait for rationale or dodge.]?Please take my contact information. I would like to hear ______'s response to this corruption and some concrete steps (s)he will take. Thank you. [Leave your contact information.]
A note

Today is the

And if you can't attend a march (or even if you ?can),?post about one in your area or about some big ones around the country on social media, to spread the word.
But wait! There's another?concrete action to do today.?Trump wants to know what we think of his executive order to investigate and "reorganize" every single agency in the country. Let's tell him.
Your task
Go
[here](https://www.whitehouse.gov/reorganizing-the-executive-branch)
and fill out his survey. I mean, he asked.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 15, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Californians, sick of this stupid dithering with people's basic health needs and galvanized by our disastrous political situation, are working to
[form a single-payer health care plan](https://ww2.kqed.org/stateofhealth/2017/04/12/while-washington-fiddles-california-leaders-forge-ideas-for-universal-health-care/)
. Rock on, Cali.
...so let's keep going
I'm won't comment on the weird and scary saber-rattling with North Korea right now, until I have something cogent to say. Instead let's riff off
[Indivisible Chicago's action item](https://www.indivisiblechicago.com/take-action-1/2017/4/11/tuesday-april-11th-jeff-sessions-ends-forensic-science-commission-senator-duckworth-town-hall)
on some unsurprising but frustrating steps Attorney General Jeff Sessions is taking:
Jeff Sessions is moving to end the National Commission on Forensic Science, a panel of about 30 independent forensic scientists enlisted by former President Obama to raise forensic standards. They will be replacing this with an internal department crime task force.?Investigating improving forensic science, a science that can tip the scale of justice, should continue to be independent, and not controlled by those looking to prosecute.
Your task
Call your senators and house rep. Say:
Hi, my name is _____ and my zip code is ?_____. I'm calling to ask _____ to speak out of the elimination of the National Commission on Forensic Science by Attorney General Sessions. Having an independent view of forensic science is an integral part of protecting people from wrongful prosecution. Already many convictions have been overturned because it was proven that an innocent person had been languishing in jail?sometimes for decades. There is no legitimate reason for turning back the clock on this progress in criminal justice.

NAME: Your five-minute action today: April 14, 2017

DESCRIPTION:
Good mornafternoon!
It's working...
And by "it," this time, I mean journalism:?persistent, fearless pursuit of the truth. A small-town newspaper editor in Iowa won the Pulitzer for doggedly exposing the greed and hypocrisy that was earning tons of money and influence for some and hurting the health and economy of most.
[Check it out](http://www.poynter.org/2017/tiny-family-run-newspaper-wins-pulitzer-prize-for-taking-on-big-business/455465/)
.
...so let's keep going
April 15 is Tax Day, and we are still?waiting for Donald Trump to release his taxes. He said he would and then didn't; he said the American people don't care but we do. We care that he is flouting a courtesy extended by presidential candidates for generations, we care that?he said he'd do it and then dodged it, we care that he seems prone to?kleptocratic?interests. House Republicans
[have blocked two more recent attempts](http://fortune.com/2017/03/28/donald-trump-taxes-tax-returns/)
on the part of the Democrats to acquire Trump's taxes.
Your tasks
First,
[find a tax march in your area](http://taxmarch.org/local-marches/)
and try to?make a point to go Saturday. Numbers are important. Bring your friends and family. If you can't go, post about it on social media, including the time?and location, to make it?easy for others to go. Examples:
--Tax march this Saturday! Show Trump how much his lack of transparency bothers us. [location and time info]
--Trump thinks the American people don't care about his taxes. He's wrong - tell him so. [location time and info]
Secondly, call your House rep and your senators. Say:
[If Republican]:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _________.
I am disappointed that once again the Republicans in the House have refused to require that?President Trump provide his taxes. Trump is refusing?a simple courtesy to the American people that?every?president has offered for generations. Why are the Republicans okay with this? We will not forget. He went back on a promise and the Republicans are enabling and excusing it.
[If Democratic]: My name is ______ and my zip code is _________.
I am disappointed that once again the Republican House has?refused to oblige President Trump to provide his taxes. Trump is refusing
a simple courtesy to the American people that?every?president has offered for generations. I am asking ______ to find other ways to keep this issue alive and require Trump to follow?through on his promise. We will not forget. He went back on a promise and the Republicans are enabling and excusing it. We are relying on you to hold the president and your Republican colleagues accountable.
THIRDLY,?remember you bought all those postcards a while ago? No? Rule of thumb for These Times: always have postcards available. Some time Saturday or before, throw one in the mail to Trump. Include your name and ideally?your full address, but if you don't want to do that just put your zip code. Write anything along the lines of?"The American people are still waiting for your tax returns. You promised!" Rainy spring-break day? Perfect kids' activity!?Here's the address:
Donald J. Trump,?1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW,?Washington DC 20500.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 12, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Last night, all over the U.S. Jewish families got together to observe Passover, a holiday that, through symbolic foods at a big meal, retells the story of how the Jews?found a new home after?fleeing Egypt as refugees. There are always modern-day parallels to the details and the messages of the stories told around the table. But Trump and Syria have really shined a light on the relevance of?the Passover story, and this year, families all over the country incorporated modern-day refugees' stories into their Passover seder with
[this guide](https://www.hias.org/passover2017)
and others like it. Some families do this every year; but this year,?it is likely that many more did. (The linked resource?also provides resources for helping refugees; consider downloading it and checking out what you can do.)
...so let's keep going
So
[about Syria](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/04/world/middleeast/syria-gas-attack.html)
. I frankly find the events of last week in Khan Sheikhoun, outside Damascus,?completely baffling. The atrocities being committed by Assad are unfathomable in the first place. Then?the
[airfield bombing Trump?authorized](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/07/us/politics/syria-strike-trump-timeline.html)
, suddenly, was?counter to any stance he's had in the past. And then said bombing
[seemed to have done basically no damage](http://abcnews.go.com/US/syrian-jets-off-air-base-hit-us/story?id=46646770)
. Now Tillerson is going to Russia to try to
[convince Putin to stop supporting Assad](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/11/world/europe/russia-syria-rex-tillerson.html?ribbon-ad-idx=3&rref=politics&module=Ribbon&version=context?ion=Header&action=click&contentCollection=Politics&pgtype=article)
and to join the U.S. in "fighting Isis," which is a 100% different goal from disciplining or pressuring Assad, and which efforts were in fact
[reduced to make way for resources to?attack?this airfield](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/08/us/politics/us-islamic-state-syria.html)
.
I don't know where to begin making sense of this, and I'm not going to try.
What I'm going to focus on is this: Trump said some oddly uncharacteristic, religion-y?stuff about how he is bombing the base because
[children of?God](http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/04/08/syrian-warplanes-take-air-base-bombed-us-tomahawks/)
[suffered and died](http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/04/10/donald-trumps-action-syria-proves-not-league-putin-says-son/)
in this gas attack. He seems to have been shaken by the horrific images (has he not been following the news out of Syria and elsewhere? Oh, that's right - no he hasn't).?Yet his refugee policies remain cruel and uncompromising.?If you care about the welfare of children in a war zone, do not explicitly and loudly and internationally proclaim "
[We don't want them here](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/acts-of-faith/wp/2017/01/27/we-dont-want-them-there-trump-signs-order-limiting-refugee-entry/)
."
Your task
Call your members of Congress?and say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is ______. I'm calling to ask _______'s position on President Trump's refugee policy in light of the recent gas attacks in Syria that killed 100 or more?Syrian civilians, including many children.
[Rep does/does not?support Trump's policy:]
Thank you OR?I'm very disappointed to hear that. The recent sarin gas attack?on innocent Syrian citizens shows how urgently they need refuge. If President Trump is going to claim he cares about those babies who died in that attack, he MUST change his openly and aggressively anti-refugee policies.
[(S)he doesn't have a position/I don't know his/her position:]
I'm disappointed to hear that OR?Does anyone there know? I'll wait...No? I would like to hear a public statement.
T
he recent sarin gas attack?on innocent Syrian citizens shows how urgently they need refuge. If President Trump is going to claim he cares about those babies who died in that attack, he MUST change his openly and aggressively anti-refugee policies.
[If you are Jewish, riff off this:] This week is Passover. Every year at this time, my family marks our ancestors' condition as refugees who had to?flee?from suffering and death. The Passover story is about the Jews' flight from Egypt, but?it is a story that has been repeated over and over?in Jewish history.?Jewish people have had to flee every corner of the world at some point?and?I am here alive today because someone took us in, over and over. As a Jewish person who is safe and whose family is safe in our wonderful country, I remember and honor the imperative to shield and protect strangers, and I urge ______, his/her colleagues, and President Trump to do the same People fleeing war or?persecution need refuge. History does not look kindly on nations that refuse to help desperate peoples.
here, you can tweet
@realDonaldTrump,?@SpeakerRyan, and
@SenateMajLdr too:
If you care about babies being gassed in #Syria, give them a safe place to go. Let them in. #lovethestrangerasyourself
Sources

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 11, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Thanks for the response to my letter yesterday in notes and subscribes.?I am glad
plenty of people are taking action despite the slog of fighting a lot of frustrating and scary things, every day. Go team!
It's working...
The next two weeks are "spring recess"?members of Congress are supposedly in their home districts, supposedly bonding with their constituents. So many sources?are helping to prepare We the People for engaging knowledgeably and effectively with our Congressfolk (or holding them accountable if they refuse to meet with their constituents).
[Organizers](http://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources/recess/)
,
[activists](http://act.moveon.org/survey/readytoresist9/)
, and
[subject-matter experts](http://www.commondreams.org/news/2017/04/07/congress-goes-recess-resistance-movement-gears-round-two)
are offering everything they know.
...so let's keep going
Let's connect today's task to the "It's working" segment.?It's April recess for our members of Congress, and they are supposedly at home communing with their constituents.?Are yours?
Your task
Find out if your elected officials are having townhalls
[here](https://townhallproject.com)
,?and find out what your community members are doing to meet with their members of Congress
[here](https://www.resistancerecess.com/event/resistance-aprilrecess/search/)
and
[here](https://www.resistancecalendar.org)
. These are populated with user-contributed data so if you know about something that is not on these calendars, go ahead and add it.
If a member of Congress of yours is NOT listed on the Town Hall resource above, call a home-state office. Say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to see if ______ is having a town hall in the next couple weeks, during spring recess.
If No, say: That is disappointing. There are a lot of really important things going on right now and it's essential we are able to talk with our elected representative. Might _____ reconsider and hold a town hall? [after the response]
Thank you. I'll let everyone I know that unfortunately we won't have the chance to hear or speak with ______.
If yes, say: That's great. When and where is it? Thank you for the information. I'll pass it on to everyone I know.
And then do. Pass it on to everyone you know.
Shoot anyone who IS having a town hall a note on Facebook, Twitter, or webform, or phone them, to thank them. Note the dates and locations on your calendar. Even if you know you can't go. Simple awareness is a good and needed step.
It's OK if you're not planning on going. Pass along what you learn about your Congressfolks' schedules, one way or the other.
If you can go, fan-freakin-tastic. Look at the sources below for good information on this recess's issues.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!
Sources
https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources/recess/
https://act.moveon.org/survey/readytoresist9/

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 10, 2017

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
I see fewer opens and?fewer new subscribes, and a slight uptick in?unsubscribes. That is totally all good; the letter is?here to help, and if the letter isn't helping, it doesn't need to be in one's inbox.?I'm going to posit, I'm just going to posit, that the reason for the reduced engagement is that?people have found other methods of robust?civic participation and are spending their time there:
People might be focusing on work with a community organization, such as Indivisible, the local chapter of the Sierra Club, the League of Women Voters,?or their own representatives'/candidates' campaigns.
People might be focusing on?organizations that help bring resources to weak-blue or weak-red (for challenges) districts, such as Flippable, Swing Left, Sister District, or Code Blue.
People might be another small-action website?or letter, such as daily action, or getting action alerts from Here to Stay, Planned Parenthood, or others.
People might be running for office!!! :) Do you know anyone running for office who never would have thought about it before the election? Let me know.
I hope it's true! What I hope is not happening is that people are getting used to how things are, or feeling like their actions aren't?mattering?and giving up.?I confess I've certainly felt that way. This spring has been challenging and busy for me in the way Life makes things challenging and busy sometimes, mostly work related, and?it has made?it awfully hard to care about other things when my vision and focus has been telescoped?to mostly a single distance point. I don't do my own actions every day (though I usually do them eventually).?But I am continuing to write and act?because, if a mass of us does,?when we look back, we will see we?have not only made a difference on individual issues, but we will have changed the dynamics of our very democracy: more progressive participation on all levels, greater responsiveness on the part of the elected people, more support for journalism and entities that protect our rights, greater awareness of our civic duties and rights?and the different those make.
So let's keep going
Today, do something you haven't yet?done this week.
Your task
To contact your members of Congress about the series of assaults launched on our environment, click

.

[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-5-2017)
.
To donate money to an organization that trains and supports progressive people in running for office, click
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-6-2017)
.
To thank the "Alt_U.S.Agency" type Twitter?accounts that are keeping the truth going despite gag orders and ignorance rendering their official counterpart less effective,?and to thank Twitter and the ACLU when the administration tried to strong-arm Twitter into giving them information about a private individual or group?who criticized Trump,?click
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-6-2017)
.
To support a democrat in Kansas who is making a surprisingly strong showing in a deep-red district for a special election happening TUESDAY (very soon!), click
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-april-7-2017-1)

Devin Nunes, a strong Trump supporter?who headed the House Intelligence Committee and who made some questionable moves in this position regarding his ability to?fairly investigate Trump's Russia ties,

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 7, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
I'm going to return to yesterday's example of?how successful the Democrats were in races?this week?in traditionally Republican places here in Chicagoland, because now I have a comprehensive list.
[Look](http://ildcca.org/2017/04/proft-rauners-millions-democrats-make-historic-gains/)
at this list of wins!
So let's keep going
Unsurprisingly, Mitch McConnell trashed the Supreme Court nomination?filibuster in order to ensure that he will get his way, and all the Republicans went along with it?
[even the ones that thought it was a horrible idea](https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/mcconnell-nuclear-option-helps-senate-mccain-whoever-says-that-is-a-stupid-idiot/2017/04/05/d9d73aec-1a1a-11e7-9887-1a5314b56a08_story.html?utm_term=.82f42323afb8)
. I guess this is why the GOP wins?they vote as one, like
[the Borg](http://www.startrek.com/database_article/borg)
(and without regard for where their collective drift is taking them and those around them on their?nightmarish singular quest, also like the Borg...). The
[exceedingly conservative?Gorsuch](http://www.npr.org/2017/03/16/519501771/judge-gorsuchs-writings-signal-he-would-be-a-conservative-on-social-issues)
is headed to the Supreme Court, in a seat that
[should have been Merrick Garland's](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/06/us/politics/neil-gorsuch-supreme-court-senate.html)
a year ago.
The best thing to do is to run a whole bunch of progressive people and dominate all the elections to come such that the House and Senate, over time, will wash Mitch McConnell and his ilk?right away?into a sea of blue.
Your task
Pick a place that cultivates progressive people running for office and give money to it. Even $5. Yes, you'll get on their email list. Just unsubscribe if you don't want to hear from them.
[She Should Run](http://www.sheshouldrun.org/)
supports progressive women interested in running for office. So do a bunch of other organizations.
[Run for Something](https://www.runforsomething.net/)
supports progressive millennials interested in running for office.
[314 Action](http://www.314action.org/home/)
supports scientists and others with STEM backgrounds?interested in?running, as a way to combat the assault on climate change science and other science.
The
[Victory Fund](https://victoryinstitute.org/trainings/candidate-campaign-trainings/)
helps LGBTQ candidates.
The
[New American Leaders Project](http://newamericanleaders.org/programs_training.html)
helps immigrants run.
The
[Progressive Change Campaign Committee](http://boldprogressives.org)
supports and counsels progressives of any?demographic
interested in running, as do various other places.
And so on.?There are more listed in this article and on this page
[here](http://www.pantsuitresources.com/run-for-office.html)
(scroll down past the WA state stuff?unless you live there of course!).
(Anyone have a lead on an organization that supports people of color interested in running?)
Pick a place and donate a little bit. Every little bit counts.
Sources

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 6, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
Here in Chicagoland, we had elections in our local suburban districts yesterday. Many Republicans in traditionally Republican districts?ran unopposed, because the deadline for entering the race closed soon after the election, while progressives were still reeling; and there were many cases where the Republicans in such districts?won. But! There were plenty of
[notable wins](http://www.chicagotribune.com/suburbs/naperville-sun/news/ct-nvs-naperville-lisle-township-democrats-election-st-0407-20170405-story.html)
for?Democrats in these districts,?as well as
[very tight?near-wins](http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/local/politics/ct-illinois-governor-race-bolingbrook-20170405-story.html)
in districts that felt airtight for their Republican incumbents a few months ago. We gotta keep it up!
...so let's keep going
You know who's calling their elected officials?every day??Women, that's who. One recent survey found that
[86% of calls to Congress are being made by women](http://www.themarysue.com/women-86-percent-resist-trump/)
, and the phenomenon's been confirmed
[elsewhere](http://wapo.st/2oKGx82)
.
And you know who isn't calling? Men.
Apparently
[they don't?think it works](http://melmagazine.com/yes-women-are-making-nearly-all-the-protest-calls-to-congress-in-the-trump-resistance-fba6e003049d)
.
But they're wrong, and they need to step up, because while it's working now, it won't if the astounding numbers and energy subside, plus right-wing forces surprised by the force of the progressive opposition now are sure to regroup. This isn't a sprint, it's more of a...maybe a relay race. Or a marathon where everyone is one another's cheering friends on the sidelines. The men right now have stepped away from the race course in order to watch lip-sync battles on their phones and we need them.
Your task
Whether you are a man or a woman, reach out to one man who you know is concerned about Trump and Trumpism but is not active, and ask him to act. Give him some concrete tools: suggest he subscribe to a daily or weekly to-do list such as Five Minutes: Small Steps for a Big Impact (this letter) or Daily Action (on Facebook) or
[Re:Act](http://us14.campaign-archive2.com/home/?u=34bf9c62b5c76a26e2e6e912d&id=877859f17f)
or a local Indivisible group or Flippable, or any other source you think will help him. If he says it won't work give him some of the many "It's Working" examples from this letter, and give him
[this](http://melmagazine.com/yes-women-are-making-nearly-all-the-protest-calls-to-congress-in-the-trump-resistance-fba6e003049d)
essay.
THANKS, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 5, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
Here's exactly how these things work...a friend of mine who lives in the Bay Area woke up November 9 feeling despair, like so many of us. After talking with a friend on her block, they?decided to host a group of neighbors?to talk about what could be done.
[Here's](https://elainesir.com/political-action-groups/)
a blog post she wrote about it.
The group met regularly, and, over time, decisions got made. First, they came up with ideas for plans of action. Then?subcommittees?researched those ideas, and then, following some discussion,?they decided that,?being in a deepest-blue district of a deepest-blue state, their course was to?lend?their support where it was more needed. They?joined Sister District?and have been assigned a?vulnerable/flippable?district to support?through phone banking, awareness-raising, fundraising, and so on as 2018 approaches; until that race kicks in, they do the same for consequential special elections around the country.
And that, my friends, is how ish?gets done.
...so let's keep going
I know I sound like a one-issue-pony lately with the Supreme Court nomination, but it's consequential and multi-pronged. Please bear with me as we give this critical mess the attention it requires.
[So!](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/03/us/politics/senate-democrats-appear-poised-to-filibuster-gorsuch-nomination.html?_r=0)
It worked! There are enough senators filibustering Gorsuch's nomination for him to not be confirmed?that is, unless McConnell pulls "the nuclear option" and changes the rules to require fewer senators to confirm the nominee. McConnell has kicked dents our democracy's integrity
[again](https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2011/01/strict-obstructionist/308344/)
and
[again](https://www.thenation.com/article/caught-tape-what-mitch-mcconnell-complained-about-roomful-billionaires-exclusive/)
and
[again](https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/the-gops-shameful-gamble-on-merrick-garland-pays-off/2016/11/10/05f79dd2-a780-11e6-8fc0-7be8f848c492_story.html?utm_term=.3e13a1911610)
in order to consolidate personal and political power, and?he is threatening now to do it again. (As happens with these things, if you are a complete jerk, you create new problems; in this case,
Gorsuch's
filibuster is a direct consequence of
McConnell's outrageous?hijacking of Merrick Garland, Obama's Supreme Court, pick a year ago.)
How to respond to a
[dead-eyed?bully and his gang](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/7/7d/DeathEaters.jpg)
who dig?in and glower harder?when you stand up to them? Find some friends,?stand taller, and flex your muscles, your brain and your courage. That's our Senators' job, yo.?Your task is to remind them of that.
Your task
Call your Senators and leave a message (or call tomorrow morning).
If Republican:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I am calling to tell Senator ________ that I do not support Mitch McConnell changing the rules in order to push through Gorsuch's nomination. Senator McConnell has already done a lot of damage with?his actions regarding Merrick Garland last year. If he hadn't have done that, the Supreme Court?wouldn't be in the mess it is in now.?If Senator McConnell?makes good on his threat to go nuclear, he is going to sow even more dysfunction?and anger, and he is going to weaken the entire Republican party. Please urge your leader to?back away from this pitfall and instead?work to reconcile the Merrick Garland debacle.
If Democratic:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I am calling to tell Senator ________ that I?support the filibuster of Neil Gorsuch. Since?Mitch McConnell is threatening to change?the rules in order to get his way, the next essential step is to stand up stronger to Senator McConnell. I urge Senator _______ to work with his/her party to develop immediate and strong?consequences?should?Senator McConnell make good on his threat and?change?Supreme Court nomination rules. Don't back down, and do come up with next steps should he go there, and do make those next steps public. Thank you.
Note, some Democrats are not supporting the filibuster and are voting to confirm Gorsuch, but I think this script?as written could apply to them as well.
Notes
I've been getting these letters out very late in the day; that has?proven more sustainable with my other daily obligations. However, I recognize that?even if speaking practically any actions delivered the night before?can easily?be done the following morning,?receiving a call to?action in the morning is somehow more satisfying and galvanizing.
I've been?reluctant to send letters that were written the ?evening before?because so much has happened?each day that I've feared the letter would?lose relevance;?but the pace of things does seem to be slowing down, or maybe it's just that we've now gotten used to the level of absurdity. It might take me a few days to transition to that method, but I'll do so shortly and?we'll see how it goes.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

Tiny Letter held yesterday's letter for some sort of fraud or spam alert?um, April Fools? NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 2, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello! My Saturday letter got held up, as I mentioned on Sunday, but it's important, so I am re-posting it, with allowances for TinyLetter's spam filter.
Good evening!
It's working...
There are new means to help you contribute?your energies?popping up every day. It's pretty awesome. My most recent discoveries are, first,?ourstates dot org,?which?lays out state-level legislation to?oppose?or support?in a super easy interface; and secondly, g
reentweets2017 dot blogspot dot?com, which gives you complete,?topically relevant scripts?you can pop right in to make your own tweet.
Apparently the note I got said?TinyLetter's spam filter didn't?like either of these?urls, for some reason. I have had no issues with either and, at least insofar as ourstates goes,
[this Slate article](http://www.salon.com/2017/03/30/fighting-back-at-the-state-level-anti-trump-resistance-goes-granular-with-our-states-a-map-based-organizing-project/)
both confirms the
case that state-level stuff is exceedingly important
and reassures me that
the site is legit.
...so let's keep going
Last week we saw?an assault on common-sense environmental protections. In the sneaky,?criminally dishonestly named HONEST Act,
[the House voted last week to restrict the EPA's use of science](http://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/326380-house-votes-to-restrict-epas-use-of-science)
in its regulatory decisions.
And
[Scott Pruitt has rejected a ban on a pesticide known to cause brain damage](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/29/us/politics/epa-insecticide-chlorpyrifos.html?_r=0)
in farm workers and children, claiming there isn't enough proof of this, er, widely proven effect, and therefore?using exactly the same denial-based logic?that we heard from tobacco company execs for years and years.
And,?with Scott Pruitt by his side,?Trump issued an executive order implementing
[a plethora of rollbacks on climate-change action](http://www.cnn.com/2017/03/28/politics/donald-trump-climate-change-executive-order/)
.
Your task
Call your House Rep and Senators and leave a message,?or call tomorrow morning to talk to a person, or use the awesome
[Resistbot](https://resistbot.io/)
to fax them from the comfort of your own text-message?app.
Say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling with alarm about the attacks this week on the part of the House, Scott Pruitt, and Donald Trump. I am opposed to HR1430,?which would greatly reduce the EPA's ability to do its work. I am?opposed to the use of insecticide [chlorpyrifos]?that?Pruitt is keeping in circulation, of which there is ample evidence showing how it damages brains, especially in children. And I am opposed to Trump's measures rolling back common-sense climate change actions to no conceivable benefit, economic or otherwise. I would like to know what Rep./Senator _________ is going to do to fight back against these measures. Please contact me at _______.
Wait, there's more!
The aforementioned GreenTweets has helpfully provided tweets to chide the Dems who voted for and thank? the Repubs who voted against?the Honest Act (HR 1430). Use their tweets, which I have posted as a screenshot below?(but eliminate the word "today," since the vote happened last week). You can also tweet your own rep using modified versions of?the same tweets besides the people on this list, all other Reps voted along party lines (Aye for?Repubs and Nay for Dems);?you can double check your Rep's vote
[here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/votes/115-2017/h206)
.
THANK YOU, FIVE MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: April 1 AND April 3, 2017!
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
[Overten thousandwomen have contacted Emily's List since Election Day looking to run for office](http://emilyslist.org/news/entry/EL-announces-over-10000-sign-ups-since-election-day)
. Emily's List is an organization that recruits, trains, and supports pro-choice female candidates for political office.
It takes a while to get one's feet under oneself...this is just the beginning. Ten thousand women. Fifty states. Just think about what we're building.
As the Emily's List president says in the press release, "Ten thousand women isn't a ripple...it's a wave" (my ripple metaphor from
[yesterday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-30-2017)
not withstanding, hah).
...so let's keep going
Today's action thanks to
[Your Daily Action](https://www.facebook.com/YourDailyAction/)
on Facebook.
[Mitch McConnell speaks confidently that Neil Gorsuch will be confirmed for SCOTUS](http://www.politico.com/story/2017/03/when-will-neil-gorsuch-be-confirmed-to-supreme-court-236599)
, implying that he will ignore the strenuous objections of Democrats and simply change the rules in order to get his way.
Background:?As
[I've talked about previously](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-20-2017)
, the damage McConnell wreaked on our democracy when he wouldn't allow Merrick Garland's nomination is simply inexcusable. He must be held accountable for it.?For this reason and others (like Trump's corruption/collusion imbroglio), and with many thanks to YOUR calls and letters,
[more and more Democrats are planning to filibuster](http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/U/US_SENATE_SUPREME_COURT_COOL-?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT)
. Therefore,?McConnell is threatening to eliminate the filibuster from the Supreme Court nomination process in order to get his way.
If he does, that's on him. If the Dems back down and let him get his way,
AGAIN
, with his intimidation and bullying, that's on the Dems. It's time he got his lights punched out. Er, politically. Metaphorically.
Your task
Read through the scripts and pick the one that fits for your Democratic or Republican senator.
If your Democratic senator is planning to filibuster (check his/her website/Facebook page), say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to thank Senator ______ for pledging to filibuster Gorsuch's nomination and to ask him/her to stay strong. The Democrats need to stop backing down in response to McConnell, who is a bully who has made a career of putting party and power over country. McConnell will take and take and take until the Democrats stop giving in. No one but Garland should be considered for the vacant Supreme Court position. These problems are squarely the fault of McConnell and he should know that.
If your Democratic senator has not made a statement about filibustering, say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to ask Senator ______ to make a stand and filibuster Gorsuch's nomination. The Democrats need to stop backing down in response to McConnell, who is a bully who has made a career of putting party and power over country. McConnell will take and take and take until the Democrats stop giving in. No one but Garland should be considered for the vacant Supreme Court position.?These problems are squarely the fault of McConnell and he should know that; but if Senator _____ and his/her colleagues allow themselves to be intimidated by him, AGAIN, the fault will lie with them.
If you have Democratic Senators Heitkamp or Manchin, who are planning to vote Yes on Gorsuch:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to express my great disappointment and concern that Senator [Heitkamp/Manchin] plans to confirm Gorsuch for Supreme Court. (S)he is enabling the Democracy-killing power plays of Mitch McConnell, who hijacked the Supreme Court nomination process last year. McConnell is a bully who has made a career of putting party and power over country. He will take and take and take. He must be stopped, and it is Senator ______'s responsibility to do so. No one but Garland should be considered for the vacant Supreme Court position. I would like to understand how Senator _____ justifies his/her vote in light of McConnell's actions. [If they can't tell you right then:] Please have him/her contact me at ______.
For your Republican senators:
My name is ____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to say I oppose the confirmation of anyone for the Supreme Court except Merrick Garland. Mitch McConnell stepped completely out of bounds by hijacking Garland's confirmation process. In doing so McConnell sullied his whole party and damaged the integrity of the democratic process. He must be held accountable and the action must be righted. Therefore, I oppose Neil Gorsuch's confirmation and expect Merrick Garland to he given his hearing. Senator _____ is supposed to be more than a rubber stamp for Mitch McConnell and his unAmerican, awful ideas. I expect to see some independent thought. Thank you.
THANK YOU, FIVE MINUTESERS.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: March 31, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
[Even Trump's fans know he's lying](https://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2017/03/26/donald-trump-voters-we-like-the-presidents-lies.html)
. They just don't care, because they like that he's scaring the bejeezus out of everyone in Washington. The destruction of our democracy and our livable Earth seems a high price to pay for the chance to watch D.C. d-bags get their comeupance, but it's certainly an interesting perspective.
This article is maybe a bit of a stretch for the "It's working" section. I'm claiming it a victory that pretty much everyone in the country knows that nothing he says has basis in reality.
...so let's keep going
I'll be honest, it's hard to keep going. The consequences of this election no longer feel?like an exception that is easy to make time for; life is closing back together, sealed tight with?normalcy and responsibilities,?and the demands of everyday moments?are reclaiming their space. Meanwhile,
[awful things keep happening](http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2017/03/30/vice-president-pence-breaking-tie-senate-moves-against-planned-parenthood/99820022/)
.
But we have to keep going. That's all.
First of all, what choice do we have? What would happen if we stopped?
Secondly, it IS working, despite the lost battles and the backslides (that's why it's called struggle; that's why it's called resistance).
[It is working](https://www.theatlantic.com/science/archive/2017/03/whats-next-for-the-keystone-xl-pipeline/520917/)
, and it is working because
[people are showing up](http://taxmarch.org)
.
Your task
Write individual things you've done that have made a difference. Items might be specific phone calls made, or town halls attended, or dollars donated, or subscriptions purchased, or tweets sent, or emails written.
Now write down at least three
people
you've influenced to act. It could be a small change in perception or awareness, a conversation, a postcard sent or letter written, another pair of feet marching or a seat filled at a town hall.
Think about the people touched by those five acts and three people. And the people touched by them, and so on. Think about
[pebbles dropped in a pool of water](http://c8.alamy.com/comp/AGHAN0/raindrops-hitting-water-surface-and-creating-ripples-AGHAN0.jpg)
. With enough pebbles dropped, there is nowhere on the water that goes unaffected by ripples touching ripples, merging with and moving each other.
Look at your list. Take heart. Take a breath. Look at
[this cute picture](http://i.ytimg.com/vi/nu9ZLqiq2SA/hqdefault.jpg)
of a fluffy?baby loon riding its parent's back. Tomorrow: Mitch McConnell.

Unfortunately, the House passed the bill we looked at Monday (rather, the Senate version, which it looks like they adopted in lieu of their house version) that
[allows your Internet service providers, such as Comcast and Verizon, to collect and use your private information](http://money.cnn.com/2017/03/28/technology/house-internet-privacy-repeal/)
without your consent. As part of this bill, Republicans also ensured such protections can never be introduced. This now goes to President Trump to sign.

for S.J 34 to see how your rep voted. Then call your House rep tomorrow morning (or slightly modify the scripts to leave a message tonight). Special shout-out if your Rep is Republican and voted Nay, so
[check that roll call](http://www.govtack.us/congress/votes/115-2017/h202)
.
If they voted in favor, say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to say I am extremely concerned that Senate Joint Resolution 34, which kills Internet privacy regulations, passed. I feel my representative has sold my personal information and all the details of my daily llfe ?to the highest bidder. My privacy and security online have been badly damaged. What are?Representative ____?s reasons for passing this?
[If a rationale is given, such as that this focuses on ISPs and not other Internet companies or that this is reduundant:] This bill will have real effects and is a huge win for ISPs and a huge blow against privacy.?There is no legitimate reason for Representative _____ to do this to his constituents. I will remember this.

If they voted against, say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____. I am calling to say I am extremely concerned that Senate Joint Resolution 34, which kills Internet privacy, passed. I feel my privacy and security is being severely compromised. I appreciate Rep. _______'s No vote, and I'd like to ask what measures Rep. ______ is planning to take ? to?counter this massive attack on our privacy.
[If they have an answer, great. If not]: I am very interested in retaining Internet privacy, security, and access for all Americans.?I'd like to?Rep. _____ to contact me with bills (s)he plans to sponsor or support. My contact information is ______.

The House?is planning a vote Tuesday to repeal FCC ?broadband privacy rules?and to make?it so those rules can never be implemented again.

.

last week. Republicans Susan Collins and Lisa Murkowski?voted No; otherwise it was a straight party-line vote, with all Rs voting Yea to permanently burying your consumer rights to privacy and security online and all Ds voting Nay.
Senator?Flake (R-AZ) and Rep Blackburn (R-TN) are behind this bill.
[Here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/sjres34/details)

My?privacy and security online is important to me and a vote in favor of this bill is a vote directly against my interests.?Please oppose House Joint Resolution 86. If your Rep is a co-sponsor,
call and say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _______. I am calling to say I am very disappointed that?Rep. ______ is cosponsoring?House Joint Resolution 86,??the bill to kill the FCC's bro
adband privacy rules.?My?privacy and security online is important to me and a vote in favor of this bill is a vote directly against my best interests.?I urge Rep. _______ to withdraw his/her support?and I am paying attention.?I am disgusted by the way the Republican Congress has used these CRA resolutions to make changes that are bad for
the American people.
Got another sec?
[Check to see](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/sjres34/details)
if your Republican Senator is a co-sponsor.
If your Senator is a Republican except Collins or Murkowski,?say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is ____. I am calling to say I am very disappointed in Senator ___'s vote for Senate Joint Resolution 34, the bill to kill the FCC's broadband privacy rules.
My?privacy and security online is important to me. A vote in favor of this bill is a vote directly against my interests and?I am paying attention. [If your Senator is a co-sponsor:?I am even more frustrated that Senator _____ co-sponsored this bill. (S)he is not representing his/her constituents will with such a move.]
If your Senator is a Democrat or Collins or Murkowski, say:

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
The Republicans tried again to pass their health care bill,
[and failed again](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/24/us/politics/health-care-affordable-care-act.html?_r=0)
. Their attempted changes were not to make it less horrible, but to make it more so, thanks to the "Freedom Caucus" led by Tea Party Republican?Mark Meadows (NC-11). The Freedom Caucus had hoped to?force Paul Ryan to strip away some or all of
[these ten](https://www.healthcare.gov/blog/10-health-care-benefits-covered-in-the-health-insurance-marketplace/)
"essential health benefits"?that the ACA (Obamacare) guarantees:
1. Outpatient care
2. Trips to the emergency room
3. Treatment in the hospital for inpatient care
4. Care before and after your baby is born
5. Mental health and substance use disorder services: This includes behavioral health treatment, counseling, and psychotherapy
6. Prescription drugs
7. Services and devices to help you recover if you are injured, or have a disability or chronic condition. This includes physical and occupational therapy, speech-language pathology, psychiatric rehabilitation, and more.
8. Lab tests
9. Preventive services including counseling, screenings, and vaccines to keep you healthy and care for managing a chronic disease.
10. Pediatric services: This includes dental care and vision care for kids
There is an eleventh as well?the right to have health care despite?pre-existing conditions?because, without the?essential coverage listed above, you would be denied the care you need for your pre-existing condition.?I mean those ten things above really cover everything except unexpected disasters.
...so let's keep going
It is a win that this cruel?bill didn't pass. However, at least half of the reason?it didn't pass was because it wasn't right-wing enough for the Freedom Caucus.?We must make sure the next attempt is more, not less, respectful and usable to humans.
An added bit of information:
[in a phone call with a Washington Post journalist today](https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/president-trump-called-my-cellphone-to-say-that-the-health-care-bill-was-dead/2017/03/24/8282c3f6-10ce-11e7-9b0d-d27c98455440_story.html?utm_term=.945475f353e8)
after the Ryan bill failed, Trump said?he plans now to just?let Obamacare "explode" so he can blame the Democrats. This political act will take real actual people down with it.
Choose one of those key protections listed above?(I mean, or more, but for a five-minute task, choose one). Write down why it is vitally important. A personal story is best. If you are a man and you choose something that is "women's health care" (your wife's mammograms saved her life, your daughter's Obamacare delivered her two babies),?even better, since these lawmakers seem incapable of understanding that old men's bodies are not the default human body and all others an inconvenient and embarrassing?exception.
Your task
Write
[Trump](https://www.whitehouse.gov/contact)
and fax
[Paul Ryan](https://faxzero.com/fax_congress/R000570)
and
[Mark Meadows](https://faxzero.com/fax_congress/M001187)
the following letter:
Dear President Trump/Paul Ryan/Mark Meadows,
When you try to take away basic health care protections, it is very difficult to see your?humanity. No other industrialized, reasonably functioning country does this to?its citizens.?If it weren't for [your chosen item], [put your thoughts here as to why this thing is vitally important].
You might be hoping to withdraw all support and resources for the ACA and?wait for it to fail, so you can blame the Democrats. In doing so, your victory will be pyrrhic, because you will have ruined the lives of millions of people, and in some cases literally ended their lives. We need strong health insurance that respects the basics needed?to keep our entire population healthy. Single-payer would be best. [Add the following?for Donald Trump] Just imagine what a winner you will be if you push single-payer health care through. Everyone will love you. You will be a hero.
Sincerely,
[Your name]
Sources
https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/24/us/politics/health-care-affordable-care-act.html?_r=0
https://www.healthcare.gov/blog/10-health-care-benefits-covered-in-the-health-insurance-marketplace/
http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/23/521220359/gop-health-bill-changes-could-kill-protections-for-people-with-preexisting-condi

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
The vote on the ACA replacement
[has been postponed](http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/03/23/gop-leaders-scramble-to-get-lawmakers-behind-obamacare-replacement.html)
!
This is widely seen as a blow to Paul Ryan and to Trump.
This has a lot to do with the ultra-conservative Tea Party wing of the Republican House, the Freedom Caucus, thinking the bill doesn't go far
enough
in restricting services (they want to weaken requirements for?maternity care and substance-abuse treatment, among other things). But it
also
has to do with "moderate" Republicans balking at the harsh, expensive, inequitable bill.?Which means it has to do with your efforts! Thank you!
...so let's keep going
What we don't want to have happen is that the Republicans appease the Freedom Caucus by
[making the bill](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/23/521220359/gop-health-bill-changes-could-kill-protections-for-people-with-preexisting-condi)
[even more harsh](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/23/521220359/gop-health-bill-changes-could-kill-protections-for-people-with-preexisting-condi)
, and then the moderate
Republicans cave because their constituents have lost focus
. So we need to keep the pressure on. I know we've called a couple times already, but's very important to follow up when the Trumpist administration and Congress suffer setbacks to make sure they don't simply pivot and recover.
Your task
Call your House and Senate elected officials (regardless of party and stance) and say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I want to call to say I'm glad the vote for Ryan's current health care bill has been postponed, and I'd like to reiterate my grave concern over any bill resembling that one. We need to make the excellent parts of the ACA?even better?while reigning in the influence of the insurers so that?health care?becomes?more affordable and stable. [Choose some or all:?I support care for families and for people starting families, including maternity care; how is increasing birth risks helpful to anyone in our society???I support Planned Parenthood. I support meaningful Medicaid and Medicare coverage. I support a ban on lifetime caps, which severely hurts people with disabilities.?I support mental health care and substance abuse care. I support a ban on discriminatory pricing and on?pre-existing condition pricing. I support sharing the responsibility of health care across everyone in our society; cherry-picking features we individually want to support?is completely antithetical to the point of insurance and is very naive.][Add a story of your own if you have it.]
So easy!
I mentioned Resistbot
[a week or so ago](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-14-2017)
?you text your message using the
[Resistbot](http://resistbot.io/index.html)
app and it?will fax your text to your members of Congress. Subscriber Emily gave it a try and recommends it highly. Check it out!
Sources
www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/03/23/gop-leaders-scramble-to-get-lawmakers-behind-obamacare-replacement.html

NAME: Your five-minute action item: March 23, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
It?s working?
Groups all over the country are organizing to keep their members of Congress accountable in ways I?haven't seen in my lifetime, and there appear?to be no signs of letting up.
[Here's](https://thenevadaindependent.com/article/constituents-urge-heller-listen-concerns-las-vegas-rally)
an example from Nevada.
We still have along way to go, of course...years to go...and we need to continue to take heart and not let up.
?so let?s keep going
The House is expected to vote on
[the replacement for the ACA](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-8-2017)
tomorrow. This plan is basically
[a tax-cut?bill benefiting the rich](http://https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2017/03/acha-tax-cut/518889/)
. The Congressional Budget Office (CBO)?predicts that 24 million people who currently have health care will lose it by 2026 if this bill is put into law. It defunds Planned Parenthood, which is essential care for millions of women, and it vastly reduces the reach and depth of Medicaid. It retains the measure that keeps young people through age 26 on their parents? insurance and that bans discrimination for pre-existing conditions, but it throws coverage for a wide variety of other things, including mental health care and childbearing, into question. It puts an immense amount of pressure on states to make up for where this bill would fall short. It denies
[the basic reality of how insurance works](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2017/03/09/is-that-not-correct-male-gop-lawmaker-asks-why-men-should-pay-for-prenatal-coverage/?utm_term=.b54ee0af49be)
(we all share the cost of a wide variety of medical care we will need throughout our lives).
Your task
Go
[here](https://www.americanprogressaction.org/issues/healthcare/news/2017/03/17/166615/trumpcare-by-the-numbers/)
to learn how the proposed bill?would affect your specific U.S. Congressional district. Use that information to fill in the blanks for this script and call your House Rep.
Thanks to
[Re:Act letter](http://us14.campaign-archive1.com/?u=34bf9c62b5c76a26e2e6e912d&id=0a7436c9e2&e=02ce18aa8c)
for most of this script and for the link
with the state/district info.
Say:
?Hello, I am [NAME] from [PLACE]. I?m calling to ask [REPRESENTATIVE] to oppose the most recent version of the American Health Care Act. The CBO [Congressional Budget Office] says 24 million people will lose insurance; the recent update does nothing to address that. [XX,XXX] people would lose coverage in our district alone. By 2026 the average cost per enrollee in [STATE]?will go up $[X,XXX].On behalf of those constituents who would lose coverage, will the rep pledge to publicly oppose the bill?? [If you wish, share a (true) story about how this affects you or your community.]
THANK YOU, FIVE MINUTESERS!
Sources

of various postcard parties around the country. Did you send yours? Better late than never! As usual,?I forgot to post my own contribution here. It's below.
...so let's keep going
[Neil Gorsuch's hearing started today](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/20/us/politics/judge-gorsuch-supreme-court-confirmation-hearings.html)
.
Gorsuch is up for the Supreme Court seat that was
[stolen from Merrick Garland](https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/the-gops-shameful-gamble-on-merrick-garland-pays-off/2016/11/10/05f79dd2-a780-11e6-8fc0-7be8f848c492_story.html?utm_term=.a232071efc5e)
in a Constitutionally violent old-up-and-hostage situation perpetrated by?Mitch McConnell. Of all the blood-curdling, partisan things McConnell has done, I think this?might be the worst.
Unlike many of Trump's choices for running our country,?Gorsuch is a real judge with experience and some respect for his field. But
[he is extremely conservative](http://www.politico.com/story/2017/01/who-is-neil-gorsuch-bio-facts-background-political-views-234437)
and?will most likely vote along with the other four conservative judges on the Supreme Court. Cases almost certain to be coming down the pipeline in the next say five years include challenges to marriage equality;?religious?freedom/freedom from religion;?abortion/women's privacy rights and human rights;?Internet-related privacy rights;?Internet-related access rights;?health care;?Citizens United (the root of much of the destruction of our democracy);?regular people's financial well-being, privacy, and options;?the viability of our public education system;?police power and accountability;?and responses to climate change.
We are at a crossroads with some incredibly important issues.
If McConnell hadn't pulled his seat-stealing stunt, I would ask folks to urge their Senators to thoroughly vet Gorsuch and then vote No, but honestly there wouldn't be much to do about his being eventually appointed, no matter how much one might?disagree with and fear his stances on issues that directly affect our lives. BUT. The reason he is even up for the seat is because of McConnell's unprecedented hostile squatting.
The nomination belongs to no one except Garland. Even if Garland were voted down following?the hearings, he deserves a hearing. Every candidate for this seat should be filibustered until Garland gets his hearing.
You may have heard that there is some?fear that McConnell will pull
[the nuclear option](http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/article/2017/feb/03/6-questions-answered-about-nuclear-option-filibust/)
and get rid of the filibuster option for Supreme Court hearings altogether in order to get Gorsuch nominated. The Democrats MUST NOT be cowed by this threat. They MUST?stand up and act in offense?rather than preemptively cave out of fear of?their?power-crazed?colleagues. The Democrats' fear is part of the reason we are where we are.
Your task
Call your senators today or tomorrow morning. Say:
I am calling to tell Senator ______ to?ask tough and thorough questions of Gorsuch's record and beliefs regarding?other people's freedoms and opportunities. In addition I am demanding that Neil Gorsuch's nomination be filibustered. No candidate should be considered until Merrick Garland is given his hearing. Mitch McConnell's theft of the confirmation hearing from Garland must never be forgotten and must be responded to. Mitch McConnell's move damaged the?integrity of our democracy and that damage must be repaired.
[If you are speaking with a Democratic senator's office]
I understand there is a possibility that McConnell will eliminate the filibuster option as a result, but I am sick of Democrats making moves purely out of fear of what Republicans might do. I am also sick of Democrats claiming they are?taking?the high road, when actually they are just tools being manipulated by?the Right.?Let the Republicans suffer the consequences if McConnell does such a rash move. There has been no high road for a long time, just a road to irrelevance, and?we've?put ourselves in great danger because of it.?I am demanding a FILIBUSTER on Gorsuch and on EVERY candidate until Merrick Garland is offered a hearing. Thank you.

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Steve King, House rep from Iowa, has long espoused super racist and nationali
st garbage. In the past,
it
seemed like real left-field wacko stuff that was better ignored. No more. It is now pretty
mainstream thought in the Republican party.
Fortunately,?we?are activated now.
[People?are contacting Iowa's tourism board](http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/politics/2017/03/17/iowa-tourism-officials-feel-blowback-latest-steve-king-controversy/99307160/)
to complain and to cancel their trips. The board normally receives two complaints?a month;?they are currently receiving?60 tweets a?day?plus emails and?calls. Tourism is big business in some parts of Iowa and?business owners are concerned about their elected representative's?damaging, offensive, and embarrassing comments. And
[King's democratic challenger is enjoying a big boost in donations](http://shareblue.com/iowa-tourism-complaints-skyrocket-after-steve-kings-racist-tweet/)
, too!
...so let's keep going
For
[Friday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-17-2017)
's
and
[Saturday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-18-2017)
's action
you chose something of importance to you that will be cut deeply or entirely in
[Trump's proposed budget](https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/politics/trump-presidential-budget-2018-proposal/?utm_term=.2472cfacf1a5)
, and wrote briefly about it. You wrote first about how you've been positively affected by this thing, a program or project, and then about why that's important. Put it in a letter now and email it to your members of Congress and
the president. A
nd
Mick Mulvaney, the head of the OMB (
Office of Management and Budget). And your local papers! And your social media!
As a U.S. House rep for South Carolina (he vacated his seat in order to accept the OMB director post)
,
[Mick Mulvaney](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/16/us/politics/mick-mulvaney-trump-budget-director.html?_r=0)
was
a member of the
[Freedom Caucus](http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2015/10/20/house-freedom-caucus-what-is-it-and-whos-in-it/)
, an extremely conservative and uncompromising wing of congressional
Republicans
[whose every dream is being realized](http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/12/14/a-house-divided)
now by this administration
. And now he is the
head of the
the nation's budget.
You have all the info for it.
It is okay if it's not the most cohesive or professional thing you've ever written. If you want to spend more time on it, of course do so!
You should know
[your members of Congress](http://govtrack.us)
; find their webforms or email addresses on their websites.
Click
[here](https://www.whitehouse.gov/contact)
to write the president.
The OMB fax number is
202-395-3888.
Address the fax to Mick Mulvaney, the director. There are lots of free fax services online, such as
[this](https://faxzero.com)
one.
Your task
Set a timer.
Compose your letter. Here is a frame
:
I am writing to express my deep [concern/grief/fears/anger/indignation] about Trump's proposed budget.
I will provide one example of how this budget will send ripples of [
loss/hardship/grief/struggle] throughout the country.
[Now add your part here
.]
Societies need support for the public good to come from the top.
Eliminating support for everything that inspires,?educates, and?preserves our nation's incredible beauty and dynamic history?shows the greatest foolishness and folly.
Sincerely,
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

DESCRIPTION:

Read

of what it's like to work in a Congressperson's office since the election. We MUST keep it up. It is WORKING. It?makes a difference. Don't normalize the assaults on democracy and justice; instead, normalize the?five-minute action. Make it?part of your daily activity, like brushing your teeth.

Yesterday, we reviewed the Trump administration's cruel,?dark budget.?What would a society?where all priorities and almost all?money go?to matters of war be like? I don't want to find out.

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
You may have noticed I have been erratic in my delivery of these letters?of late. It's been a busy busy month for work and I apologize for the inconsistent schedule.?I?hope you are able to complete actions in the evening or the following day.
It's working...
Mennonite communities have a history of doing social good, but
[they are getting louder about?resisting](http://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/news/a53717/mennonites-protest-trump/)
Trump's bigotry?against immigrants. A coalition
[even went to the Women's March](https://themennonite.org/daily-news/mennonites-join-womens-march-washington/)
.
So let's keep going
You have probably heard about
[Trump's proposed budget](http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/visual-guide-winners-losers-trump-s-budget-n734386)
. It makes
[significant cuts](http://www.cnn.com/2017/03/16/politics/trump-budget-cuts/)
to
every
department, with the most?crippling cuts?slashing through?the EPA, State Department, the Labor Department (all cuts are in workforce-development?programs for elderly and youth)?and the Department of Agriculture.
It decimates??FEMA funding for disasters and entirely
eliminates?NOAA
coastal and marine efforts
?two of so many examples of making policy based on?wishing really hard that climate change?weren't true.
It also
completely eliminates
the National Endowment for the Arts, the National Endowment for the Humanities, public broadcasting (NPR, PBS),?Americorps and its sibling programs,?federal afterschool programming, and many other programs that express our very humanity. It
completely eliminates
[funding for maintaining the health](https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/politics/trump-presidential-budget-2018-proposal/?utm_term=.1b1b50123220)
of the Great Lakes (the largest freshwater system on Earth); the Chesapeake Bay;?environmentally consequential areas near the border with Mexico;?and many other natural treasures.
The three departments getting beefed in the budget are Homeland Security, including $4.4 billion for his
[stupid wall](https://www.poetryfoundation.org/resources/learning/core-poems/detail/46565)
, the Department?of Defense,?and Veteran's Affairs, which includes $4.5 billion for veteran's health care, which is great, but if you are helping vets become healthy while destroying the society they risked their lives protecting, you are lighting your own tail on fire.
I understand that our nation's?budget is impossibly complicated and that it is naive and inaccurate to impose?a sort of this-for-that equivalent. But.
[Trump's personal spending of taxpayers' money](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/politics/wp/2017/03/17/how-much-is-donald-trumps-travel-and-protection-costing-anyway/?utm_term=.27d3e9318d39)
?multiple hundreds of millions of dollars a year on Melania and Barron's residence in New York City and security for Trump's weekends at Mar-A-Lago?makes these cuts all the more sickening and offensive.
Your task
Choose one of the programs listed above, or one of their products:?for example, public art, or cultural explorations, or free educational TV, or youthful?volunteer experiences, or afterschool classes, or science and weather data, or services after a natural disaster, or a healthy water system near you.?Jot down specific ways you, your kids, your parents, your neighbors?have benefited from these programs.
[Here](https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/politics/trump-presidential-budget-2018-proposal/?utm_term=.1b1b50123220)
is a?list?of specific organizations and cuts, but it's OK to, for example, think about art or culture programming that affected you without being certain of the NEA's role. A government that supports the
arts, education, scientific research, safety measures, and?services for vulnerable people has a ripple?effect on ALL?other programming support and resources,?down to your neighborhood park.
That's it. Pick one. Set a timer.?Make a list. It doesn't have to be a masterpiece, just a list.
And we'll pick up from there tomorrow.?See you then. So, so sorry for this late hour.

NAME: Your  five minute action item today!! March 17, 2017!
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hoo boy. Good evening. This'll have to be a fast one!
It's working...
By "it" this time, I mean our system of checks and balances.
[Trump's Muslim Ban 2.0 was blocked](https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2017-03-15/federal-judge-in-hawaii-blocks-trumps-new-travel-ban-hours-before-implementation)
the night before it was supposed to go in to effect?by a couple judges for being an obvious rewrite of a stated wish to "keep Muslims out."
...so let's keep going
The House has already passed a?bill that will
[all but eliminate class-action lawsuits](https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/985)
. Class action lawsuits
are
[a valuable civil rights tool](https://www.themarshallproject.org/2017/03/08/a-critical-civil-rights-tool-is-on-the-chopping-block#.XQY0UeLul)
as well as
[one of the few tools left for individuals](https://www.buzzfeed.com/coralewis/republicans-in-congress-are-moving-to-limit-class-action-law?utm_term=.toNmg99mr#.dqRAMxxAE)
who suffered
injuries on their person, finances, freedom, family, and so on from the actions of?a large organization or corporation.
The Republican bill was?introduced by Bob Goodlatte (R-Va), the same guy who introduced
[that?bill to?eliminate?the House ethics office](http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/article/2017/jan/03/house-gops-ethics-vote-what-was-all-about-anyway/)
on day 1?of this Congress and
[a number of other blood-curdling bills](https://www.govtrack.us/search?q=bob+goodlatte)
; his bill makes?the requirements so high that class-action lawsuits will be all but dead. The Republicans are going full-steam ahead undoing public-good policies going back to FDR's social security/medicare/employment protections, through?LBJ's Civil Rights and War on Poverty legislation,?and of course including?Obama's environmental and human-rights protections. They are getting what they've been aiming for for generations.
Anyway, the Senate is expected to vote on this bill soon.
Your task
Please
call your?Senators and say:
My name is _______ and my zip code is ________. I am calling Senator ________ to?ask him/her to
FIGHT
HR 985, the bill that severely limit class action lawsuits. People need protections from large powerful entities.?[If you have a story about how you were part of a class action lawsuit against an entity that was exploiting or hurting you, definitely tell it.]

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: March 16, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Remember
[I told you a story last month](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-4-2017)
about my mother's representative, Pete Roskam, who has refused to meet with concerned constituents and in fact has disrespected them repeatedly by insisting, both in public and in letters to supporters, that?they are plants or outsiders? He has begun to meet with people in small groups about the ACA and, while it is highly unlikely he will adjust his partisan,?conservative stance too much,
[he has expressed concern](http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20170314/BLOGS02/170319944/roskam-blinks-on-ryancare)
in meetings?and publicly?for the changes to Medicaid in RyanCare, evidently in response to his (real, actual) constituents.
...so let's keep going
Today is the
[Ides of Trump](https://www.theidesoftrump.com/#theidesoftrump)
; tens of thousands of people around the country are sending a postcard to Trump expressing their displeasure. Unfortunately, there is not a?more specific message; it would be a more effective campaign that way. Still, though. Power in numbers.?Remember to keep a stack of postcards in your house to make actions such as this easy. You can buy pre-stamped postcards from the post office for I think $0.53.
Your task
Lcate a postcard. Please include your zip code and?name on it. Send it to?1600 Pennsylvania Avenue?NW, 20500.?Here are some ideas for your message:
Immigrants are part of the fabric of America! Shame on you!
Demand an end to violence and harassment?against Jewish centers and mosques!
Your hateful words about my fellow Americans are deeply offensive to me and millions of others.
We are concerned about your constant lying. You need psychological help and your lying is a danger to our country.
You promised you'd release your taxes. Where are they?
Come clean on your relationship with Russia.
BANNON NO! BANNON NO! BANNON NO!
By installing white nationalists in our highest offices, you have perpetrated?a shameful act on a country I love.
We all have to breathe air and drink water. Stop the assault on our environment.
If you believe women are humans, then you should know that women's rights are human rights.
You lie constantly, don't know how democracy works,?and have cruel and uninformed ideas. Resign!
...there are so many more.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!
Remember you can always view past actions in the
[archive](http://tinyletter.com/fiveminutes/archive)
, and your friends and associates can always subscribe by writing to me or signing up
[here](http://tinyletter.com/fiveminutes)
.
Sources

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: March 15, 2017

DESCRIPTION:
Happy Pi Day!
It's working...
People are inventing stuff to help us raise our voices and to help protect us. A little while ago subscriber Emily reminded me (so I'm reminding you)?that faxes are another option for getting a hold of members of Congress, and now
[check out this "ResistBot"](http://www.teenvogue.com/story/resistbot-faxes-texts-to-senators)
that turns text messages into faxes?to your member of Congress. How awesome is that?! So easy!?And after
[yesterday's](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-13-2017-1)
letter subscriber Brian pointed me?to
[this portable panic button for immigrants](https://www.wired.com/2017/03/portable-panic-button-immigrants-swept-raids/)
who fear detainment/deportation. When your life might be ruined, it's good to know that at least your?trusted loved ones will be instantly?alerted?so someone can?pick up your kids, move your car, and so on.
...so let's keep going
Are you all caught up from
[yesterday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-march-13-2017-1)
? Good. ?Now,?Trump has asked us to share stories about the ACA. Everyone knows the ACA has?issues that must be resolved?(caused in large?part by
[powerful insurance companies](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/08/17/490202346/aetna-ceo-to-justice-department-block-our-deal-and-well-drop-out-of-exchanges)
and a Congress so pickled in spite that they are incapable of productive action).?But calling it a total failure and blaming it for people's misery, as Trump and the Republicans in Congress have done,?are just
[more?lies, lies, lies](http://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMp1609016)
.*
Your task
Got a story for how the ACA has helped you? Please share it with the president at
[this link](https://www.whitehouse.gov/obamacare-share-your-story)
.
That's it!
*On a related note,?the Congressional Budget Office has
[released its review](http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/cbo-24-million-more-without-health-insurance-under-gop-plan-n732946)
of the ACA replacement?and they estimate that 14 million people will lose their insurance in the next year and 24?million will in the next 10?years. It would also make insurance
[outrageously expensive](http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/takeaways-cbos-analysis-republican-health-care-plan/story?id=46106361)
for low-income older people.
