NAME: Your five-minute action item today: March 14, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Organizations working to flip districts, such as Flippable, are
[learning and getting more efficient and stronger](https://www.flippable.org/blog/2017/3/12/iop43l5pg4vlk3sble9dqcamyt3m48)
. The movement is maturing, with no flagging in site. Keep it up!
...so let's keep going
Trump's ill-conceived and poorly implemented?changes to immigration enforcement policy and the xenophobic rhetoric surrounding them has led to
[great fear in immigrant communities](http://www.sunherald.com/latest-news/article134610779.html)
?not just among undocumented people but among legal residents and citizens, too. This is because implementation has been
[capricious and arbitrary](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/28/politics/donald-trump-immigration-detention-deportations-enforcement/)
. People here legally are being detained or questioned because of how they look, and?while Trump has claimed he will prioritize people who have committed serious crimes, this has not been the practice. Trump is
[requiring local law enforcement to act](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2017/01/26/trump-wants-to-empower-local-police-to-enforce-immigration-law-raising-fears-of-racial-profiling/?utm_term=.6662a342f390)
as ICE agents, which at best will take law enforcement away from their primary duty of ensuring safety and order, and at worst will empower some to engage freely in racial profiling and intimidation. Trump also wants to hire 10,000 new ICE agents, which would
[triplethe current number](http://www.npr.org/2017/02/23/516712980/trumps-plan-to-hire-15-000-border-patrol-and-ice-agents-wont-be-easy-to-fulfill)
.
Task 1
First, help people know their rights.
Take a screenshot of
[this](http://unitedwedream.org/thank-deportation-defense-card-handy-phone/)
information (English is at the bottom) that everyone should know if ICE comes knocking on their door,?and send it to at least one other person and/or post it in social media and ask others to share.
[Here](https://www.aclu.org/files/kyr/MKG17-KYR-PoliceImmigrationFBI-OnePager-English-v01.pdf)
is some more detailed information that addresses various other situations (at home, at work, in the car, etc.).?And
[here](http://iamerica.org/know-your-rights#workplace)
are those various situations, again, but in?easier-to-read posters on specific subjects. These resources are also in a variety of languages.
Task 2
Then, call your Mayor and/or your police/sheriff's office* and say:
I am concerned about Trump's policy of obligating local law enforcement to do immigration enforcement. Our local law enforcement already has an important job to do and if they are doing a different job they can't be there to serve and protect. I also don't feel safe if people are afraid to call 911 or other emergency?help, which will happen if authorities are deputized to serve as ICE agents. I also fear the increase in immigration enforcement will create arbitrary searches and mistaken detainments?as it already has. What are you as a [city/police force/sheriff's office] going to do to make sure the people in our town/county are able to stay?safe and are being treated fairly?
[If they say there is nothing they can do, you can add] If you think that, I urge you to discuss the issue further.?This is your municipality and your responsibility is to the safety of all the people here. ICE should do their jobs properly, with the required warrants and processes, and our local law enforcement should be allowed to do their jobs properly, without interference from ICE.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: March 12, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Today...beginning right this minute, actually...the ACLU is hosting
[a resistance training](https://peoplepower.org)
, in response to?the #MuslimBan and so much more,?for people who want to?combat?Trump's abuses. House parties all over the country will tune into a?livestream video and then have a discussion about what they can do in their communities. Unfortunately, I can't attend one today. But do you know who is attending one? Thousands and thousands and TENS of thousands?of people! All over the country ?
[here's](https://map.peoplepower.org)
a map. (If you want to watch the livestream on your own?you can,
[here](https://peoplepower.org)
, and it will also be available as a recording after the fact as well.)
...so let's keep going
If you have been doing these actions, you might now be on a bunch of people's mailing?lists. This might be the case, for example, if you've given money to any of the flippable-district races, or if you've signed up to learn more about a certain issue.?It can get burdensome, but, hey, guess what? It's resolvable! Your action today is to cull your inbox a bit.
How is this an "action item"? Because if we open our email and immediately feel annoyed or overwhelmed, we are not going to act. We need space in order to move.
Note:?Maybe the annoying prospect of getting on an email list has?stopped you from doing actions. Please don't let it stop you. We need you.?Take one for the team and unsubscribe when needed, or use a separate?email address.
Your task
We could probably spend all day going through our email box! But yeah, let's not. Set your alarm for five minutes. Do you hear from candidates of whom you're not a constituent? Unsubscribe. Pitches you never look at from organizations you never donate to? Unsubscribe. Pitches you never look at from organizations you DO give to? Unsubscribe. Create a calendar alert for giving instead. Things you totally want to get to but you realize you never ever do and there are twenty unread, starred emails waiting for you? Read some, and/or unsubscribe.
Lists are king for elected officials and issues organizations, but we individuals need to stay productive and organized, too.
If you wish, when the box comes up asking why you unsubscribed, write that you appreciate and support all their work but you will stay up to date on their efforts by other means.
What to keep? Keep things that you read and act on at least, say, once every three to five emails. Keep your own elected officials' emails. If you are actively following other elected figures, even if they're not yours, obviously then keep those. If your email box is scaring you but No, Really, you do want this info, consider subscribing through social media or some other means, or make a to-do list of your top issues of interest and visit those sites on your own rather than have them send stuff to your inbox.
Thanks Five-Minutesers! Here's to headspace, for the fight to come.

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!

Our (Democratic) Senators are hearing us. They are

as a matter of national security. Of course the Republican Congress denied their request...but they are hearing us. And they will continue to. We'll return to the tax issue with our own calls in a bit.

This task?thanks to
[Indivisible Chicago](https://www.indivisiblechicago.com/take-action-1/2017/3/10/friday-march-10th-speak-out-against-scott-pruitts-lies)
.
Yesterday, Scott Pruitt stated that
[he does not believe that carbon dioxide induced by?human activity?is a primary contributor to global warming](http://www.cnbc.com/2017/03/09/epa-chief-scott-pruitt.html)
.?"I think that measuring with precision human activity on the climate is something very challenging to do and there's tremendous disagreement about the degree of impact, so no, I would not agree that it's a primary contributor to the global warming that we see," he told CNBC's "Squawk Box."
There is not tremendous disagreement. There is
[no disagreement](https://climate.nasa.gov/evidence/)
by anyone with?any credibility at all
, not about the causes or the impact
.?For the love of humanity, denying the reality of something does not actually make it no longer a reality. This magical thinking is SO. DANGEROUS. SODANGEROUS. sosososodangerous.
Your task
Call your Senators and your governor.
Say to your Senators:
My name is __________ and my zip code is_____. I'm calling to ask the Senator to speak out on Scott Pruitt's statement that human activity is not a contributor to global warming. This is settled science and it is unacceptable and dangerous that the head of the EPA would deny this.
Say to your governor:
My name is __________ and my zip code is_____. I'm calling to ask Governor ______ to demand of Scott Pruitt that he?respect the reality of human-impacted?global warming. Global warming is going to affect [your state] by drastically changing?[our coastlines and waterways/our precipitation patterns and other agricultural concerns/our winter ?seasons,?which will change the economy in sudden and unexpected ways].?Global warming is settled science and it is unacceptable and dangerous that the head of the EPA would deny this, and this combined with proposed cuts to the EPA will badly hurt our state. What does governor _______ intend to do about it? (S)he can let me know at [contact information]

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
I promise I won't keep making this section of my letter about my own representative ?all the time, but I have one more story related to this week's town hall. One of the first questions our representative?took at Monday's town hall?was from my neighborhood's Indivisible Group. Melanie thanked him for his progressive stance on many issues, but also pointed out that as a long-time, well-liked?rep in a deep blue, very safe district, he has a responsibility?to speak out on a greater variety of issues, and to be a wrench?in the gears of the Trump administration. She also presented him with a large picture, complete with an actual wrench embedded (below, and sideways - sorry).
Well, today, when he spoke on the House floor of his?opposition to Trumpist policies, he closed his speech by saying "My constituents demanded I be a wrench?in Trump's cruel agenda, and I Mr.?Speaker, do not intend to disappoint them." Watch the video
[here](https://www.facebook.com/RepGutierrez/videos/10155089994983205/)
. I guess our reps ARE listening!
...so let's keep going
Trump's choice of administrator for?Medicare/Medicaid is Seema Verma, a person who, at least, has experience in her role, so at least we are dealing with the more traditional sort of horrifying candidate. She has been the main force shaping
[Indiana's health care policies](http://www.indystar.com/story/news/politics/2017/02/16/pick-head-medicare-medicaid-gives-few-policy-views/98007892/)
under Mike Pence as well as some other conservative states. She has been supportive of providing
[block grants](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/06/upshot/how-would-republican-plans-for-medicaid-block-grants-actually-work.html?_r=0)
for states to use at their discretion, that familiar trope that is fairly guaranteed to provide worse coverage and coverage for fewer people, and is especially hard on people with disabilities. She has also supported things like work requirements, which reinforce
[our country's obsession with equating poverty with immorality](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/12/27/506348147/the-future-of-medicaid-may-be-found-in-indiana-where-the-poor-pay)
, and mandatory savings accounts for health care for people making as little as $12,000 a year.?She thinks coverage for
[maternity leave should be optional](https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/trumps-pick-for-medicare-and-medicaid-wants-to-cut-mandatory-maternity-coverage?utm_source=vicenewsfb)
.
This evening, let's call our senators and also our governor and leave messages. So many costly responsibilities are going to be kicked down to the states, SO many. Our governors, need to be prepared for their Republican Congressional colleagues' leaving them so up a (polluted, EPA-less) creek.
Your task
Call your senators and say:
My name is _______ and I live in _______. I am calling to ask Senator _______ to please challenge Seema Verma's appointment to Medicare/Medicaid administrator. Please press her to?answer?very specifically what changes she plans to make to Medicare and Medicaid, and slow down her appointment as much as possible. Her ideas about "personal?responsibility" pass moralizing, patronizing, and uncompassionate judgment on poor and unwell people and people trying to juggle multiple responsibilities. Her notions about maternity leave are short sighted and hostile to men and women expecting children and those?with infants. Having a family should not be considered an unseemly luxury.
Call your governor and say:
My name is _______ and I live in _______. I am calling because I am very concerned about Seema Verma likely being confirmed this week as the head administrator of Medicare/Medicaid. She will almost certainly kick these programs down to states as block grants. We have seen that block grants mean greater struggles for people who are already struggling, especially children and adults with disabilities. [Personal story if you know someone with a disabled family member.] We have also seen that "tests" for honesty and diligence imposed on people so they can access their health care are complicated and messy, and expensive, too. It's always better to be prepared. Any?of us could need these services, even you. Things happen. People lose jobs. People get sick. How is [state] preparing to adequately cover all its people if Seema Verma is confirmed?
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: March 9, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Monday I went to my rep's town hall meeting. There are usually a handful of people at his town halls, he says. Look at the image below. And that was well before it started! People continued to?stream?in until the walls were?three?people?deep, and?apparently there were people waiting around the block who couldn't get in.
...so let's keep going
The following?summary thanks in large part to
[Re:Act letter](http://us14.campaign-archive1.com/?u=34bf9c62b5c76a26e2e6e912d&id=99da9476ba&e=02ce18aa8c)
.?On Monday Paul Ryan released The Replacement, which he calls the American Health Care Act, AHCA (personally, I think it's not coincidence the name is so close to the ACA, so the Republican Congress?can take advantage of the confusion and take credit where it's not due to them, but I can't source that from anywhere except my own self). He gave committees until TODAY?two?days?to review this monumentally important bill. He is asking for a vote prior to its receiving its score from the?Congressional Budget Office (CBO). (For the record, if we're keeping track of hypocrisies here, Ryan was strident in requiring the ACA be reviewed by the CBO prior to any vote.)
The proposal raises costs?for poor people and?older people and?provides tax cuts to wealthy people. There is no penalty for not having insurance, but insurance companies can add a 30% penalty, payable to them, if you lapse coverage. The bill?retains the popular ACA provisions of not discriminating for?pre-existing conditions and of covering?people up through age?26 their parents' coverage.
The bill will cut off?the Medicaid expansion, which currently covers 11?million people, in 2020, and in 2018 will?eliminate?the modest taxes levied to pay for the?ACA, though there is no explanation of?where the difference in funding?will be made up. The bill will
[defund Planned Parenthood](http://www.cnbc.com/2017/03/06/house-gop-releases-plan-to-repeal-replace-obamacare.html)
in starting 2018 and in 2020 levy
[dramatic changes to Medicaid](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518864390/gop-bill-would-repeal-obamacare-taxes-and-penalties-keep-some-subsidies)
that entail poorer coverage to fewer people. Companies are no longer required to provide their full-time employees with health insurance.
The bill provides?cheap, bare-bones plans?that will suffice for young healthy people willing to take a risk,?but then we're back to the pre-ACA problem of people needing more care having insane costs because the cost is not distributed across the population and of people being woefully undercovered when something unexpected happens.
Overall, m
any millions of people are estimated to lose their insurance as a result of this bill.
We are a society. We are young people and old.?We?are sick people and healthy. A healthy person can be sick tomorrow. Wishing all this weren't the case won't make it so. Once again, the Republicans are creating policy based on what they wished were true, instead of what is true. That is their theme of the era.
It has far from universal Republican support. Tea-party types in Congress don't like it?because it?doesn't balance its budget.
The bill was kept in secret until Monday and, now presented?committees have had two to three days to review it and the CBO has not had time to review or comment on it.
[Here](https://ballotpedia.org/United_States_House_of_Representatives_Committee_on_Ways_and_Means)
are the people on the House Ways and Means Committee.
[Here](https://ballotpedia.org/United_States_House_of_Representatives_Committee_on_Energy_and_Commerce)
are the people on the Energy and Commerce committee. Is?your rep in one of these committees?
Your task
TODAY?call your House rep first, then your senators.
Say:
My name is ______ and I'm calling from _______.?I am calling to ask _____ to demand a transparent process for?Paul Ryan's AHCA. This means any votes must wait until the CBO has had a chance to review and provide a score, and committee members and floor members have had adequate time to review and discuss. Can I count on _______ committing publicly to such a transparent process?
Notes
a) Today is International Women's Day and there is an admittedly-hard-to-participate-in women's strike. (Imagine what would happen if EVERY WOMAN laid down her work at home and on the job for the day. It would be an incredible statement, and a lot easier to participate. But, alas, we did not?organized enough for that). If you can, don't do paid or unpaid work, and tell people why. Otherwise, wear red,?do any necessary shopping and business?only at women-owned businesses, and tweet/post your support for women. You too, dudes.
b)?Did you guys get through to your governor and the president yesterday (as well as your members of Congress)?regarding Muslim Ban 2.0? Do call your gov. Mine clearly hadn't been pressed on how he was going to support and protect?Muslim?people in my state.?His office would?benefit from hearing from other Illinoisans. I also did get a chance to leave my comment for Trump, after waiting?on hold for several minutes.

People all over the country are preparing for tomorrow's Women's Strike. Not everyone can strike;

are ways you can participate.

We?need you to be?an ally. Wear red.?Tweet/post that you are a feminist.?Attend a rally (they will go on after work hours).

banning Muslim people?from entering our?country, and it is, predictably, the same cruel and capricious?decree meant to make brown-ness generally and Muslim-ness especially akin to?criminality. [worldwide review](http://www.newyorker.com/news/amy-davidson/trumps-divisive-new-travel-ban?)
" that requires other?countries to provide us information we demand about?their citizens, so we may decide if they may enter. So we are now imposing our capricious,?divisive identifiers on other countries; we are not only destroying our own democracy, but contaminating other countries with our bigotry.
Your task
Or tasks. You have multiple calls today, but just get 'em done, one-two-three(-four-five) and you're done!
First, call the president.?202-456-1111 or 202-456-1414.
Say:
I am an American [citizen] and I am calling because I love my country. Your executive order yesterday?to ban people from six Muslim countries?stomps on so much of what I love about my country. My country is a place for opportunity for all. My country is a place of religious freedom for all. This disgraceful order is unjust, unAmerican,?and will not make us safer.?I am wholly against this horrible order and anything like it. Shame on you.
Then, call your
[House Rep and your Senators](http://govtrack.us)
. This script ripped wholly from
[NIAC](https://www.niacaction.org/virtualrally/)
? thanks, NIAC!

My name is ____ and I live in zip code ______. I am?strongly opposed to Trump?s new executive order re-imposing a ban on travel from Muslim-majority countries. This disgraceful order is inhumane, unjust and un-American and it must be stopped.
The new order, like the original order, is an outrageous assault on American values. It will tear apart families and do nothing to make us safer. I urge the Senator to take immediate legislative action to rescind both orders and ensure that the Trump administration cannot implement its plans for a Muslim ban.
Can I count on the Senator/Representative to take legislative action to rescind the ban?
Then, call your governor.

My name is _____ and I live in zip code _____.
I am
strongly opposed to Trump?s new executive order re-imposing a ban on travel from Muslim-majority countries. It is unjust and un-American and won't make us safer. It is causing fear and panic among our Muslim neighbors in [state], with reason?hate crimes have gone way up across the country. Muslims in our state are valued members of our community and?contributors to our economy. I?would like to know some specific steps for?how Governor _____ plans to protect and support Muslim [your?state-ans]. I'd like him/her to write/call me with an answer. My contact information is _______.
Thank you, Five Minutesers!

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Media sure have grown up in how they cover our walking?Constitutional crisis. If you want a good explanation of just what the heck the deal is with these accusations about wiretapping and Obama and whatnot,
[here](http://www.economist.com/blogs/democracyinamerica/2017/03/45th-president?fsrc=scn%2Fpn%2Fte%2Fbl%2Fed%2F)
is a good article.

This from
[the ACLU](https://www.aclu.org/blog/washington-markup/senate-voting-monday-destroy-obamas-fair-pay-and-safe-workplace-rules)
:
TODAY
the?Senate is voting to roll back a rule that?requires companies that bid on federal contracts over $500,000?to disclose any violations of worker protection laws, such as?workplace safety laws, sexual harassment laws, anti-discrimination laws, and minimum wage and overtime laws. This ROLLBACK of this worker-protection measure?has already passed in the House; see how your rep voted
[here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/votes/115-2017/h76)
.
Your task
Call your Senators today. Say:
My name is _______ and I live in?________. ?I am calling to ask Senator _______ to vote NO?on H. J. Resolution 37, which would eliminate the Fair Pay and Safe Workplaces rules. [for Republicans: Why wouldn't Senator _______ want to support fair pay and safe workplaces? These kinds of protections are important for the exact people Trump swore to protect: regular working people {like me}.]
If you're fired up,
[check](http://www.govtrack.us/congress/votes/115-2017/h76)
how your?House rep voted and tell them you are disgusted that they voted for this resolution/you are glad they voted against it.
Note
Energy flagging? Mine is. It feels redundant and puny to keep calling every day. It feels remote from what is?unfolding in D.C. and across the land.
We are going to lose a lot of battles, but we are going to win?a few at first, and then more as we press on. Through our concerted actions, we are changing the rules of engagement, the potency of various weaponry, and the numbers on the field ?(extended war metaphor FTW!).
That's incredible!
We've already changed so much, starting with ourselves. Think back to what you were doing at this time last year. How many papers were you subscribed to??Did you have?your U.S. members of Congress were programmed into your phone? How frequently did you call them? Did you know who your?state assembly members were? Did you know about?community meetings taking place? Marches??Imagine you?times a million: We are unbelievably more engaged now than we were last year.
The trick is staying that way. We need to do it.
Don't think your Dem member of Congress is going to go on automatic and be a hero without you, and don't think your Republican member of Congress doesn't hear you, and isn't growing concerned about the sustained engagement.
There is a bigger reason to stay engaged:?we have seen what happens when people?in a democracy lose?touch with their?civic responsibilities, because it happened to us.?Right now, we have to work hard?to catch up on and rebuild our
[liberal democratic](http://cs.mcgill.ca/~rwest/wikispeedia/wpcd/wp/l/Liberal_democracy.htm)
institutions and principles. This will take at least a few election cycles. And then?we have to make a habit of dedicating some regular portion of our lives to tending?those institutions unfailingly.?Our country's problems?go far deeper than the elected person in the White House, but I do believe, with a great many of us working together, the solution is in our hands.

NAME: Your five-minute  action item today: Mar. 5, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
[Trump had a meltdown this morning](http://www.cnn.com/2017/03/04/politics/trump-obama-wiretap-tweet/)
, recorded for eternity on Twitter, about investigations into his campaign's and his administration's ties to Russian agents who sought to influence the election. This isn't good, per se, as his lies continue to be unprecedentedly dangerous and ignorant for a sitting president to engage in. But it shows the pressure is on, and if Democratic leaders can manage to resist recklessness and expedience?and the media continues to do its job it can be another piece of evidence of how untrustworthy, tiny,?and unqualified this man is.
...so let's keep going
If you have not yet done
[yesterday's action](https://app.tinyletter.com/#!/messages/3280325/report)
,
please do so now
. Speak out against the Right's weird obsession with?poor women's and young women's?bodies.
Now.?Public education is on the chopping block.
[HR 610](https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/610/all-info)
proposes to repeal Lyndon Johnson's 1965 Elementary and Secondary Education Act (ESEA),?which was a building block of his War on Poverty, and replace it with block grants to states. News flash,
[block grants never work well](http://www.latimes.com/business/hiltzik/la-fi-hiltzik-block-grants-20160325-snap-htmlstory.html)
, particularly for all sorts of vulnerable populations, and in addition?these block grants can be used for vouchers that allow?parents to send?their kids to private?schools (including religious schools)?using public money.
This bill probably isn't going to get out of committee for now, thanks to the efforts of the
[Network for Public Education](https://networkforpubliceducation.org/2017/02/8851/)
and others. But we have definitely seen crazier things pass of late, things that were just the pipe dreams of wing-nuts before this?year. The overall thrust of this entire administration and Congress is to push the U.S. forcibly back into the '50s on most things except unions and free college (G.I. bill)?so gutting?signature LBJ legislation fits right in.
Today, make a?call to your
[U.S. House rep.](https://www.govtrack.us)
[Here](http://edworkforce.house.gov/committee/subcommitteesjurisdictions.htm)
are the members of the Committee on Education and the Workforce; if your rep is on it
definitely
call.?If your rep?is one of the co-sponsors (Harris, R-MD-1; Franks, R-AZ-8; Olson, R-TX-22),
definitely
call.
Say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____.?I am calling to say I oppose HR 610. Opportunity is?American bedrock, and opportunity starts with equal access to education. [add if you want: Thomas Jefferson?made clear
[in?a letter he wrote](https://www.theatlantic.com/national/archive/2011/06/constitutional-myth-4-the-constitution-doesnt-separate-church-and-state/240481/)
describing?the First Amendment that the intent was to?separate church and state, for the protection of both, and HR 610?would destroy that.?I also cannot think of a?legitimate reason to?lower?nutritional standards for lunches. Saving money on the bodies?of children is not only cruel but short-sighted. Nutritious meals are preventative care.]
THANK YOU FIVE-MINUTESERS!
Sources
http://www.cnn.com/2017/03/04/politics/trump-obama-wiretap-tweet/
www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/610/all-info
https://www.theatlantic.com/national/archive/2011/06/constitutional-myth-4-the-constitution-doesnt-separate-church-and-state/240481/
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Mar. 4, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
[Jeff Sessions has recused himself](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/02/us/politics/jeff-sessions-russia-trump-investigation-democrats.html?_r=0)
from any investigation related to Russia's involvement with the Trump campaign or presidency. Jeff Sessions is the Attorney General and one of Trump's earliest and most loyal political supporters, so one would hope this will aid the possibility of a thorough and honest?investigation into this Russia mess.
...so let's keep going
While Trump's administration seems to be destined to come?crashing down in a spectacular?avalanche we can only hope doesn't crush all of us, Congress marches on passing horrible, horrible bills. Let's call about one of those bills today: the effort to
[defund Planned Parenthood](http://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-02-27/abortion-spat-imperils-gop-obamacare-repeal-and-risks-shutdown)
as part of the?ACA replacement?using an action called
[reconciliation](http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=122816822)
, which means?only a simple majority is needed to pass it?it cannot be filibustered.
Planned Parenthood
[provides essential health care](http://nymag.com/thecut/2017/01/misconceptions-about-planned-parenthood.html)
such as cancer screenings and?preventative care?to?2.5 million patients a year, mostly people of color, people with low incomes, and people in rural areas. Its?services include but aren't limited to family?planning and education, birth control, and reproductive health services. Some Planned Parenthoods provide abortion services though not all do.?Please take a moment and read
[January 15's?letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-15-2017)
to reflect on?how family planning has benefitted you, your family, and your community,?and to?consider why abortion services are an essential choice to have accessible to people.
Men, you too. Men, have women's backs please. Men, be vocal?allies. Men, it (often)?takes two to make a baby. Men, you want healthy women and children in your life and in your society.
Your task
Call your elected officials and say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I am calling to tell _____ to vote NO on any attempts to defund Planned Parenthood. These attacks on this health service are unwarranted and seem weirdly obsessive. Taking away people's access to health care and family planning?is cruel, and sick people and families are a burden on the economy and on taxpayers. Paul Ryan's plan is a terrible idea that will hurt, not help, your constituents.
If you know your elected officials are pro-choice, say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I am calling to tell _____ to keep fighting to protect health care and choice by supporting
Planned Parenthood
. These attacks on this health service are unwarranted and seem weirdly obsessive
.
I am asking ______ to please make the case to his/her colleagues that Planned Parenthood offers essential services that help their constituents.
Wait, you're not done! Then call your
[GOVERNOR](https://www.usa.gov/state-governor)
and say:
My name is ______ and I live in _______. I am calling to ask what Governor ______ plans to do protect access to health care and reproductive health services should Congress defund Planned Parenthood.?Having sick people and?reducing access to essential services is more expensive for taxpayers, not less.
What measures are you taking to ensure people and families?receive the care they need and that taxpayers don't get caught in the middle?
I would be very interested in learning the answer to this. Please contact me at [phone] or [email] and let me know the answer. Thank you.
Please leave messages?since it's evening. If a voicemail is full, please make that?call tomorrow morning.
THANK YOU FIVE MINUTESERS!

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
People are gathering once a week throughout the country to protest in front of their elected officials' offices, especially those who won't hold town halls. Until our elected officials conduct themselves sensibly?listen to their constituents,?acknowledge that Trump is a con man, and, start making policy that will
help
people and not hurt them, this?is what will happen. The movement is staying strong.
[This is what democracy looks like](http://www.tampabay.com/news/politics/rubio-is-asked-to-leave-tampa-office-over-disruption-from-weekly-protests/2314829)
.
I'll add that Trump voters are among those constituents that need to be listened to. If more people had been listened to, if policies hadn't been passed for the past 25 years, mostly but not exclusively by Republicans, that have caused economic struggle and closed off opportunity,?we would not have a president trump.
...so let's keep going
So Jeff Sessions had two conversations with the Russian ambassador?to the U.S., Sergey Kislyak,?in 2016, while Sessions was already serving as an official Trump supporter and surrogate, and Sessions didn't disclose this when he was asked about it in a couple different ways during his Attorney General confirmation hearings. He says he spoke with the Russian ambassador?in his capacity as a member of?the Armed Services?committee, not as a Trump stumper; however, the
[Washington?Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/sessions-spoke-twice-with-russian-ambassador-during-trumps-presidential-campaign-justice-officials-say/2017/03/01/77205eda-feac-11e6-99b4-9e613afeb09f_story.html)
asked all 26 other members if they spoke to Kislyak during that time and of the 20 who answered, all said No.
Some top Dems are
[calling for Sessions to resign](http://www.cnn.com/2017/03/02/politics/democrats-sessions-russia-resignation-call/)
. I think that is?unwarranted?and likely?to backfire?at this point; it appears purely partisan. However, he is at the very least?unfit to be involved with any?investigation about communications between the Trump campaign and the?Russian government. If it turns out that he had a larger and unethical or illegal role or willfully lied,?that will emerge during further investigation and at that time resignation could be demanded.
I almost hesitate to return to this item since meanwhile Congress is passing awful awful bills left and right and Trump is signing stupid reactionary executive orders, but the timing seems important on this one?call today.
Your task
Call your representative, your senators, and Paul Ryan and Mitch McConnell (phone numbers below). That's five people; it should still take you only five minutes. Demand an independent nonpartisan commission (
[not just "an investigation"](http://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/2/17/14635966/congress-russia-putin-trump)
) to look into ties between candidate/president trump and Russia, and demand that Sessions recuse himself.
You still have those postcards I asked you to buy, riiiight? You can get 'em, pre-stamped, for like 53 cents at the post office!?If you can't get through, write them a postcard. Problem with their webform is yours will be dumped unless you live in Wisconsin (Ryan) or Kentucky (McConnell), though Ryan does have a Speaker of the House office webform you can use (below).?You could also tweet.
Say for your elected officials:
My name is ______ and my zip code is ______. I am calling to say it has become clear that an
independent nonpartisan commission
must
investigate ties between candidate Trump and the Russian government, and that?Jeff Sessions must recuse himself from any part of that investigation. Based on Sessions' communication with the Russian ambassador in 2016, when?he was also a strong supporter and surrogate for candidate Donald Trump, it is clear that his participation would obstruct the process and its effectiveness. Thank you.
My name is _______ and I'm calling Paul Ryan/Mitch McConnell in his capacity as Speaker of the House/Senate Majority Leader.
I am calling to say it has become clear that an
independent nonpartisan commission
must
investigate ties between candidate Trump and the Russian government, and that?Jeff Sessions
must
recuse himself from any part of that investigation. It is more?clear than ever that
independence
is needed? and that?Sessions' participation?would obstruct that independence. Thank you.
[If asked if you are a constituent: As Speaker of the House/Senate Leader, Ryan/McConnell has a responsibility to more than his home constituency. If he didn't want that, he shouldn't have taken on the role. I am an American and I am extremely worried [for my children and my family]?about our nation's sovereignty and safety and about the number and degree of lies and lack of transparency happening. Ryan/McConnell is in a position to do something about that.

DESCRIPTION:
Good morningish!
It's working...
Arizona was one of several states whose legislatures are aiming?to make participating in a march or rally subject to felony charges. Yes, now our states are making the right to assemble a serious crime. But, because of pressure from people like you, the Arizona Speaker of the House has
[decided not to hear the bill](http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/politics-government/national-politics/article135309914.html)
.
...so let's keep going
Let's turn our attention today to acts of hate and ignorance?happening all over the country and our president's manipulation of those acts.
Last night in his speech?Trump used the death of a Navy SEAL during a raid in Yemen?and the grief of that soldier's wife, to...rationalize? distract from? his horrifying policies and unpresidential conduct. For example, his ordering the?raid in the first place,
[hastily and without sufficient reason](http://www.nbcnews.com/news/investigations/yemen-seal-raid-yielded-no-significant-intelligence-say-officials-n726451)
. And his
[blaming everyone but himself](http://www.theamericanconservative.com/larison/the-botched-yemen-raid-revisited/)
earlier that very same day?for how botched the raid was. And his grudging, belated acknowledgment of
[bomb threats, cemetery?desecrations](http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/28/us/bomb-threats-jewish-centers-jcc/index.html)
, and
[outright murders](http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2017/02/28/suspect-in-kansas-bar-shooting-of-indians-apparently-thought-they-were-iranians/?utm_term=.fece8a8d957e)
that clearly?targeted?the groups of people that Trump himself has targeted in rhetoric and action.?And?his policy of
[publishing weekly reports of immigrants](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/03/trump-scapegoats-unauthorized-immigrants-for-crime/518238/)
(documented and not) who have committed crimes; this is as senseless as publishing reports of people whose names begin with K who have published crimes, and that example helps make clear the purpose of such a list?to provoke fear and hatred toward the targeted group.
[Hitler used this tactic](https://www.ushmm.org/wlc/en/article.php?ModuleId=10007822)
.?I'm not invoking
[Godwin's?Law](https://www.washingtonpost.com/posteverything/wp/2015/12/14/sure-call-trump-a-nazi-just-make-sure-you-know-what-youre-talking-about/?utm_term=.25dabd8fd1b3)
here; Hitler really did.
[Renowned children's authors](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2017/feb/25/australian-childrens-author-mem-fox-detained-by-us-border-control-i-sobbed-like-a-baby)
,
[prestigious historians](http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/french-historian-henry-rousso-us-immigration-deportation-10-hours-detention-holocaust-expert-a7601786.html)
, and, untold numbers of
[brown](http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation-now/2017/02/25/customs-alis-son-wasnt-detained-because-hes-muslim/98419924/)
and?"
[foreign-y](http://www.recode.net/2017/2/28/14764064/nigerian-software-engineer-detained-by-us-customs)
"?people just trying to get to their damned jobs?are being detained, harassed, and, unless they have someone pulling for them, sent back home from our airports.?ICE has been given the go-ahead to be very aggressive with detainments and deportations, but apparently
[little thought has been given to protocol, legality, or consequence](http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2017/02/24/president-trumps-expedited-removal-plan-may-be-illegal/98276078/)
. People are
[preparing to be separated](https://www.apnews.com/cdecb058f4a94810af45189bc7c5444a)
from their children.
This is not presidential.
Your task
Write a letter to the editor of your local paper, post a comment on your local media's?Facebook, or tweet media reminding people of some or all of the above. Here are some samples:
I am extremely disturbed by the tactics Trump is using to provoke irrational fear and distaste for immigrants. For example, his decision to publish a weekly report of immigrants who have committed crimes i
s as senseless as publishing a report of people whose names begin with K who have committed crimes.
There is no evidence whatsoever that immigrants commit more crimes or are a danger in any way; in fact, research shows immigrants commit fewer crimes than native-born people. This tactic mirrors a report published in Nazi Germany called
Der St?rmer
, which?showcased crimes allegedly committed by Jews.?This kind of move is clearly meant to stoke fear and anger against a targeted group. Trump then?doubled down on this idea Tuesday night?by parading the relatives of people killed?by immigrants at his speech.?This is bigotry-baiting in its purest form.?These actions do not reflect American values and?cannot stand.
OR
I am extremely disturbed by the tactics Trump is using to provoke irrational fear and distaste for immigrants.
For example, recent detainments and deportations from airports show an aggressive but capricious and ignorant policy. A children's book author from Australia and a French professor were recently detained and nearly sent home. A Nigerian man was forced to prove he knew coding language to support his claim that he was a software engineer; Muhammed Ali's son was detained and questioned?aggressively about his religion and beliefs.
These actions do not reflect American values and?cannot stand.
OR
I am extremely disturbed by the tactics Trump is using to provoke irrational fear and distaste for immigrants.?For example, his vastly expanded deportation policy has swept up numerous people, including legal residents and citizens, to the benefit of no one at all. There is already a
[gigantic slump in tourism](http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-03-01/donald-trump-slump-could-hurt-us-tourism-industry/8313378)
to the U.S. because of his policies, and naturally these policies will have a chilling effect on immigration of any kind. Who among us does not know a Muslim doctor or restaurant manager, a Latino engineer?or mechanic? This is America. These people, our neighbors, our schoomates, our coworkers, are America.?Make no mistake, Trump's policies are a type of ethnic cleansing.
Tweets:
@[media outlet],
@realDonaldTrump uses #propaganda and fear-mongering just as every demagogue before him. His target: #immigrants.
@[media outlet],
#immigrants commit fewer crimes than native pop. @realDonaldTrump singling them out is race-baiting in its purest form.
@[media outlet],?100 #bombthreats, murderers shouting "get out of my country;" these are @realDonaldTrump's words and actions at work.
THANK YOU FIVE-MINUTESERS. Please write. Make it clear that xenophobic race-baiting and hate-mongering will not stand.

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
People are
[having fun with trying to get their elected officials to engage with them](http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/22/politics/congress-missing-town-halls-trnd/)
, which will engage those voters even?more and make unresponsive elected officials?feel the heat even hotter. People have put absentee members of congress on milk cartoons and billboards and held town halls with cardboard cutouts and empty suits. One group even
[wrote their rep a song](https://youtu.be/YytB-QesZ58)
.
...so let's keep going
Tomorrow, the House Judiciary Committee is scheduled to hear a resolution authored by Rep. Jerry Nadler (D -?N.Y.) that would force a public?inquiry into Trump's conflicts of interest, including his entanglements with Russia and his continued?business dealings, and
[the House Judiciary Committee plans to kill it in committee](http://www.politico.com/story/2017/02/trump-conflicts-house-resolution-235288)
. It would be embarrassing for the Republicans to have to have this go to the floor. But
[even in committee it's dicey for some Republicans](http://thehill.com/blogs/floor-action/scheduling/321113-this-week-trump-makes-first-address-to-congress)
, such as Jason Chaffetz, who has
[already been getting heat](http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/10/514446449/chaffetzs-support-of-trump-brings-boos-and-jeers-at-utah-town-hall)
from his constituents for finding all kinds of reasons to not-investigate Trump, so it's worthwhile making the GOP?extra uncomfortable trying to bury it.
Please call your rep whether?Republican or a Democrat?they all need to hear that this is important to us.
[Here](https://judiciary.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/115th-House-Judiciary-Committee-Updated-21517.pdf)
is a list of all reps on the House Judiciary Committee. It's a large list; perhaps someone in or near your district is on it.
This script is simplified from Indivisible Guide's script?feel free
to use the original
[here](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources-2/2017/2/27/mandate-disclosure-on-trumps-conflicts-of-interest)
.
Your task
If your House rep is already a co-sponsor (check
[here](http://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hres111/details)
),?say:
I?m calling to thank Representative _________ for co-sponsoring House Resolution 111. That's great, as?Trump?s business dealings, connections to Russia, and other conflicts of interest are cause for concern. This is a matter that must be?investigated. Can I also count on ______ to go further by?committing to publicly call?for further congressional investigation into Trump?s corruption?
If your House rep is not a co-sponsor say:
My name is _______ and my zip code is ________. I am calling to ask if Representative _______ is planning to??co-sponsor?House Resolution 111.
[YES]?That?s great! If _______?truly believes, as I do, that Trump?s conflicts of interest are cause for concern, then (s)he should definitely do everything possible to make sure Congress fully investigates potential corruption. This means co-sponsoring bills like House Resolution 111?and making public statements supporting them.
Can you take down my information and let me know when (s)he has co-sponsored and issued a statement?
[NO]?That?s terrible. What that means is _______ is fine with letting Trump use the Oval Office to enrich himself and his family and fine with possible bribery from foreign governments, like Russia.
These conflicts of interest and entanglements are putting the very
safety and sovereignty
of the United States in jeopardy.
I hope ______ will reconsider his/her position and co-sponsor House Resolution 111.
[I DON'T KNOW/I'LL PASS ON YOUR CONCERNS]?That?s disappointing. I am very concerned?that
Trump might be?using?the Oval Office to enrich himself and his family and putting the interests of?foreign governments before our own.
These potential conflicts of interest and entanglements are putting the very
safety and sovereignty?of the United States in jeopardy, and the resolution would allow House members to properly investigate.?I hope ______ will?co-sponsor House Resolution 111. Please take down my information and let me know when (s)he has taken a position.
You can tweet, too:
@[house rep], pls co-sponsor @RepJerryNadler HR 111.
#Conflictsofinterest must be investigated. Democracy, security are at stake.
@[house rep],
thanks for co-sponsoring @RepJerryNadler HR 111. #Conflictsofinterest must be investigated. Democracy, security are at stake.
Note:
Last week we asked for an independent bipartisan commission. I *think* these requests don't conflict, because what this resolution would do is oblige Jeff Sessions to allow the House to look at all non-classified documents pertaining to various potential conflicts of interest, and that investigation could take various forms.?But?I will try to confirm this/provide further explanation.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
It's working...
My U.S. House Rep is great with people issues, especially immigrants,?but doesn't much talk about the environment. I've called him about this, written,?held signs?(nice ones).?Yesterday I called his office to see if they had suggestions for
[yesterday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-24-2017)
and they told me about an upcoming townhall, and some immigration?workshops they were putting on...and a workshop?coming up about energy and the environment. I'm not saying it was ME who convinced him, but he's obviously getting enough calls asking about the environment that he put this on his agenda. Communicating works! I thanked her and told her this issue was important to me and I was so glad to hear about the workshop. Luis Gutierrez, ladies and gentlemen. Doing?his?job.
...so let's keep going
In December, White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said
[of course Trump wouldn't ban media from press briefings; only dictators do that](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/politics/wp/2017/02/24/in-december-spicer-said-barring-media-access-is-what-a-dictatorship-does-today-he-barred-media-access/?utm_term=.7dbe6a91d000)
.?Yesterday,
[Trump banned?key?media?from a press briefing](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2017/feb/24/media-blocked-white-house-briefing-sean-spicer)
. Trump allowed media he perceived as friendly to attend and barred those he perceived as unfriendly. Breitbart,*?Washington Times, and two other right-wing media sites were allowed in, as well as ABC,?CBS, and NBC,?Time,?the Associated?Press, and the Wall Street Journal. The New York Times, CNN, Buzzfeed, LA Times, Politico, and foreign media?were told they were not on "the list" and were barred from entry. (There has never been a list before).
This is an authoritarian administration. In the United States, in our Constitutional democracy, the president does not repeat inflammatory lies and then?banish those who force him to contemplate his own actions. By the way, Trump today said he wouldn't attend the Correspondents' Dinner. So he's a chicken as well as a tyrant.
Two outlets, Time and AP, refused to enter in solidarity with those banned. Wall Street Journal says today it totally would?have refused if it had only known of the ban. Hmm. The networks went in.
Your task
Write this to one or media outlets that were barred (
[NYT](https://myaccount.nytimes.com/membercenter/feedback.html)
,

,

,

,

):
Regarding Friday's president-dictator?press briefing,?I am with you. Thank you for striving to expose Trump and his cohort for who they are.
Write to
[AP](https://www.ap.org/contact-us)
and
[Time](https://secure.customersvc.com/servlet/Show?WESPAGE=td/home.html&MSRSM%20%20%20%20%20AG=TD)
:
Thank you for standing with the media that were barred from Friday's press briefing. The only way we can nip this tyranny in the bud is by standing in solidarity to delegitimize?it. Your actions were important. Thank you.
Write to
[WSJ](https://customercenter.wsj.com/contact)
,
[CBS](http://audienceservices.cbs.com/feedback/feedback.htm)
,
[ABC](http://abcnews.go.com/Site/page?id=3068843&cid=clicksource_4380645_footer_contactus)
,
[NBC](http://contact.nbcnews@nbcuni.com)
:
I am extremely disappointed you chose to attend the "invitation only" press briefing. Trump's move to label some media outlets fake and ban them from Friday's briefing was chilling, and by going along with it you are helping him move the needle toward tyranny. The only way we can nip this danger in the bud is by standing in solidarity to delegitimize?such actions. Shame on you. You have an immense responsibility to the truth and transparency in this era. I hope you consider your roles and responsibilities differently in the future. We are counting on you, and if you are not going to stand up to authoritarianism, you are enabling?it.
Tweet?the White House Correspondents' Association and, wth, to Trump.
The White House Correspondent's?Association has asked people to comment on this event, and so many people have tried that their server crashed. They say they apologize, are working on the issue, and in the mean time please tweet them. I dunno, how about these?
@RealDonaldTrump calling
@WHCA
press "fake," barring them from briefing are textbook authoritarian moves. How very tiny of you. #MediaBan

@realDonaldTrump, you are a tiny dictatorbaby coward. Only allowing press you think are friendy? Sad. #presidentbannon @whca #MediaBan
Call/email
[Trump](https://www.whitehouse.gov/contact/write-or-call)
:

You seem extremely unprepared, and ill-prepared.?How are you going to keep the nation safe from ISIS if you are afraid if journalists?
(*You might recall Breitbart?is not just any old right-wing media site, but the white supremacist ethno-nationalist?media site formerly headed by Steve Bannon,
whose dream is?to
[literally destroy](http://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/24/us/politics/stephen-bannon-cpac-speech.html)

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 25, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
The DNC seems to have no choice but to?be
[decidedly more progressive](http://washingtonmonthly.com/2017/02/21/the-2017-dnc-chair-election-a-cheat-sheet/)
and take some decidedly different steps in their platform, tactics, and election for a new chair, given the pressure from below. And, as Howard Dean said in an interview today on the radio that I can't find online to link to, darnit,?if they dig their heels in against change, our nation full of newly formed?dynamic and organized progressive groups is?going to act anyway.
...so let's keep going
[Trump's immigration plan](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/21/us/politics/dhs-immigration-trump.html?_r=0)
works within the rules already set up, but takes advantage of areas of interpretation to be
[far more sweeping and?far less discerning](http://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/21/us/trump-immigration-policies-deportation.html)
than previous administrations' plans,?and to frankly attack basic human rights.
For example, p
eople may be apprehended and?deported without trial throughout the country; previously people already living in the country (as opposed to found on the border)?were entitled to a trial. Local law enforcement is obliged to enforce?immigration law; imagine the effect on law and order in your city if people are afraid to call the police, go to the hospital,?call 911, and so on. Most chilling to me,
Trump?claims he is going after criminals (which is no change in wording from Obama's policy), but that definition has been widened to include people who are convicted, charged, or
suspected
of a crime?that last could be anyone, couldn't it? On what grounds are you "suspected" of a crime??and the plan also includes prioritizing deporting people who have "abused any program related to public benefits," which first of all calls up this?racist "welfare queen" type?trope, and also is very disturbingly vague. I have like forty cents on my library card, for example.
If you need more?evidence that the Bad Hombres?boogyman?is total, despicable bunk: it's long been documented that
[immigrants commit fewer crimes](https://www.manhattan-institute.org/html/mythical-connection-between-immigrants-and-crime-6305.html)
than citizens, and many employers and entire?industries in the U.S.
[rely on undocumented laborers](http://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-undocumented-workers-industry-impact-0115-biz-20170113-story.html)
who also
[improve our economy](http://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/foreign-policy/203984-illegal-immigrants-benefit-the-us-economy)
. (The ethics of this workforce situation are problematic; I note it?here to point out the stupidity and hypocrisy of Trumpist actions.)
Your task(s)
OK! Today. A few different tasks to choose from or, heck, do all:
1) If you are part of a faith community, please consider working with other interested congregants and/or your director to determine how you can become a part of the network of organizations of all faiths around the country providing comfort, care, advice, and advocacy for immigrants. Every religion speaks of caring for the stranger, and caring for all who seek comfort.
2) Call your elected officials. I know it's a lot, but please do?try to call your STATE elected officials as well: your state senator, state rep, and governor.
Say:
My name is _______ and my zip code is _________.?I am calling to say I oppose the Trump administration's plan regarding?undocumented people. His claims that he is focusing on criminals is false. His methods are cruel. His goals will not help the U.S. economy nor Americans'?safety or opportunity. I'd like ______ to please find ways to oppose this policy [at the state level]. I'd also like ______ to please?work hard with his/her colleagues?to [create a better alternative/create a?stance for the state that is respectful, compassionate,?and productive].
[If your elected official is friendly to this message, add:] Do you have any upcoming workshops and townhalls regarding this subject? Might you be adding such workshops in the future?
Call your mayor or community elected-official (in Chicago we have aldermen). Say:
I am calling to say I support our being a sanctuary city/I would like our city to be a sanctuary city. [Can I count on you to support efforts to become one??Our law enforcement already has a job to do, and making people fearful of calling the police or getting help in an emergency?will definitely not help our city.]
In social media, and/or in an email to your elected representatives,?tell your own family's story. Almost all?of us living here?are?immigrants. We have all been?called dangerous, lazy, and unAmerican when we first arrived?(perhaps we still are). Yet?we, our folks, persisted and raised proud Americans.?You can connect today's news to how your family was treated, and ask others to honestly take a look at themselves and do the same.
About the action asking for an independent bipartisan commission in re Trump & Russia
Subscriber Emily asked me why it's important to ask for a commission instead of an investigation when we are asking our representatives to push on the Russia/Trump connections (
[this letter here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-21-2017)
). The reason is there are several ways Congress can investigate, as
[this great Vox article](http://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2017/2/17/14635966/congress-russia-putin-trump)
outlines.
Right now the
standing committees
(e.g.,?the Senate Judicial Committee, Senate Intelligence, House Ways and Means, House Oversight)?are all controlled by Republicans since they control both Houses,?and it is unlikely they would seriously investigate the issue?they could say they had an investigation, say there's nothing there, and then close the books. Each of
those committees
also have a lot of other things on their plate?so they are also not going to be dedicated to one issue no matter which party controls the committee.
A
bipartisan select committee
ensures that the investigation?is not controlled by Republicans and that the people on the committee are only focusing on the one issue. And an
independent commission
is an even longer-term thing where they do deep investigative research and then come up with recommendations, like they did after 9/11. So while it's good to keep asking for an investigation generally, asking for a bipartisan independent commission is better and?establishes that the?stakes are high and we don't want to just be appeased and move on.
After that step there's an
independent investigator
, but that's led by the executive branch and appointed by the attorney general, um, Jeff Sessions, so...No. He's a huge Trump backer and has been from the start and that will not be independent or reliable.
OKAY THANK YOU FOR READING, FIVE MINUTESERS;?NOW GO FORTH AND ACT! :)

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 24, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Trump and his enablers are railing on the "
[fake protesters](http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/14/politics/democrats-town-halls-chaffetz/)
." This is incredibly frustrating, because it's quite clear from here on the ground that
[the crowds thronging elected officials' offices and town halls are absolutely real](http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2017/02/22/town-halls-republicans/98250238/)
. But the good part is...they know this too. Well, maybe not Trump. That is one?bizarre world he sees behind his eyes that I do not understand. But his congressional enablers?know, and they appear too cowardly and unimaginative to accept it, so they are basically going LA LA LA LA LA I CAN'T HEAR SO THIS ISNT HAPPENING.
So, your efforts?are?working. Thanks!
To his great credit, Mark Sanford (R-SC)
[stayed for almost?three hours after his town hall](https://www.buzzfeed.com/alexislevinson/as-many-republicans-avoid-testy-town-halls-mark-sanford-host?utm_term=.blL9JPP9E#.hnknBxxnb)
to listen and take tough questions from the hundreds of people both inside and outside of the venue, AND he is being a grownup and
[owning that these are real people with real concerns](http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/mark-sanford-town-hall-attendees-real-people-not-manufactured-crowds)
. I guess all those
[vigorous walks on the Appalachian Trail](http://www.politico.com/story/2015/06/mark-sanford-maria-belen-chapur-relationship-119143)
helped him appreciate people's passions.
...so let's keep going
The
[Republicans' plan to replace?the ACA](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/16/us/politics/affordable-care-act-congress.html?_r=0)
outlines 1)?eliminating the Medicaid expansion, which covers 10 million people, in favor of?block grants to states; 2) separating "high-risk" patients (patients that have, have had, or are at risk of getting seriously ill)?from others and putting them in their own insurance and coverage pool; and 3)?replacing?subsidies with health-care savings accounts. These are all awful ideas.
Block grants: Is your state in good financial shape? My state is not in good financial shape. Even in the best prepared?states, somebody?bears the brunt of any dysfunction/shortfall, and it's almost always?the most vulnerable. C
hildren,
people with disabilities, busy working families, and anyone unlucky enough to have happen to them the kinds of things that happen to living things, such as illnesses and injuries,?will lose out.
All states?will need to do?a lot more with a lot less. There are also
[Medicare changes](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/making-sense/medicare-beneficiaries-pay-attention-repeal-replace-debate/)
associated with the GOP plan that?will result in less?coverage, fewer tests and drugs covered, and greater costs for recipients and taxpayers. There is no?plan for how people insured under the current Medicaid/Medicare ACA plan will be covered and there is no meaningful plan for financing the suggested changes.
High-risk pools:
[This has been tried before and has been miserable](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/18/514991567/gop-leaders-urge-return-to-high-risk-insurance-pools-that-critics-call-costly)
. Put all the people who need the greatest amount of care in one insurance pool and have them alone cover it through their insurance payments? What could go wrong? It's extremely expensive both for the insured and the state (that's you, the taxpayers).
This?could be any of us. Any of us could get cancer or pancreatitis?or ms. Any of us could get into a car?accident. Any of us could a newborn in the NICU.
Using health-care savings accounts doesn't work for people who have very little left over to save. Someone making $200,000 a year can put a hell of a lot more into their savings account than someone making $30,000 a year. Think about how that changes your decisions about when and how to seek care, and how those decisions then ripple down through your life.
Your task
Three calls today, your house rep and your two senators.*?You should already have all these numbers in your phone...if you don't
[put em in right now!](https://www.govtrack.us)
Say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _______. I am calling to say I oppose the plan Paul Ryan outlined last week to replace the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare). It does not adequately show how it would maintain coverage for people, where the money it needs?would come from, nor how much the transition itself would cost. The solutions he outlined are inadequate for covering people with serious conditions, busy families spinning a lot of plates, and many others.?I am calling to demand that the ACA be retained and strengthened or, if Congress wants to replace it, go for something based on a
[single-payer system](http://www.politifact.com/wisconsin/statements/2015/sep/11/reid-ribble/donald-trump-wants-replace-obamacare-single-payer-/?utm_source=followedapp.com)
.
THANK YOU FIVE MINUTESERS!
*It's very important for your state elected officials and your governor to be on board with maintaining the consumer protections the ACA guarantees...we'll get to that probably next week.

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Trump's new national security advisor to replace Michael Flynn is Lt. Gen.
[H. R. McMaster](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/20/us/politics/mcmaster-national-security-adviser-trump.html?_r=0)
, who, in addition to having?an excellent best-selling-intellectual-thriller-fiction name, appears to be competent, reasonable, and experienced in his field. Apparently less-crazy heads are prevailing and Trump is actually listening.
...so let's keep going
If you did not do
[yesterday's task](https://app.tinyletter.com/#!/messages/3249753/report)
, please take a look right now. It's quick but important.
Today we are calling our House Reps to oppose two bills introduced by Steve King of Iowa. This info thanks to
[Indivisible Chicago](https://www.indivisiblechicago.com/take-action-1/2017/2/14/wednesday-february-15th-union-busting-school-busting-bond-busting)
.* HR785 is a National Right-to-Work Act, which lets employees benefit from union contracts without paying dues. RTW laws weaken unions and lowers wages for workers by an average of 3.2%. A companion bill, HR744, is the latest iteration of the often introduced Truth in Employment Act, purporting to give employers the right to not hire workers that have previously been affiliated with unions, for fear that they might try to unionize other employees (as is their right).
Your task
Call your Representative and say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is _______. I am asking ________ to vote No on HR785 and HR744. These bills hurt the laborers and other working people Trump says he wants to help.
If you are writing or if you want to expound, add: The time that people think of when they say America was "great" was the decades after World War II?the heyday of unions. Unions allowed people the opportunity to provide for both their families and their health, and to therefore feel safe, confident, and optimistic while they built the economy.
Unions, plus free college for GIs, were largely responsible for our strong prospering middle class when the country was "great." To make the country great [again], vote NO on HR785 and?HR744.
Sample tweet:
@[your rep]#Unions are what made America great. HR785 and 744 hurt the workers Trump claims he wants to help. Vote NO.
King has introduced this in the past and GovTrack thinks it's unlikely it will pass?but I mean it's within the realm of possibility that we could say goodbye to the EPA and Roe v Wade (I think, largely due to DeVos' lack of experience, the Ed Dept. is safe, but I could be wrong), so who knows. And, as I sit here in Illinois, surrounded by previously blue, union-strong states that are now right-to-work and red...we've seen how it happens. It seems best to take precautions.
THANK YOU, FIVE MINUTESERS!
*If you live in Illinois, Indivisible Chicago is an excellent source for state-level actions.
Source
www.nytimes.com/2017/02/20/us/politics/mcmaster-national-security-adviser-trump.html?_r=0

DESCRIPTION:

SO SORRY for the very late letter today. Work obligations unfolded on their schedule today, not mine, and then there was an unexpected visit to the vet (all's well). At some point, life was going to happen in lieu of a timely letter, and we reached that point today.

You can also tweet or Facebook your elected officials a similar message.?It's important to ask for an

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb 21, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
Efforts to repeal the ACA are slowing down, because...duh!
[No one wants their health care taken away!](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/19/us/politics/affordable-care-act-critics.html?mwrsm=Facebook&_r=0)
Of course people want it improved, and Republicans are sweating trying to find a way to do that that doesn't anger insurers, pharmaceutical companies and other beneficiaries of the current system. Good luck, guys.
...so let's keep going
It's President's Day, and there are
["Not My President" actions](https://www.resistancecalendar.org)
all over the country. If you can and are so moved,
[find an event](https://www.resistancecalendar.org)
and go to it.
The way I see it, though,?making today about Trump strikes me as?a wasted opportunity.?President's Day is about honoring great presidents who have made our country better. Our current president?takes up way too much of my brainspace?already and elected officials' offices are closed today, so my task for you today is to?do something refreshingly affirmative.
Your task
Think about what makes a great president. Make a list. Think about what each of those things looks like.
What does integrity look like? What does judgment look like? What does compassion look like? What does equanimity under pressure look like? What does intelligence look like? What does strategy in the service of the country look like? What does humility look like? What does vision look like??What does wisdom look like? What does goodness look like?
Choose a few words and?phrases, and then write a letter and send it to
[Trump](https://www.whitehouse.gov/contact#page)
,
[Pence](https://www.facebook.com/GovernorMikePence/)
,
[McConnell](https://www.mcconnell.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/contactform)
, Paul
[Ryan](http://www.speaker.gov/contact)
, and your elected representatives. And maybe your local paper. And?post it on social media. Let's get people thinking ahead to what we want. Because can you think of any Democrat who could win a Presidential race right now??I can't. We need to start envisioning leaders, paying attention?to who rises up, and cultivating them.
Dear __________:
Today is President's Day. On this day, we honor our best presidents. I am writing to remind you what a great leader looks like.
The president?I want has integrity.?The president I want has judgment[...etc. Use my list above or write your own.]
Please re-focus yourself on what makes a good leader, and demand it of yourself, your colleagues, and our democracy.
Sincerely,
[if you have more than five minutes, add a paragraph like this one before that last sentence and the sign-off:]?A great president says what s/he means, means what s/he says, and?puts?the well-being of the American people first.?A great president makes tough decisions when needed, but never forsakes thorough vetting, honesty,?and compassion in doing so.?A great president sees opportunity in change?and plans carefully to ensure people are prepared for such challenges. A great president believes in the common good.?A great president?sees strength and vibrancy?in our diverse society?and learns from the mistakes we make in managing that diversity.?A great president sees unfairness and calls it out when s/he sees it.?A great president is sure-footed enough to confidently confront a bully but light-footed enough to use only the very?strength or strategy needed. A great president recognizes his or her power and has the humility and?wisdom to channel it through service. A great president is capable of walking in another person's shoes, and does so, regularly.
[add a paragraph like this for an even longer version:] Since our current president holds none of these characteristics, I prefer to think about someone who does. [Write about a president you admire, or different components of different presidents you admire, or heck, write about someone in your own life with these qualities.]
THANK YOU FIVE-MINUTESERS!
Source
www.nytimes.com/2017/02/19/us/politics/affordable-care-act-critics.html?mwrsm=Facebook&_r=0
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 20, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
It's working...
Don Lemon, who has said and done some dumb unjournalistic things in the past,
[completely shut?down this commentator](https://youtu.be/5s-qTV2Eez8)
who proclaimed some straightforward facts that?he didn't want to talk about to be "fake news." It is?a?relief and so important to see outlets like CNN and people like Don Lemon?understand and embrace their?role defending truth in these scary times.
...so let's keep going
The other day Trump called the media "
[the enemy of the people](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/02/18/trump-called-the-news-media-an-enemy-of-the-american-people-heres-a-history-of-the-term/?utm_term=.7e24dc3f5ff0)
."?Today, let's let Trump know how we feel about the media.
Your task
[Complete his survey](https://gop.com/mainstream-media-accountability-survey/)
about whether the media is biased; then pass it on to your friends. I filled it out twice (under two different name/emails)?once checking the "Other" box and writing?commentary,?and once using the Yes and No boxes as much as possible given their construction.?Evidently?(I can't verify this), the simple?Yesses?and?Nos are the answers that will be tallied...the commentary was honestly probably not meaningful but just felt really good.
If you have another few minutes,
[tweet Don Lemon](https://twitter.com/donlemon)
or your favorite media outlet thanking them for standing up for the facts.
If you have more than five minutes
Register for
[this phone-in meeting?tonight](https://act.moveon.org/survey/readytoresist4?source=indivisible&link_id=6&can_id=5d9ef3e02d7616fc44cc4e38ae26086e&email_referrer=tonight-national-planning-call-to-kick-off-congressional-recess&email_subject=tonight-national-planning-call-to-kick-off-congressional-recess)
with Indivisible and some partners. Once you are registered, you?can listen to the recording later if the time scheduled isn't convenient. They last an hour, but I don't set aside an hour?I listen while doing laundry, making dinner, in transit, or on a walk.
You will learn a ton about some main progressive?priorities and about approaching your elected official. Elected officials will be in their home districts this coming week and
[allegedly](http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2017/02/17/gop-finds-fix-for-chaotic-town-halls-dont-hold-them/?utm_term=.c8662e817b8b)
there to speak with constituents. Even if you can't or don't want to attend, learning about what's going on is a good thing.
One silver lining to?this political nightmare: it's been very good for prompting people to learn more about
[participatory democracy](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/18/us/politics/town-hall-protests-obamacare.html?_r=0)
!
