NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
?It's working....
Retired Vice Admiral Robert Harward, Trump's pick for replacing Michael Flynn as national security adviser, declined the honor. He publicly cited polite reasons, but privately called the administration an inflexible and chaotic "
[shit sandwich](http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/02/trumps-pick-to-replace-flynn-turns-down-job.html)
."
Of course Trump is largely responsible for this reputation all by himself, but the constant pushback on the part of the public and (at our insistence) Congressional Democrats certainly helps.
So let's keep going
Have you heard of
[Countable](https://www.countable.us)
? It's an app that tells you at a glance what Congress is voting on and?what your elected officials are voting. It's great, but I have to tell you that it's not for the faint of heart these days. It feels like everything that is dear is being demolished.
[A modest rule](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-congress-regulations-idUSKBN15H2PC)
asking industry not to dump toxins in streams.
[Funding for health clinics](http://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/2017/02/14/congress-challenge-rule-protecting-planned-parenthood-grants/97903856/)
for poor people.
[Treating unemployed people like adult humans](http://www.usnews.com/news/articles/2017-02-14/house-gop-reopens-push-to-drug-test-the-unemployed)
deserving of basic?respect. All these are being disposed of as quickly as possible.
It's demoralizing. I'm not gonna lie. It's hard to take.
But it's important to take the long view.
The long view includes 2018 and 2020. So we need to preserve our union and our voting rights until then, and then get these awful people?out of office.
Your task
[Support Stephanie Hansen](https://secure.actblue.com/contribute/page/keepdeblue#website)
in who is running for an empty?state senate seat in Delaware?(the previous senator is now lieutenant governor). The special election is February 25. If she wins, Delaware will remain
[one of the six](https://ballotpedia.org/State_government_trifectas)
?six out of fifty?states that has a democratic governor, senate, and house assembly (the Republicans have twenty-five such "trifectas").?(
[Here](https://www.flippable.org/why-state-races)
is a compelling reminder of why retaining/gaining state seats?is so. so. so. important, and
[here](https://www.flippable.org/learn/)
are more really useful things to know. Thanks very much to Flippable.org for these).
[Here's](http://secure.actblue.com/contribute/page/keepdeblue#website)
that link again to support Stephanie Hansen?even just $3 helps.
Some more resources
If you are interested in focusing on 2018 and 2020?in helping keep state blue districts?blue and flipping state red districts to blue?
[Code Blue](https://www.codeblue.team)
and
[Sister District](https://www.sisterdistrict.com)
both?focus?on that. Even if you're in a deep-blue district you can help through organizations like these.
Sister District has affiliates in all fifty states and
[is focusing on downballot (state-level) races](https://www.sisterdistrict.com/what-we-do/)
all over the country in 2017. Code Blue is also focused on downballot races; their website only mentions a few states, but I know?there are some other affiliates by state because I know there is an Illinois one that is not listed on the website. So, try messaging?the main site and asking if they can give you contact info for an affiliate near you.*
?
Other groups that work to flip districts?are
[swingleft.org](http://swingleft.org)
and, of course, the one I referenced and linked to a lot today,
[flippable.org](https://www.flippable.org)
.
Right now, as far as I understand, Swing Left is?focusing on US districts (not state level); often Flippable does, too, though this race in Delaware is a state one.?I say "right now" because a lot of these groups are growing and changing by the minute, with so many newly minted activists trying to figure out where they fit.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 18, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
ARRRRGGGGHhhhh
[Scott Pruitt was just confirmed](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/17/us/politics/scott-pruitt-environmental-protection-agency.html?_r=0)
, which is just the stupidest. The stupidest.
Still call your Senators, with the following script. Then please read on for the other commentary and action information that was in the first version of today's letter.
Script for Republican senators except Susan Collins plus Dems Manchin and Heitkamp:
I am calling to say I am disgusted with Senator _______'s vote to confirm Scott Pruitt. His record shows amply he does not have the interests of the American people's health in mind. It is a crime that this vote was taken today in light of the
[Oklahoma judge's orders](http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/politics/ct-scott-pruitt-epa-emails-20170216-story.html)
yesterday to turn over communications documents related to the oil, gas, and coal companies. I expect the communications Pruitt produces as a result of the judge's order will be examined thoroughly and he will be held accountable.
I would like a phone call or email back explaining Senator _______'s choice to confirm Pruitt. My contact information is __________________.
On a separate note, I also want to alert Senator ______ to my extreme concern about the
[communications alleged between Russian officials](http://www.npr.org/2017/02/16/515624391/nobody-that-i-know-of-trump-denies-campaign-contacts-with-russia)
and Trump campaign officials. When will a bipartisan investigatory panel be formed?
Script for Democratic senators except Manchin and Heitkamp plus R Susan Collins:
I am calling to say I am disgusted with the Senate's vote to confirm Scott Pruitt. I want to thank Senator _____ for voting No, but also ask why he/she did not work to delay the vote in light of the Oklahoma judge's orders yesterday to turn over communications documents related to the oil, gas, and coal companies. This is a dangerous and horrible choice and our health is going to suffer for it. I am asking Senator ______ to make sure the communications Pruitt produces as a result of the judge's order will be examined thoroughly and he will be held accountable.?I would appreciate a phone call or email back. My contact information is __________________.
On a separate note, I also want to alert Senator ______ to my extreme concern about the
[communications alleged between Russian officials](http://www.npr.org/2017/02/16/515624391/nobody-that-i-know-of-trump-denies-campaign-contacts-with-russia)
and Trump campaign officials. When will a bipartisan investigatory panel be formed?
Sources
https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/17/us/politics/scott-pruitt-environmental-protection-agency.html?_r=0
www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/politics/ct-scott-pruitt-epa-emails-20170216-story.html
www.npr.org/2017/02/16/515624391/nobody-that-i-know-of-trump-denies-campaign-contacts-with-russia
Okay!
Here's the original letter from today, minus Task 1.
It's working...
Restaurants and other
[businesses all over the country closed](http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2017/02/16/a-day-without-immigrants-strike/97965460/)
in support of A Day Without Immigrants, choosing to lose thousands of dollars in order to stand in solidarity with their immigrant employees and show others how vital immigrants are to our nation's economy, culture, and very existence.
Next week elected representatives are expected to be in their home districts and
[many are avoiding meetings and town halls](http://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/politics/washingtons-gop-members-of-congress-under-pressure-to-face-their-voters/)
. This isn't good, of course, but it shows they are really feeling the heat. And well they should.
...so let's keep going
Next week, Congress has a "state work period," which means your elected officials will be at their home offices. If at all possible, go down to see them in person. At this point, you might not be able to actually get in to sit in their offices and see them, but you can show up outside and/or you can go to a town hall.
Your task today is to arm?yourself with information,
whether you have time to do more next week or not.
[Here](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources-2/2017/2/11/town-hall-tips-fact-sheet?link_id=4&can_id=8f9891ddae34cf619c28ce36c23ca57f&source=email-reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_referrer=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_subject=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible)
and
[here](http://preview.mailerlite.com/k7z3v4/563672799336468542/i0b1/)
are
some excellent information resources on town halls, and
[here](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources-2/2017/2/12/missing-members-of-congress-action-plan?link_id=5&can_id=8f9891ddae34cf619c28ce36c23ca57f&source=email-reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_referrer=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_subject=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible)
is information on what to do if your member of Congress shirks his/her responsibility to hold town halls and meet with constituents.
[Here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yq1NT9DZ2z3B8ixhid894e77u9rN5XIgOwWtTW72IYA/htmlview?sle=true)
and
[here](http://heritageaction.com/2017/02/town-hall-list/)
are lists of town halls scheduled (so far--keep checking the Google Doc especially for updates). On a slightly different note
[here](http://actionforabettertomorrow.org/blog/2017/2/13/action-request-a-meeting-with-your-representative-senators)
is some great info on asking for a constituent meeting (one-on-one or a small group meeting).
For the town halls or demonstrations, you don't have to go it alone?connect?up with
[a local Indivisible Guide group](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/show-up)
or issues-oriented group such as?Sierra Club or an immigrants' rights group. I know
[Planned Parenthood](http://plannedparenthoodevents.ngpvanhost.com/)
has a handy tool for finding supporters near you who are planning?to see your legislator?other groups?might as well.
Your goal for this action is to make sure you know whether your reps have a town hall planned for next week and where/when you can show up en masse in front of their office (or actually talk to them!). Again?even if you can't actually go next week, knowledge is still power, plus you could pass the info onto friends or post it in social media.
Tactics
Subscriber Zabrina wrote me to ask
why we are not laser-focused
on
[the Russia thing](http://www.npr.org/2017/02/16/515624391/nobody-that-i-know-of-trump-denies-campaign-contacts-with-russia)
as an impeachable offense. It's a good question, and I thought others might be interested. My answer is two-fold?why not focus on the Russia collusion allegations, and why not demand impeachment.
I have made a conscious choice not to focus on any one issue exclusively, partly?because different things feel alarming and urgent to different people for different reasons, but mainly because a big part of our awful challenge right now is that Trump is not the only problem. A virulently right-wing strain of Republicans has unfettered control right now of the House and Congress, two-thirds of the states' governorships, and a good number of both branches of state assemblies as well, and they will remain after Trump is gone. There are no checks on them, and these are not Eisenhower or, shoot, even Nixon Republicans. While we are all focused on the latest Trump craziness, Congress is passing horrible horrible stuff left and right. Well, more like right and righter.
So we have this super dangerously unpredictable and ignorant clown to contend with, and then we also have these super power-hungry party-over-country zealots who in some ways are worse because they are far more organized and smart and they know how our system works and how to manipulate it. And we MUST weaken the control and power of that right-wing juggernaut while also trying not to have Trump get us killed. So I am loathe to focus exclusively on one egregious new development at the cost of letting other horrible things go uncommented on.
We must be PREPARED for 2018 and 2020, and if we think Trump being gone is all we need, the right wing will maintain or expand its control.
As for demanding impeachment...there is plenty to investigate under impeachment charges, for sure, but it also looks like he's tangling himself up pretty bad in his own rope, and I think the more he does to weaken his own self, and the more losses he suffers, the more he undermines his own legitimacy, the more death-by-a-thousand-paper-cuts people like you and me (and, at our insistence, Democratic elected officials) are causing by resisting every thing, the more amateurish and bungling his advisors look...the easier it will be to take him down when the time comes. I think we also want to not martyr him. He needs to lose legitimacy among his own supporters too. I keep thinking about the Supreme Court vote legalizing marriage equality; the lawyers had one chance to bring the issue to the Supreme Court so they wanted to make damned sure they had as solid a case as possible both in terms of legal argument and in terms of the mood of the country.
I hope this helps. Thanks for reading! And THANK YOU FOR YOUR ACTIONS.
Sources
http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2017/02/16/a-day-without-immigrants-strike/97965460/
http://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/politics/washingtons-gop-members-of-congress-under-pressure-to-face-their-voters/

took himself out of the running due to lack of support, and now EPA nominee
[Scott Pruitt](https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2017/01/trumps-appointees-conflicts-of-interest-a-crib-sheet/512711/#Pruitt)
is potentially in trouble. Let's get this EPA-suing, pollution-loving, climate-change denying worst-possible-candidate outta there. A judge from Oklahoma (where Pruitt was attorney general) has
[ordered Pruitt to turn over thousands of documents](http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/politics/ct-scott-pruitt-epa-emails-20170216-story.html)
related to his communications with coal, gas, and oil industry execs by Tuesday. Unfortunately, he might be confirmed today.
Call both of your Senators and say:
My name is ____ and I am a constituent. I am calling to say the Senate must not hold a confirmation vote on Scott Pruitt until Senator ____ and the rest of the Senators have had a chance to review the communications ordered turned over by that Oklahoma judge on Thursday. Pruitt has until Tuesday to turn over the documentation, so the hearing should be scheduled late next at week at earliest. These documents are entirely germane to the confirmation, since there are unresolved questions of conflict of interest related to them. I am asking Senator _____ to demand a delay in the Pruitt vote until late next week.
On a separate note, I also want to alert Senator ______ to my extreme concern about the
[communications alleged between Russian officials](http://www.npr.org/2017/02/16/515624391/nobody-that-i-know-of-trump-denies-campaign-contacts-with-russia)
and Trump campaign officials. Do you know when a bipartisan investigatory panel will be formed on this?
Task 2
Next week, Congress has a "state work period," which means your elected officials will be at their home offices. If at all possible, go down to see them in person. At this point, you might not be able to actually get in to sit in their offices and see them, but you can show up outside and/or you can go to a town hall.
Your task today is to arm?yourself with information, whether you have time to do more next week or not.
[Here](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources-2/2017/2/11/town-hall-tips-fact-sheet?link_id=4&can_id=8f9891ddae34cf619c28ce36c23ca57f&source=email-reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_referrer=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_subject=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible)
and
[here](http://preview.mailerlite.com/k7z3v4/563672799336468542/i0b1/)
are
some excellent information resources on town halls, and
[here](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources-2/2017/2/12/missing-members-of-congress-action-plan?link_id=5&can_id=8f9891ddae34cf619c28ce36c23ca57f&source=email-reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_referrer=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible-7&email_subject=reclaim-recess-with-indivisible)
is information on what to do if your member of Congress shirks his/her responsibility to hold town halls and meet with constituents.
[Here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yq1NT9DZ2z3B8ixhid894e77u9rN5XIgOwWtTW72IYA/htmlview?sle=true)
and
[here](http://heritageaction.com/2017/02/town-hall-list/)
are lists of town halls scheduled (so far--keep checking the Google Doc especially for updates). On a slightly different note
[here](http://actionforabettertomorrow.org/blog/2017/2/13/action-request-a-meeting-with-your-representative-senators)
is some great info on asking for a constituent meeting (one-on-one or a small group meeting).
For the town halls or demonstrations, you don't have to go it alone?connect?up with
[a local Indivisible Guide group](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/show-up)
or issues-oriented group such as?Sierra Club or an immigrants' rights group. I know
[Planned Parenthood](http://plannedparenthoodevents.ngpvanhost.com)
has a handy tool for finding supporters near you who are planning?to see your legislator?other groups?might as well.
Your goal for this action is to make sure you know whether your reps have a town hall planned for next week and where/when you can show up en masse in front of their office (or actually talk to them!). Again?even if you can't actually go next week, knowledge is still power, plus you could pass the info onto friends or post it in social media.
Tactics
Subscriber Zabrina wrote me to ask why we are not laser-focused on the Russia thing as an impeachable offense. It's a good question, and I thought others might be interested. My answer is two-fold?why not focus on the Russia collusion allegations, and why not demand impeachment.
I have made a conscious choice not to focus on any one issue exclusively, partly?because different things feel alarming and urgent to different people for different reasons, but mainly because a big part of our awful challenge right now is that Trump is not the only problem. A virulently right-wing strain of Republicans has unfettered control right now of the House and Congress, two-thirds of the states' governorships, and a good number of both branches of state assemblies as well, and they will remain after Trump is gone. There are no checks on them, and these are not Eisenhower or, shoot, even Nixon Republicans. While we are all focused on the latest Trump craziness, Congress is passing horrible horrible stuff left and right. Well, more like right and righter.
So we have this super dangerously unpredictable and ignorant clown to contend with, and then we also have these super power-hungry party-over-country zealots who in some ways are worse because they are far more organized and smart and they know how our system works and how to manipulate it. And we MUST weaken the control and power of that right-wing juggernaut while also trying not to have Trump get us killed. So I am loathe to focus exclusively on one egregious new development at the cost of letting other horrible things go uncommented on.
We must be PREPARED for 2018 and 2020, and if we think Trump being gone is all we need, the right wing will maintain or expand its control.
As for demanding impeachment...there is plenty to investigate under impeachment charges, for sure, but it also looks like he's tangling himself up pretty bad in his own rope, and I think the more he does to weaken his own self, and the more losses he suffers, the more he undermines his own legitimacy, the more death-by-a-thousand-paper-cuts people like you and me (and, at our insistence, Democratic elected officials) are causing by resisting every thing, the more amateurish and bungling his advisors look...the easier it will be to take him down when the time comes. I think we also want to not martyr him. He needs to lose legitimacy among his own supporters too. I keep thinking about the Supreme Court vote legalizing marriage equality; the lawyers had one chance to bring the issue to the Supreme Court so they wanted to make damned sure they had as solid a case as possible both in terms of legal argument and in terms of the mood of the country.
I hope this helps. Thanks for reading! And THANK YOU FOR YOUR ACTIONS.

It's working...
[Andrew Puzder withdrew](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/15/us/politics/andrew-puzder-withdrew-labor-secretary.html)

You have one call and one act of awareness to do today.
Please make the call immediately
, with my apologies for the late notice. They are up for a vote today.
Task 1
The House is voting on three bills meant to start the process of gutting the Endangered Species Act and other protections for the plants and animals that need us as much as we need them. We
are
in an eco
system
, y'all.
Say:
My name is _____ and my zip code is _____.?I am calling to tell ______ that I strongly oppose three bills up for a vote today:
[HR 424](https://secure.defenders.org/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=3145&s_src=3WDW1704JHTXX&s_subsrc=hr424)
,
[HR 717](http://thehill.com/opinion/letters/319758-congress-must-not-pass-endangered-species-reform-bill)
, and
[House Joint Resolution?69](https://secure.humanesociety.org/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=7313)
.
I expect Representative ______ to vote against these bills.
[More, if you wish to add it:]?There is no good reason?to weaken the Endangered Species Act, and this bill?relies on the uninformed opinions of people who know nothing about ecosystems or animals. We humans have taken over the planet and?we are now?responsible for the existence of the other plants and animals here, like it or not. We rely on plants and animals as much as they rely on us. As for the wolf bill?and the grizzly bear?bill, we have much more informed and less cruel ways of understanding and managing wildlife these days. We know better than these bills. I am asking ______ to oppose these bills.
[
More potential add-on?:?The Bible offers?plenty of ways to protect people and the earth, but?I don't come by using those arguments authentically. Maybe some of you can help me. Any feedback on the following?argument? Let me know, and use it if it speaks to you and/or your associates and elected officials.]
The Bible tells us we have dominion over animals. This means that
[it is our responsibility to protect?them](https://bible.org/article/christian-environmentalism)
. Dominion means stewardship, not destruction. Everything in the world is connected and we are playing with fire when we act with pride or greed?against that notion.
Task 2
A lot of restaurants and other businesses?are following D.C.'s lead in observing
[A?Day Without Immigrants](http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/16/515555428/a-day-without-immigrants-promises-a-national-strike-thursday)
today. This is in response to Trump's call to build his wall?and other?nonsense words?and deeds?that are making our nation
[a hostile place for immigrants](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/updates/trumps-orders-immigration-rattle-educators/)
and
[people perceived to be immigrants](http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/14/us/trump-us-immigration-reaction/)
. Today,?offer understanding and support of?your local places that are closed or operating with a skeleton crew (e.g., if they are closed,?take a moment to write?on their Facebook page: "Thank you for supporting your staff today, the Day Without Immigrants. We wouldn't be America if we didn't have immigrants"). Shop and eat today?at places that are?donating to immigration or anti-hate causes. If there's a march or demonstration in your area, consider attending for whatever amount of time you can. If you are an immigrant or a business owner, you can play?a larger role and strike, or support?your employees in?striking,?yourself.
THANK YOU, FIVE MINUTESERS!

Secondly, the House is poised to

.
Men, we need your voices on this as much as we need women's voices, if not more. Call.

My name is ____ and my zip code is _____. I?am calling for two reasons. First, I am disappointed that the House Ways and Means Committee has declined to request Trump's tax returns. Trump has said he won't release his taxes because Americans don't care, but we do. I want Representative ______ to?find a way to request his tax returns.

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
Today, Sunday, get to something you didn't get to this week:
1) Help gray wolves stay non-extinct
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-6-2017)
. Please. They need you. The Endangered Species Act, which has rescued 99% of its more than 2000 listed animals from extinction and is on the chopping block, needs you.
2) Learn about your state reps, and why it's seriously important that you follow them,
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-9-2017)
.
3) Call or email your elected officials in support of bills examining Trumpist conflicts of interest
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-11-2017)
.
4) Set yourself up to learn about state-specific bills
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-11-2017-1)
.
[Tuesday's](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-7-2017)
action was mostly about Scott Pruitt and we'll revisit that this week.
A note: I've noticed that when you look at letters in the archive, the font varies. That's odd, and not graphically pleasing. Sorry about that. I wish I had control over it so I could fix it.
THANK YOU, FIVE MINUTESERS!
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 12, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
I named yesterday's letter Feb 11. I'm sure you all figured it out?much faster than I did (today's letter?almost went out as Feb. 12!).
It's working...
Remember
[Jan. 2's five-minute action](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-2-2017)
to support public-school science teacher
[Cheryl Turpin](https://cherylturpinforvb.com)
in the Virginia Beach?special election Jan. 10? She lost?by 362?votes, the smallest margin in the district's history. Galvanized by the support, she?is now running for that?seat in the regular election in November. (
[Donate](https://secure.actblue.com/contribute/page/ct362)
if you like ? she is?suggesting $3.62 to symbolize the votes.)
So let's keep going...
[Thursday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-9-2017)
was about why
civic participation and activism on the?state level
is crucial.?So now you've signed up for
[your state assembly elected officials'](https://openstates.org/find_your_legislator/)
newsletters and put their contact info in your phone, riiiiight?
Good! Now that you have the people to contact, how do you learn about state issues?
Turns out today's topic was an
extremely
difficult task to spell out. It's actually really really rilly
rilly
hard to give?people all over the country?general hints for learning about?state-level issues. Go figure.
Your task
Your five minute task today is to sign yourself up for one or more email lists.
I know this will be?annoying for a while; eblasts, money requests, blergh.
But bear with me. It's the best way for you to build your knowledge about your own state.
Here is that task (and beyond):
1.?Find your local
[Indivisible](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/local-action-groups)
group?and your local
[Organizing for Action](https://www.ofa.us/get-involved/connect/)
group and?sign up?to get both their emails.*
If these groups are not very active in your area, figure out where?in?your state they are and sign up for that affiliate.??Even if you can't or don't want to make any of these groups' meetings, pay close attention to their meeting notes and action items related to?state?initiatives.
2. Notice which state issues concern or interest you the most. Contact your Indivisible and?OFA groups and ask them which local organizations are opposing?or supporting?certain bills.?You can then contact and follow those groups.
Make sure you find and sign up with the
local
affiliates of national groups?the local affiliates?are state?focused and action oriented in a way that the national groups?will not be.
For example, the local affiliates of the
[Sierra Club](http://www.sierraclub.org/near-you)
,
[Moms Demand Action/Everytown](http://act.everytown.org/signup/Join-Moms/?source=mdmo_MomsMain&utm_source=md_m_&utm_medium=_o&utm_campaign=MomsMain)
, and
[Showing Up for Racial Justice](http://www.showingupforracialjustice.org/affiliated_groups_local_contacts)
all direct viewers toward working on
state-level issues
.
From these groups,
even if you don't attend?meetings or events, you will learn?which bills are moving through your state and can?call?your state elected officials to oppose/support the bills.?If the organizations?offer
petitions, use those as a guide to call rather than as a substitute.
3.?Once you are paying attention, you will also become aware of local-local groups, not just the local affiliates of national groups. Parents' groups,?faith groups, and neighborhood groups, for example, often do amazing work and really have their ear to the ground about legislation coming up.?Once again, if you can?join or volunteer for those groups, great, but if not, that's fine?you can learn from them about important developments in your state and call your state elected officials.
For example, in Chicago the
[Community Renewal Society](http://www.communityrenewalsociety.org)
is a faith-based organization doing?amazing prisoners' rights/criminal justice reform stuff, among other things,?and
[Raise Your Hand Illinois](http://www.raiseyourhandaction.org)
is composed of a crew of kick-ass parents?fighting for public education.
4.?In the course of all this?you will likely learn which elected state officials champion the issues that are important to you. Even if they are not your elected official, start following them; their websites and?social media pages will be a great resource for learning about developments on those issues.
For example, in Illinois, Sara?Feigenholtz co-sponsored a bill to get rid of
[Illinois' "trigger law,"](http://chicagotonight.wttw.com/2016/12/12/illinois-lawmakers-look-expand-protect-abortion-rights)
passed in 1973,?which would make abortion immediately illegal should Roe fall. Sara?Feigenholtz is not my state rep, but she sure has my gratitude and my ear.
5. If you subscribe to a bunch of things to figure out what you're most interested in, at any point you can unburden yourself of all those emails by?unsubscribing to some?once you figure out what the best sources are for you.
New subscribers,?I promise you that the vast majority of actions really are just about five minutes. This five-step process situation?is?anomalous.
Fun with free civic-participation tools!
Subscriber Kari asked what Maxine Water's bill's number was (because her rep's?office asked her). It didn't say anywhere on Maxine Waters' link, but I went to
[govtrack.us](http://govtrack.us)
, clicked to browse bills, and then searched using her name in quotes and the word "Russia." The bill came up in the list of possibilities ?
[here's](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/115/hconres15)
the direct link to what I found. So! It's good to be reminded?there are these amazing tools at our fingertips. Waters' bill?by the way?is House Congressional Resolution 15.
*Also download
[Indivisible's freakin amazing guide](https://www.indivisibleguide.com/resources-3/)
to getting your elected officials to do what you want. It's simple and effective.
THANK YOU FIVE MINUTESERS! STATE POLITICS?IT'S NOT JUST FOR WONKS ANYMORE!
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 11, 2017

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
It's working...
[The Ninth Circuit rejected Trump's bid](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/09/us/politics/appeals-court-trump-travel-ban.html)
to reinstate his capricious and illegal executive order banning Muslims and refugees from entering the country.?This is just one?battle of a long?war?a?more airtight order could be created, Congress could create similar legislation, Trump could appeal?but it's a good win. Yay lawyers, law, and judiciary!
...so let's keep going
[Yesterday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-9-2017)
made the case for the importance of state-level civic participation and activism. We'll return to that tomorrow. Today, let's make some calls.
The conflicts of interest of Trump and his administration staff?are
[many and ridiculous](https://corrupt.af)
,?so let's focus on a couple key ones.?These suggestions thanks to
[reactletter.com](https://www.reactletter.com)
. You can find the links supporting these actions?at their letter
[here](http://us14.campaign-archive2.com/?u=34bf9c62b5c76a26e2e6e912d&id=de26196d8a)
, though I also compulsively added most of them below.
Call
[your House Rep](https://www.govtrack.us)
Say:
I am extremely concerned about Donald Trump's continuing conflicts of interest.
I am asking Representative _____ to?support or, better yet, co-sponsor,
[Representative Waters? bill to investigate](https://waters.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congresswoman-waters-introduces-legislation-urging-investigation)
President Trump?s ties to Russia and cyberattacks.?Please also find a means to
[press for Donald Trump's taxes](http://money.cnn.com/2017/02/07/news/economy/trump-tax-returns/)
to be released. I care a lot about his taxes and about the fact that he won't release them.
Call
[your Senators](https://www.govtrack.us)
:
Say:
I am extremely concerned about Donald Trump's continuing conflicts of interest. I am asking Senator _____ to please support the
[Russia Review Act](http://edition.cnn.com/2017/02/07/politics/russia-sanctions-gop-senators-donald-trump/)
. Please also find a means to
[press for Donald Trump's taxes](http://money.cnn.com/2017/02/07/news/economy/trump-tax-returns/)
to be released. I care a lot about his taxes and about the fact that he won't release them.
These people are co-sponsoring the Russia Review Act, so adjust your script accordingly by?thanking them and asking them to keep pushing if one is your Senator:
John McCain, R-AZ
Marco Rubio, R-FL
Sherrod Brown, D-OH
Claire McCaskill, D-MO
Ben Cardin, D-MD
Lindsey Graham, R-SC
These people have the power to request?tax?returns from the Secretary of Treasury as Chairs of Finance Committee/Joint Committee on Taxation/House Ways and Means Committee respectively, so push accordingly if you are from IA,?UT, or TX-8.
Sen Chuck Grassley,?R-IA
Sen?Orrin Hatch,?R-UT
House Rep, Kevin Brady
Quick bonus
Email the House Oversight Committee (
[oversight.house.gov/whistle/](https://oversight.house.gov/whistle/)
)
Copy and paste (and change as you wish) this:
I am extremely concerned about Donald Trump's continuing conflicts of interest. Please investigate all of the following:
1) Russia's inappropriate ties to our election process, and the possibility that Trump and his supporters knew of these ties;
2) Trump's inadequate-to-absent divestment?from?his business holdings, and the subsequent personal?wealth and influence?he has gained from entities here in the U.S. and all over the world?as a result;
3) Trump's refusal to release his taxes;
4) Trump's repeated threats?and?intimidation aimed at?individuals and corporations;
5) Trump's orders and actions intended?to circumvent our established system of checks and balances.
This committee is overseen by Jason Chaffetz,?who was gleefully smacking his lips at the years of investigations he had pre-lined up for Clinton but who has yet to agree to investigate anything Trump's done (though he finally squeaked out some concern about Kellyanne Conway's
[ethics-shattering plug for Ivanka merch](http://actionforabettertomorrow.org/blog/2017/2/9/action-kellyanne-conway-just-broke-the-law-on-live-tv)
), and?whose constituents have been finally demanding action, as you can see from
[this extremely satisfying video](http://www.cnn.com/videos/politics/2017/02/10/chaffetz-town-hall-booing-do-your-job-chant-jnd-vstop-orig.cnn)
.
[Here](http://corrupt.af)
and
[here](https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2017/02/donald-trump-conflicts-of-interests/508382/)
are a couple resources if you want to learn more about the incredible amount and variety of corruption?Trump and his administration are swimming in?so far.
THANKS, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

DESCRIPTION:
Good morn...afternoon!
Oh,
[where to start](http://gph.is/1qO4hYT)
. We could go?the
[kleptocratic grabs](https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2017/02/donald-trump-conflicts-of-interests/508382/)
route.?We could go the
[House dumping the Elections Commission](http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/trump-fears-fraud-gop-eliminates-election-commission-45328264)
route, the
[continuing horror show of cabinet appointees](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/02/trump-cabinet-tracker/510527/)
route,?the House bills to
[eliminate the EPA](http://www.sfgate.com/politics/article/Lawmakers-introduce-bill-to-end-EPA-10910411.php)
[and the Dept. of Education](http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/02/09/514148945/about-that-bill-abolishing-the-department-of-education)
(even if the sponsors?are just posturing, these actions reveal a dangerous contempt for our government by elected?members of our very same government), the
[environmental carnage](http://www.nationalparkstraveler.com/2017/02/change-administrations-puts-zion-national-park-bind-over-drilling-proposal)
route, the plan to take the pressure off white supremacists by
[revamping a U.S. counter-extremism program](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-extremists-program-exclusiv-idUSKBN15G5VO)
...
I think we're going to go big picture today.
The fact is, Trump's?choices for cabinet make sense?to his advisors?and our Republican Congress: Bannon?has stated many times over that his goal is to
[literally destroy our country's structure](http://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/steve-bannon-will-lead-trumps-white-house)
and?we know today's
[right-wing thinking](http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2016/06/charles-koch-wants-to-be-the-next-bernie-sanders.html)
mirrors?that of a high-school boy's thinking after getting his mind blown by
[Ayn Rand](https://newrepublic.com/article/69239/wealthcare-0)
. So absolutely this administration and this Republican Congress are going to work as fast as possible to dismantle agencies that exist to protect people and?the common good.
?
W
e don't have to wait to see how this turns out. We've
seen what places with no government?look like and
[it is pretty hellish](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/making-sense/column-this-is-what-happens-when-you-take-ayn-rand-seriously/)
.
[Very hellish](http://www.cfr.org/fragile-or-failed-states/failed-states-world-terror/p4733)
. But here we are.
Even if Trump gets impeached or resigns, a?far right-wing apparatus remains and will gleefully?continue in this vein ? unefettered by Trump's stupid amateur illegal?mistakes, actually.
What this means is, a ton of things are going to be kicked down?to the states, regardless of whether they have the money or the will to manage them.
You MUST get involved with your state.
Your health, your?civil rights, your environment, your air and water, your reproductive agency, your criminal justice and policing system, your voting rights, your kids' education, your community's paths for immigrants and refugees ? protections and opportunities in these areas?WILL be decimated?with this administration and Congress.
You must make sure that not only your district?but the district next door and next door to that has progressive leadership
or is on the path toward progressive leadership in 2018 and 2020. You must ensure your governor's office has the interests of the people of your state in mind.?Blue-stater? Doesn't matter. There are lots of red districts in your deep-blue state led by tea-partiers who hate library bonds and public parks, I guarantee you.
This is a nationwide letter so I can't speak to a specific five-minute task?in your specific state. But I can point you to a couple steps so state-level tasks will find their way to you.
Your task today
is one of those steps:
Okay finally! Your task
Find out who your state senator and state house?representative are
[using openstates.org](https://openstates.org/find_your_legislator/)
; then click on their names to
check out bills they've sponsored and recent votes
. Openstates.org is?pretty sweet (
[give them money](https://www.generosity.com/fundraising/open-states-general-support-fund)
if you are so moved).
Then go to your state officials'?websites to put their phone numbers into your phone
and sign up for their mailing list/newsletter
.?They need to know you care and you need to know what they are doing and not doing. While you're there, peruse their website and get familiar with how they present themselves and their issues of interest.
It's working
You know how Mitch McConnell silenced Elizabeth Warren?yesterday? His words,?"
[She was warned. She was given and explanation. Nevertheless,?she persisted](https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2017/02/nevertheless-she-persisted-and-the-age-of-the-weaponized-meme/516012/)
" perfectly summarize?every story about?women's struggle?for opportunity, equity, respect,?and safety throughout history, and now the?phrase has become a sort of joyful battlecry against the Trumpist Right. Next time you are feeling cowed by things, remember
[#ShePersisted](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23shepersisted&src=typd)
.
Also, the Democrats in Senate have been staying up all?night?and slowing down all day to willfully make?the confirmation processes as painful as possible ? because we asked them to. Shoot 'em a thank you message on social media.
OK! BYE! LOOK UP YOUR STATE REPS! THANK YOU!

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
[Betsy Devos was confirmed](http://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-38875924)
to be Secretary of Education, which I find astonishing ?could one additional Republican not admit that she has no qualifications? ??and
[Jeff Sessions](http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/opinion/commentary/ct-jeff-sessions-civil-rights-drugs-20170120-story.html)
is set to be voted on today, Wednesday. Call each of your Senators. Then tweet McConnell about?his horrible behavior.
Task 1
For Democratic senators, say:
I am calling from zip code ______. I?want to thank Senator _____ for doing his/her part to
[make the confirmation process for both DeVos and Sessions?very challenging](http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-democrats-plan-late-night-oppose-ag-nominee-sessions-n718066)
.?I am asking him/her to?continue?to?do everything possible to block Jeff Sessions' nomination.
For Republican senators except Susan Collins and Lisa Murkowski:
I am calling from zip code ______.
I am extremely disappointed in Senator _____'s vote for Betsy Devos.?I would like a phone call or email back explaining?this mystifying support for a
[clearly unqualified person](http://www.newyorker.com/news/daily-comment/the-betsy-devos-confirmation-debacle)
. My email?address/phone number is?_______. ?I am also calling to say I am strongly opposed to Jeff Sessions for Attorney General and I expect Senator _______ to vote No.
If your Senator is Susan Collins or Lisa Murkowski:
I am calling from zip code ______. I?appreciate Senator ______ putting our country's families over her party by voting No on Betsy DeVos,?but wish she could have influenced her colleagues. I am also calling to say I am strongly opposed to Jeff Sessions for Attorney General and I expect Senator _______ to vote No..
Task 2
Send a tweet real quick.
Yesterday
[Mitch McConnell invoked a Senate?rule about maintaining decorum?to shut?Elizabeth Warren up](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/warren-violates-arcane-rule-sparking-senate-dustup/)
. She was not being indecorous; she was reading a 1986 letter?from Coretta Scott King about Jeff Sessions. He silenced her?because he didn't want to hear it. She is now not?allowed, somehow, to speak on Jeff Sessions until the hearing.
Search Mitch McConnell or?#LetLizSpeak?on Twitter and you'll find some good'uns?to retweet,?and/or tweet your own, such as one of the following:
@SenateMajLdr You misuse the #Senate,?an institution you are tasked with stewarding, to silence someone you disagree with. UnAmerican.
@SenateMajLdr Silencing @SenWarren for reading a letter written?by a #civilrights leader...keep it classy. #LetLizSpeak
@SenateMajLdr blocking Garland #indecorous. Stacking cabinet hearings indecorous. Lying to consolidate power indecorous. Silence yourself.
A note
It is disgusting that Betsy Devos was confirmed. There is an excellent?chance Jeff Sessions will be, too. I feel those pangs of angry, scared helplessness, oh yes I do. But ? even when we lose battles, we are building footholds toward a later?win, and we are?costing the?Trumpists political capital and momentum. Remember that.
We also know our enemies now. How much do you know about Betsy Devos? Probably a lot. How much do you know about Jeff Sessions? Use that information to your advantage.?Volunteer at your local school.
Get involved with your local school board. Find and support a?community empowerment organization or a prisoners' rights group. Protect your own community by making?it as healthy as can be.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 8, 2017

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
The Palatine protest featured in
[Saturday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-4-2017)
has made national news
[several](http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/constituents-push-back-lawmakers-cancel-town-halls)
[times](https://www.thenewcivilrightsmovement.com/johnwright/california_congress_member)
[over](http://www.msnbc.com/rachel-maddow-show/public-events-republicans-hounded-over-anti-health-care-plans)
. You guys got a first scoop :-D. Bravo to those 6th district heros! (No outside forces helping, despite what the obviously scared RNC is saying.) I have adapted the letter to a blog post on the inimitable
[ElaineSir.com](http://elainesir.com/midwest-story-trump-era/)
.
Okay! Scott Pruitt is up to be confirmed as head of the EPA.
You might recall that the EPA is the agency responsible for ensuring our air, water, and soil does not get so poisoned that we get sick. More info below the task.
Your task
Check your Senators' websites/Facebook pages to see if they have a stance on Scott Pruitt.
If they have taken a stance opposing Scott Pruitt, say:
My name is _____ and I'm ?calling from zip code ______. I would like to thank ______ for his/her stance opposing Scott Pruitt. I'd like him/her to please remain vocal and strong in his/her opposition and to speak to his/her colleagues about it.
If they have taken a stance supporting Pruitt or have remained silent, say:
My name is _____ and I'm ?calling from zip code ______. I am calling because I am opposed to Scott Pruitt's nomination for EPA director. Pruitt's conflicts of interest are very concerning. Additionally, a?strong and independent EPA is essential to my health and yours. I will consider a vote for Pruitt a vote against the health of my family.
Another quick task
Quick. SO quick.
Got Twitter? Good. The House "Science" Panel, which is stacked with climate-change deniers and science attackers,
[had a meeting this morning](https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/house-science-panel-to-hold-hearing-on-ldquo-making-the-epa-great-again-rdquo/)
which likely included discussing a piece of EPA-crippling legislation that has been chair Lamar Smith's long held dream. Some of you early subscribers may remember
[we've called this panel before,](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-dec-2-2016)
about climate-change denying information they retweeted from Breitbart.
Go to @HouseScience and retweet from the alternative EPA, NASA, and other "unofficial" science agencies (since Trump silenced the actual agencies). And/or tweet something yourself, such as:
@HouseScience
@LamarSmithTX21
, burying facts does not make things better. Shame on you.
@HouseScience @LamarSmithTX21 blocking peer-reviewed science will hurt all of us. We see you.
@HouseScience @LamarSmithTX21 You and your families are healthy and safe because of the EPA. @ActualEPAFacts
Bonus
If you have a Republican senator, call and tell them you oppose Betsy DeVos's nomination for Secretary of Education.
[Here's](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-18-2017)
a previous letter with links to sources.
Background
As we've discussed before in this space, Pruitt is
[maybe the most inappropriate pick possible](http://mediamatters.org/blog/2017/01/20/eight-things-we-learned-scott-pruitt-s-epa-confirmation-hearing/215070)
. He is a lawyer who has spent his career fighting on behalf of companies who have violated EPA regulations. He is, in fact, currently embroiled in lawsuits against the very agency he is testifying to become head of. In word and deed he is openly hostile to the EPA and its work, and in word and deed he openly puts corporate interests before human health interests. He will not accept that human-influenced climate change is real.
[Hundreds of former EPA officials have signed a letter imploring senators to reject Pruitt's nomination.](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2017/02/06/hundreds-of-current-former-epa-employees-urge-senate-to-reject-trumps-nominee-for-the-agency/?utm_term=.ff48e93d1c71)
It's working
Wondering if making a phone call really matters?
[It does](http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/progressives-are-demanding-obstruction-senators-are-listening-n715466)
.
[It does](http://m.startribune.com/hello-people-swamp-congress-with-calls-in-era-of-trump/412653953/?section=politics)
. Thank you for your continued focus.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 7, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
The Endangered Species Act came into being in 1973.?Of the more than 2000 animals listed on it, 99% have come back from certain?extinction because of the Act!?That includes our national symbol, the bald eagle, and that is an astonishing success rate. The Act works.
Congress and soon-to-be?Secretary of the Interior
[Ryan Zinke](http://scorecard.lcv.org/moc/ryan-zinke)
want?to dump the Endangered Species Act, starting with chipping away at protections for specific wildlife.?House Resolution bill HR424 and its companion bill in Senate, S124,
[eliminate?protections for grey wolves](https://secure.defenders.org/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=3147&s_src=3WDW1704MHTXX&s_subsrc=hero-home-s164)
and are?the first of many similar bills to follow.
Why should we care about wolves? Some might feel an inherent connection to the natural world, of course. But even if you don't, the fact is?you cannot consider yourself separate from it. You are part of it.?We all are. Plants oxygenate and?clean our air. Plants and animals clean our water and soil. We eat plants, animals who eat plants, and animals who eat animals, and when those food sources are too manipulated?in too unbalanced of a system, people get sick.
[True story](http://io9.gizmodo.com/5927112/chinas-worst-self-inflicted-disaster-the-campaign-to-wipe-out-the-common-sparrow)
:?In 1958, Mao Tze-Tung initiated a sparrow eradication campaign throughout China. Sparrows ate rice grains from crops, and Mao reasoned that, for every million?sparrows killed, 60,000 more people could eat. The campaign worked, and China was literally emptied of sparrows. But, without sparrows to control the insect population, scourges of locusts soon descended upon rice fields, eating?vastly more rice grains than the birds would have. The sparrow campaign was a major contributor to the great famine of 1958-1961, when 30 million people died of starvation.
We can't always predict the consequences of our actions, and we can't make major?changes to the natural world without repercussions
.
Also, wolves are magnificent. Next time you have twenty minutes, say,?in the car or at the bus stop or making dinner or folding clothes, listen to
[this Snap Judgment podcast](http://www.npr.org/2014/05/23/314974039/06-female)
.
Your task
Today, please?call your elected officials. While please everyone call, it's especially important for those who live in or have close ties to
ID, MI, MN, WI, and WY
to call. Those five states have reps who
[co-sponsored the House bill](http://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/424/cosponsors)
, including two Democrats. And MN,?WI, and WY senators
[co-sponsored the Senate bill](https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/senate-bill/164/cosponsors)
; the MN and WI co-sponsors are Democrats.
Say:
My name is ______ and my zip code is ______. I am asking Representative [or?Senator]?_______ to oppose HR 424 [or Senate bill?S124]. Wolves have?just barely?come back from the brink of extinction. We rely on wildlife and wilderness for a healthy ecosystem, which we in turn need to stay healthy.
Numbers may be busy because people have become extremely civically engaged. Please keep trying, or try alternate?numbers, and if that fails, pop 'em a postcard.
I learned an unfortunate thing about faxes ? I was so excited about that idea! But faxes these days just get delivered by?email, so, while it is still a fine way to contact your rep,?it is not really a workaround to the emails-are-easy-to-ignore issue. Calls and letters/postcards still seem best.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
Today, choose an action from the past week you haven't done yet and do it. You still have some postcards from when you got them last week, right? If your reps' voicemails are all full, jot down your note to them on a postcard and throw it in the mail.
Pro tip: I learned yesterday that you can buy pre-stamped postcards from the post office for $0.38 each. Total deal! Please stack up.
Here are the actions from the past several days. Please pick one you haven't done and do it.
Read a hopeful story, unfolding in real time when I wrote yesterday,?and donate money (just a tiny amount! $3?)?to some important special races coming up
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-4-2017)
.
Tell your Senators to vote No on Gorsuch for SCOTUS,?or, better, in my opinion, tell them McConnell went too far and badly damaged our system and our trust in our Congress, and you are demanding your senators block any nominee other than Merrick Garland. Scripts and more info
[here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-3-2017)
.
Since you're just leaving messages/mailing?postcards today, narrow down
[Thursday's post](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-2-2017)
to one of the topics listed. Might I suggest demanding that Steve Bannon be removed from the National Security Council and the chair of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and director of national intelligence be readmitted in their full capacity. Read more info on Bannon in
[Monday's letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-30-2017)
.
If you wish to do

again because there were some updates?between Wednesday and Thurday, and please call from there. Essentially, the actions are: Tell your senators NO?on revoking the Stream Protection Rule and the BLM Methane and Waste Prevention Rule. Tell your House rep NO on HR 622.
If you have a Republican senator, please tell them to vote NO on Betsy DeVos (the Dems are already doing so, but you can still call and give your Dem senators your support). Info

.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 5, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Oh. Good afternoon. It took me a while to write this one.
Let me tell you a story. I live in a deep-blue city surrounded by a lot of?red?(and some blue)?districts. Democrats and progressive people ? and even moderate?Republicans ??have resigned themselves to not being represented in these red districts.*?They might vote, but the incumbents run unopposed or barely opposed, and constituents,?feeling isolated,?don't see a path toward getting?involved.
My mother lives in a district like this and has often remarked, with resignation,
that she is the only Democrat within?30 square miles.
In fact, my mother lives?in one of the least contested of these red districts,?the 6th district, represented by Republican Peter Roskam. He has won handily since 2007. He
[never meets with constituents](http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20170202/BLOGS02/170209952/political-heat-rising-on-gops-roskam)
.?He is as Republican?as can be, enthusiastically supporting?all the far-right stuff the Republican leadership has championed this millennium?and offering zero resistance to Trump.
The Democratic Party of DuPage County asserted in its January community?meeting that they were not going to bother trying to flip?the 6th district; he was too strong. Their strategy for the state lay elsewhere.
But everything has changed since the election, even if the official Democratic Party affiliates?are the last to know it.?After the election, in the amazing nationwide movement that could be known as the Progressive?Activism Facebook Revolution, the group Action 6th District was born.
I don't know how involved you all are on Facebook, but there are groups of thousands, tens of thousands, hundreds of thousands of progressive people mobilizing for action there. This is one reason lawyers were able to get on the ground immediately upon Trump's executive order targeting Muslims and refugees.
Action 6th District has 640 people in it, and their purpose is to demand that Roskam hear them and be accountable to them. T
he group's?admin, Holly, has done incredible work to keep the group focused and action-oriented. Another group,
called
6th District of Illinois - Holding Rep. Peter Roskam Accountable, has done the same, and there are others as well
.
Members of these groups
call, write, and show?up, every day.?They have been?reprimanded and?belittled by staff. They have been refused meetings,?email addresses, even staffers' names. They have had
[doors closed on them](http://www.chicagotribune.com/suburbs/aurora-beacon-news/news/ct-abn-roskam-helath-care-meeting-canceled-st-0202-20170201-story.html)
,
[meetings changed](http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20170202/BLOGS02/170209952/political-heat-rising-on-gops-roskam)
from public to private. But they have persisted?and now
[their efforts have earned attention on the national stage](http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/peter-roskam-cancels-obamacare-meeting)
.
The Democratic Party of DuPage County
[just this past week announced a change in strategy,](http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/local/politics/ct-roskam-hultgren-trump-backlash-met-20170203-story.html)
publicly stating that flipping the 6th district is one of their focuses. Holly and her cohort did that. When the people lead, the leaders will follow.
This morning Peter Roskam held his?public-turned-private event at a local Party office.?Yesterday,?a Republican committeeman asserted that the uninvited people outside would not be heard and
[scoffed that there would be maybe three protesters and 100 meeting attendees](http://www.journal-topics.com/news/article_36ba593e-ea2c-11e6-b581-a70c07fe97c3.html)
. Accounts and media?from this morning?show over 500?protesters!
Roskam snuck out the back door after the meeting.
A reminder: These folks?"protested" because their elected official refuses?to meet with them.?Their signs said things like "Let's talk ? I'll buy the coffee," and "We see you but you won't see us," and "Talk to us ? please?" and "Where's Roskam?" with the rep's face in a Where's Waldo hat.
Here's?a great
[video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=35vgwYz3AyM&feature=youtu.be)
;
[NBC5](http://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local/peter-roskam-protest-palatine-412780383.html)
was the first to report but there will be more as the day goes on
.
Your task!
All this to say,
blue activism within red districts work.
YOU can make a huge difference. Ask Holly. Even if you live in a blue district,?you can support fellow progressives?in?red districts by
showing family and friends?there the power of community action and?helping them get?involved.
That's what I've done with my mother.
You can also help?through sites like
flippable.org, sisterdistrict.com, and swingleft.org.?Your task today is to do a Flippable.org action.
Flippable has identified
[three upcoming special elections](https://www.flippable.org/upcoming-elections)
that need your help. Please donate even just $3 to one or each of them. It makes a difference. The first one, for
[Stephanie Hansen](https://secure.actblue.com/contribute/page/keepdeblue#website)
, is most crucial as well as most urgent.
Note
*We're relatively lucky in my state of?Illinois in that, while the districts are gerrymandered, they are not done so as unconstitutionally as in other states, such as
[North Carolina](http://www.snopes.com/2016/11/30/federal-court-strikes-down-north-carolina-racial-gerrymander/)
and
[Wisconsin](https://www.rt.com/usa/375351-wisconsin-redistricting-legislative-unconstitutional/)
, where Republicans have essentially buried Democratic votes in the way they drew the districts after the 2010 census. Finally, seven years later,?the courts seem to be on it,?but this is one major reason so many state houses and the U.S. Houses are so red.
Representation in state houses as well as U.S. Congress is dangerously lopsided, as the Republicans executed
[a series of?savvy and diabolical strategies?for a total takeover](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2015/03/04/the-remarkable-republican-takeover-of-state-legislatures-in-1-chart/?utm_term=.fd5ddda49b28)
after Obama's first election. It's not just Trump ? our country is terribly unbalanced right now, capsizing?to the right. We all need to act.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 4, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good...afternoon!
So the new Supreme Court nominee,
[Neil Gorsuch, is a surprisingly good pick](http://www.npr.org/2017/01/31/511850519/who-is-neil-gorsuch-trumps-first-pick-for-the-supreme-court)
(pronounced GOR-sitch). He is philosophically a Scalia?copy and was one of the lower-court judges who ruled?with Hobby Lobby to allow employers?to muscle into employees' personal lives and snatch away birth control, and he?will make decisions that will infuriate us and ruin our lives. But?he is not a crackpot, at least.
[He is qualified](http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-gorsuch-supreme-court-20170131-story.html)
.?That's the best we could possibly hope for
given this c
ongress/p
resident/situation.
There are two ways you can go on this. My scripts are long again. Sorry not sorry this time. Adjust to your level of passion and time.
1) Call your Senators and say:
I want?Senator _______ to thoroughly investigate Supreme Court nominee Gorsuch as exhaustively as possible. I'd like you to?focus?specifically on his interpretations of the Constitution that allow him to get into the?pants of private citizens such as the millions and millions of people?in this country
[who use contraception](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/fact-checker/wp/2016/11/18/the-claim-that-99-percent-of-women-have-used-birth-control/?utm_term=.8bc78d3d8217)
.??Then I want Senator _______ to vote No.
2) Call your Senators and say:
[Republicans]: I am calling about the Supreme Court nominee, Neil Gorsuch.
[Anyone besides Merrick Garland?must be blocked](http://www.newsweek.com/why-neil-gorsuch-must-not-be-confirmed-supreme-court-eichenwald-551429)
.?Mitch McConnell stole Merrick Garland's chance to even be heard. McConnell committed an unprecedented and damaging?overreach in doing this that we voters will never forget and will always hold you, as a Republican, accountable for. McConnell has?destroyed the trust and the procedure around a hallowed Constitutional process. I am demanding that you and your colleagues in Senate?make it right?vote No on Gorsuch and any other nominee until?Merrick Garland is re-introduced.
[Democrats]:
I am calling about the Supreme Court nominee, Neil Gorsuch.
[Anyone besides Merrick Garland?must be blocked](http://www.newsweek.com/why-neil-gorsuch-must-not-be-confirmed-supreme-court-eichenwald-551429)
.?Mitch McConnell stole Merrick Garland's chance to even be heard.?McConnell committed an unprecedented and damaging?overreach in doing this that we voters will never forget, and we are demanding that Senate Democrats not forget it either.
Senator _______ and his/her colleagues?have the power to obstruct all candidates?and they must do it. The Republicans have shown over and over and over again that they will put party over country.?The Democrats must ?finally? step up and stop them.?The Democrats must stop fearing threats and possibilities, for example McConnell toppling the filibuster rule. Fine. Take that risk. Show some guts and fight. Save our Constitution. The Democrats must decide as a block to vote No?on anyone but?Garland.
You just might barely?be able to detect that my chosen path is the second. McConnell and this generation of Republican elected officials have
[pulled the football out from under the feet](http://trevinwax.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/1957.gif)
of the hapless, dull, wanting-to-play-by-the-rules Democrats over and over and over and over and over and over and over. Enough is enough is enough. McConnell's Garland move is just unforgivable. The Democrats must learn to fight back. You can't cooperate with bullies. You need to outsmart them and then punch their lights out.
But, if you think operating through compromise,?symbolic gestures, and good faith has been working?for us lately, sure,?go for option 1.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!
Sources
http://www.npr.org/2017/01/31/511850519/who-is-neil-gorsuch-trumps-first-pick-for-the-supreme-court
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/fact-checker/wp/2016/11/18/the-claim-that-99-percent-of-women-have-used-birth-control/?utm_term=.8bc78d3d8217?<--note that the common figure that 99% if women have used birth control is not at all the same as the percent of sexually active women who use contraception, such as the pill. It's important to be accurate so we can't be accused of not being so.
http://www.newsweek.com/why-neil-gorsuch-must-not-be-confirmed-supreme-court-eichenwald-551429
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb 3, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Calling works! Jason?Chaffetz
[dressed up in his best camo](https://www.instagram.com/p/BP_zOxEF0-Q/)
and withdrew HR?621, which aimed to?sell off public lands to the?benefit of no American people, though he somehow managed to
[blame Bill Clinton for the bill he, Chaffetz, authored](https://www.denverite.com/utah-rep-jason-chaffetz-withdraws-bill-sold-off-public-land-colorado-states-28638/)
. The companion bill (HR?622), which?says BLM and forest service cannot have federal law-enforcement resources, is still in play and should be fought. Unfortunately the two other bills
[we called about yesterday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-feb-1-2017)
passed through the House?and go to the Senate.
As you know, I generally try to focus on just one topic, but I am taking a page from my friend Victoria's playbook and asking you to snow your elected officials with?several short topics today. We gotta get on top of the avalanche here.
I'm really working on shorter scripts. :) My initial tactic was to?keep?scripts short?and then add background info for your own reading below and/or in links, but there has been some?Script Creep. So! Back to quick scripts. Each of your three calls below?will?be short, literally under two minutes.
Your task
Call your House Rep and say:
1) Please support?Representative?Murphy of?Florida?in
[her bill to protect the National Security Council from interference](http://www.orlandoweekly.com/Blogs/archives/2017/02/01/stephanie-murphy-files-bill-that-would-remove-stephen-bannon-from-national-security-council)
.
[Steve Bannon](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/30/opinion/president-bannon.html)
is a clear and present?danger to our democracy and our national security.
2) Please reject HR?622.
HR 621 was withdrawn because it was a bad bill; so is 622. It
makes public lands less usable.
3) I am extremely concerned about the reckless and confrontational conversations President Trump has been having with our allies, Mexico and Australia, and others too. This shows either extreme incompetence or a willful desire to threaten our country's safety and success. The American people will not stand for it or for their congressional representatives going along with it.
Call each Senator?and say:
1) Please oppose upcoming?bills that?revoke the?Stream Protection Rule and the BLM Methane and Waste Prevention Rule. The stream rule is a modest measure that?protects?people like you and me from drinking industrial debris. The methane rule makes?American taxpayers money from industrial cleanup and also allows us?to breathe easier. There is no good rationale for either of these bills.
2) Please do
[everything possible](http://www.usnews.com/news/politics/articles/2017-01-31/steve-bannon-on-national-security-council-may-require-senate-confirmation)
to remove Steve?Bannon from the National Security Council. Bannon is a
clear and present
danger to our democracy and our national security and the American people will not stand for Senators going along with him in charge.
3) Please oppose the confirmation of Jeff Sessions, Betsy DeVos,* and Mick Mulvaney.
[Jeff Sessions](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/01/us/politics/jeff-sessions-approved-as-attorney-general-by-senate-committee.html)
has proven unable to uphold law over party.
[Betsy DeVos](http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/01/politics/collins-murkowski-to-vote-no-on-education-secretary-nominee/index.html)
has zero experience in public education.
[Mick Mulvaney](https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/16/us/politics/mick-mulvaney-office-management-budget-trump.html)
holds troubling views on Medicare, Social Security, and the debt ceiling.
Thank you.
Note
*DeVos is 50-50 now with the Senate, because all Dems are voting No and?Collins (R-ME) and Murkowski (R-AK) have broken with party to vote No. Please tailor this part of your message accordingly. The DeVos vote is very soon,?maybe today. If news breaks that she's confirmed/rejected?before you get a chance to call, change the script?to thank/scold your Senators.
Tomorrow
We need to talk about the SCOTUS nominee. However, there are some?factors to discuss and routes to plan, and it's too much for one item on today's multi-pronged five-minute action letter.?Tomorrow, we talk Gorsuch.
THANK YOU FIVE MINUTESERS!
