NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb. 2, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
There is importantly awful awfully important?legislation set to be voted on today. Please try to get through to your House Rep and?both Senators. I know lines will be very busy because of the Supreme Court pick (don't worry, we'll get to that), but please keep trying. Please don't let the GOP get away with the?efficient destruction of our environment while everyone is looking away!
Got your elected officials' names? Good. Go to their page and find:
Their
phone
numbers, though you should absolutely have these on speed-dial in your phone by now.
Their
fax
number!! Yes, brilliant, thank you to whoever suggested this.?Fax them!?I looked for lists of faxes and only found a couple very out-of-date ones, but your elected officials' pages will have em.
Their
email
address
Their
twitter
account
Hit 'em all ways.
Congress is voting TODAY on
[a series of bills](http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/jan/31/public-lands-sell-congress-bureau-management-chaffetz)
including: immediately selling off?public land in Connecticut (the first of many ? see note?below);?stripping the Bureau of Land Management and US Forest Service of law enforcement capabilities; rolling back
[important protections for stream waters](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/gop-moves-undo-obama-rules-protecting-streams-coal-mines/)
; and rolling back regulations?regarding
[public land used by industry](https://secure.earthjustice.org/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=1942&_ga=1.158296127.406422606.1483218373)
(that also make taxpayers money through usage royalties).
Even if you ?don't get to this action before Congress votes, please still make the call/tweet/fax. Your elected officials need to hear your opposition to their dastardly?actions.
Please alert your people in states/districts?with Republican representatives.
Script?for calling, faxing, emailing, writing - include both paragraphs
I am calling to ask _________ to oppose any efforts to use the Congressional Review Act (CRA) to undermine clean air, clean water, and safety regulations, including the Stream Protection Rule and the BLM Methane and Waste Prevention Rule. To?pretend?that industry doesn't create pollution or that it will regulate?itself is folly. The Methane and Waste Prevention Rule also earns American taxpayers money in royalties. If you vote to roll back these protections, I see that as a vote against clean water for my children?and a vote against respecting my taxpayer money.
I am also asking _____ to oppose efforts to use the CRA?for the bills Jason Chaffetz introduced ? the 3.3 acres to be given away in House Bill 621?and the companion bill?stripping public lands in the West and Southwest of?law enforcement capacity. These lands are used by hunters, fishermen, campers, hikers, and birdwatchers, not to mention the plants and animals that are part of our national heritage. The land giveaways are a giant taxpayer waste, as we will be compensated hardly or not at all. And access to the outdoors is priceless ??a?vote for giving away our land and reducing capacity to manage them?is a vote saying you don't care about the huge numbers of Americans who treasure their time outdoors.
Tweets
@[electedofficial] NO to using #CRA to undermine #cleanwater/land, strip Americans of #publiclands. We treasure these things. We are watching.
Tweet Jason Chaffetz?@jasoninthehouse, Mitch McConnell
@SenateMajLdr, and Paul Ryan?@SpeakerRyan?as well as your own elected officials.
*All these pieces of legislation are immune to a filibuster because the Republicans passed a series of regulatory bills the first week to immunize themselves against such defenses. The land-sale?bills are possible also because of additional regulatory changes the Republican Congress passed the first week of their session that
[made?it easy to "dispose of" public federal land to states](https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/jan/19/bureau-land-management-federal-lease)
, with no financial?compensation or benefit to the American people.
Sources
www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/jan/31/public-lands-sell-congress-bureau-management-chaffetz
www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/gop-moves-undo-obama-rules-protecting-streams-coal-mines/
https://secure.earthjustice.org/site/Advocacy?cmd=display&page=UserAction&id=1942&_ga=1.158296127.406422606.1483218373?.
Thanks to Earth Justice for some of the language in the script as well.
www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/jan/19/bureau-land-management-federal-lease
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Feb 1, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello all!
You may have juuuuust heard on the news that?DeVos was confirmed. She was confirmed by the Senate HELP
(H
ealth E
d L
abor P
ensions)
Committee.
The full senate still needs to vote.
Your call about her is still valuable because we need only
three
Republicans to vote No?and she will be not be confirmed. AND,
it's really important that our elected representatives hear from us about whether we approve of their votes.
Below is the whole earlier letter, so you can just carry on from here.
And if you are from any of the states whose Republican?Senator is on the HELP committee, you get to call now and give him/her?a huge dressing down for voting "aye" in Committee
just now
. Please let your friends who live in those states?know to call.
Sen. Richard Burr (R-N.C.)
Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.)
Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine)
Sen. Michael B. Enzi (R-Wyo.)
Sen. Orrin Hatch (R-Utah)
Sen. Johnny Isakson (R-Ga.)
Sen. Lisa Murkowski (R-Alaska)
Sen. Rand Paul (R-Ky.)
Senator Pat Roberts (R-Kan.)
Sen. Tim Scott (R-S.C.)
Sen. Todd Young (R-Ind.)
THANKS!
-----------------
Good morning!
Task 1
Today call your Senators about two cabinet nominations. Try EVERY office?until you can get through. Say all three of these things.?If you absolutely must, tweet.
NO on DeVos.
For D senators (all Dems have pledged to vote No):
Thank you for pledging to vote No on DeVos. Please make your voice heard in resisting these awful cabinet picks.
For R senators:
Betsy DeVos has literally no experience with public education and was unable to converse on basic education concepts in her hearing. Our nation's children deserve?someone knowledgeable,?qualified, and supportive of public schools. [If you/your kids go to public school tell a story, e.g.]?"MY KIDS deserve good public schools. As a parent I am worried about what will happen to MY KIDS' excellent public school."
Tweet:
@[yoursenator] [My kids?go/I went/my spouse went/etc.] to a great public school. DeVos has no public ed experience and knew little about ed concepts. Vote No.
NO on Sessions
Trump's executive order barring refugees and Muslim U.S. residents from entry into the U.S. was unlawful and poorly executed. Given Jeff Session's record and past words,
[I have no confidence he would act as a true independent voice](https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/senate-democrats-face-a-key-test-tuesday-amid-promises-to-stand-up-to-trump/2017/01/31/1685487a-e7bd-11e6-b82f-687d6e6a3e7c_story.html?utm_term=.2f8bdd024685&wpisrc=nl_most&wpmm=1)
in a matter like this one.?Vote No on Sessions.
Tweet:
@[yoursenator] Sessions' record of targeting vulnerable people shows he is not able to act as an independent voice upholding the law. Vote No on Sessions.
NO on Pruitt.
D senators:
Pollutants in air and water make a huge difference in health and opportunity for everyday Americans like me?and Pruitt's record shows he puts the enrichment of corporations above people's health. If you care about the health of your constituents, vote No.
R or D senators:
It seems patently obvious that the only way forward in industry and economic progress is to invest in clean technologies for renewable energy. This is a huge market that has not been fully tapped?anywhere in the world and America could be at the forefront.*
Pruitt wants to dismantle the EPA when the EPA could help make America great. If you ?care about our country's economic future, please vote No on Pruitt.
Tweet:
@[yoursenator] We all benefit from clean air and water: you, me,?your kids, my kids, even?Scott Pruitt. NO?on Pruitt
Tweet:
@[yoursenator] Huge mistake for U.S. not to jump on #GreenEnergy industry. Look forward, not back. #MakeAmericaGreat: NO?on Pruitt
*Actually many countries are way ahead of us in this regard, but?let's appeal to our elected officials' inflated sense of Amurrica-ness, and man do we need to get on board.
Task 2
Send off a
[Women's March](http://womensmarch.com/)
-inspired postcard! I know it seems like 1000 years ago but it was only ten days ago and it's important to remember the power of that march and embue other things with that power.?You should have a stack of postcards and stamps now if you did Sunday's and Monday's actions; jot down an issue you care a lot about, add #WhyIMarch, and mail it to one of your elected reps. The Women's March site suggests a senator.?You can also print off a copy of a Women's March logo
[here](https://www.womensmarch.com/)
(scroll down for the?postcard and also instructions I summarized above) and affix to one of the cards you bought.
Keep going
Know that the protests are working. I listened in on an
[Indivisible](http://indivisibleguide.com/)
call last night (I just checked and the link to the recording isn't up yet, but it should be soon), and immigrants are incredibly buoyed by the support that's been rippling through the country,?by the demonstrations and airport rallies. It is so important that people not feel alone, feel others have got their back (that apathy is what got us to where we are today, after all). Lawyers have been abso-freakin-lutely incredible donating their ?free time and their legal capacities to help, tirelessly.
Tirelessly
. They are still doing it because people are still being held. (Check for whether they're working near you and bring them a pizza!)?Elected officials are getting tired of the constant calls and crowds around their offices and so on; patience with Trump is wearing thin.** Your actions work!
(**
just remember a lot of these policies are Republican ones, not Trumpist, so no matter what happens with him,
we keep fighting).
Beyond the 5
If you are interested in moving beyond the five-minute agenda, please visit your local elected officials' offices regularly. Indivisible groups have regular #ResistTrumpTuesdays where people show up at their elected official's offices. Go to
[InvisibleGuide.com](http://indivisibleguide.com/)
and download their absolutely?fantastic guidebook about effectively using the best elements of Tea Party strategies to make effective progressive change. Read it.?Then, find an Indivisible group in your area by going back to indivisibleguide.com and locating a group using your zip.
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 31, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
This weekend, along with the
[unlawful?and?unamerican order?banning](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/30/politics/donald-trump-immigration-ban/)
tens to hundreds of thousands of legal residents, including refugees, students, military personnel, doctors, scholars, software engineers, and countless others from entry into the states,?Trump did something even more ominous: he
[installed Steve Bannon in the top circle of his?National Security Council?and demoted the director?of National Intelligence and the chair?of the Joint Chiefs of Staff](http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/01/29/512295108/with-national-security-council-shakeup-steve-bannon-gets-a-seat-at-the-table)
.?This council is meant to give the president nonpartisan, expert national security advice on the most sensitive and consequential?matters abroad and at home, distinctly separate from any political considerations or opinions of other White House staff. You might recall
[Bannon is Trump's chief strategist](https://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/15/opinion/turn-on-the-hate-steve-bannon-at-the-white-house.html)
, and?a far-right activist?whose goal is "
[to bring everything crashing down, and to?destroy all of today's establishment](http://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/steve-bannon-will-lead-trumps-white-house)
"?and who took Breitbart News Network from a conservative mouthpiece to beloved?beacon of?white nationalists, white supremacists,?and virulent misogynists.
Your task
Check
[this amazing list](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1siEAXlt9afXbxohwzcR1oB_-peO_3_cmlz2_8YZzUeo/edit#gid=0)
Action for a Better Tomorrow (ABT) put together to see if your elected officials have taken a stand on the unlawful and unamerican executive order targeting?Muslim American legal?residents and refugees. For the governor's office, please ask if (s)he has taken a stand.
For elected officials who have not made a statement or have made a statement in support of the executive order, say:
I completely condemn and reject President Trump's executive order banning already-vetted Muslim American legal residents of the United States, including?refugee families. It is cruel,?immoral, illegal, and unamerican. Senator/Repesentative/Governor? ______'s ancestors were also immigrants, possibly fleeing persecution, war, or famine. We are a nation of immigrants. We are better than this, and our system is not an authoritarian?dictatorship. Outrageous orders such a?this one must be rejected.?I am asking for??______ to reject this order in the strongest terms
today
. It is the American thing to do, and it is?a matter of simple human decency.
I am also asking Senator/Repesentative/Governor _______ to act strongly against?President Trump's move to install Steve Bannon on his national security council and demote the director of National Intelligence and chair of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Moving to put a political operative on this historically non-political?council and removing the very people whose job it is to advise on all matters pertaining to?the council is unprecedented and exceedingly dangerous to our security and safety as well as our democracy. This is a total outrage and should ring bells of alarm all over Congress and the nation. I want to hear ______ speak out about this
today
.
For elected officials who have made a statement against the executive order, say:
I am calling to thank Senator/Repesentative/
Governor ______ for?rejecting?President Trump's executive order banning?Muslim American legal residents of the United States and refugees fleeing war. It is the American thing to do, and it is?a matter of simple human decency.?I am also asking?______ to
please continue
to speak out loudly against this?order.
I am also asking Senator/Repesentative/
Governor _______ to act strongly against?President Trump's move to install Steve Bannon on his national security council and demote the director of National Intelligence and chair of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Moving to put a political operative on this historically non-political?council and removing the very people whose job it is to advise on all matters pertaining to
the
council i
s unprecedented and
exceedingly dangerous to our security and safety as well as our democracy
. This is a total outrage and should ring bells of alarm all over Congress and the nation. I want to hear?______ speak out about this
today
.
If you learn any updated information about your rep or senator, please?send your update to ABT (their contact?info is on
[the linked spreadsheet](http://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1siEAXlt9afXbxohwzcR1oB_-peO_3_cmlz2_8YZzUeo/edit#gid=0)
).
If?you don't get through, keep trying. Go down the list of office locations on your elected official's website.
Follow-up from yesterday
Remember the postcards you were supposed to write a note to yourself about
[yesterday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-29-2017)
? Please make sure you get some today! Stamps too.
Thank you, Five Minutesers!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 30, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
A few things today:
1) Please look back at the
[past few day's letters](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/archive)
and do?an action you didn't get around to. It has been very difficult lately to get a hold of representatives, and after a weekend of phone calls it is highly unlikely you'll be able to leave a VM today. But please?try, and if that doesn't work please email or tweet your message, or make a note to make the call(s) tomorrow am?and take a moment this evening to?donate to CAIR or the ACLU, if you haven't yet, instead. :)
2) Please make a plan to buy a bunch of postcards and stamps tomorrow (or tonight). Because of the difficulty getting through with phone calls, postcards I think are a good thing to have on hand; plus we?need to do the W
omen's M
arch action, which I?moved off this week due to the breathtaking amount of ruining-the-country that's been happening,
and probably most of us?don't have postcards just lying around, so! Task:
put "get postcards and stamps"
on your to-do list for tomorrow (and then do it)
!
3) Travis Kalanick, the CEO of Uber, has proven himself
[to be a big d-bag](http://www.modernluxury.com/san-francisco/story/the-smartest-bro-the-room)
for quite some time now. He is also a Trump advocate and is on Trump's economic advisory council.
[Yesterday](http://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2017/01/29/deleteuber-trend-erupts-lyft-backs-aclu-amid-trump-ban-fury/97214078/)
,?when NYC cabbies struck to show support for the immigrants and refugees targeted by Trump's
[malicious and illegal](https://lawfareblog.com/malevolence-tempered-incompetence-trumps-horrifying-executive-order-refugees-and-visas)
ban, Kalanick lowered Uber prices. If you know Uber at all, you know that when there is greater need for a ride, Uber raises its prices ? its business model is, frankly, to price-gouge when possible ??but in lowering its rates?during the?citywide cab strike?Uber acted essentially as a scab, undermining the strikers?and demonstrating?pointed?lack of interest in?an action that harms a great many people, including?Uber drivers and riders.
In contrast, Lyft donated one million dollars?to the ACLU and issued a?scorching statement against the executive order.
As a result of the negative press, Uber has
[created a $3 million?legal fund](https://techcrunch.com/2017/01/29/uber-to-create-3m-legal-defense-fund-for-drivers-affected-by-wrong-and-unjust-ban/)
for its drivers?and issued a statement condemning the ban, and also
[offered a defense](http://fortune.com/2017/01/29/uber-immigration-protests/)
for keeping prices low,?so use your judgment. Me, I've always preferred Lyft because Kalanick's always been sleazy.
If Uber's actions seem ?uber-icky to you, take a minute to?delete your Uber account and switch your habit to?cabs or?Lyfts. Don't just delete your app from your phone ? delete your whole account. The option is?under Help.
Bonus: (More than five minutes.) If you are in a city where there are protests this evening against?Trump's actions, consider going.
Those of you who attended a protest yesterday or donated in support, many thanks.
THANKS, FIVE-MINUTESERS! Keep the faith.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 29, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon,
Yesterday, on Holocaust?Remembrance Day, which was established to remind the ?of?the?unthinkable endgame of racist and xenophobic ideology,
[Trump imposed a ban against Muslim people](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/28/us/refugees-detained-at-us-airports-prompting-legal-challenges-to-trumps-immigration-order.html)
from seven different countries entering the U.S. This includes people with dual citizenship,?green cards, and?visas; students, scholars, and travelers have been left in the lurch, some literally detained en route at airports. Hundreds of thousands of American citizens can no longer see their families living in other countries. Thousands?of people who travel for work or school?suddenly no longer have?the ability to do their jobs or get their education.
Of course, this is having major repe
rcussions
for the safety and well-being of the millions of
American
Muslim citizens just living their lives in cities and towns all over the U.S. right now. People
and institutions feel, and are,
[targeted](http://www.nbc26.com/news/national/texas-mosque-burns-to-the-ground-overnight-cause-of-fire-unknown)
and
[in danger](http://www.cair.com/press-center/14061-cair-asks-feds-to-probe-threat-to-blow-up-colorado-refugees.html)
.
Trump's stated reason was the 9/11 attacks. Any stated "reason" is illegitimate: this?action absolutely mirrors steps totalitarian regimes take against their targeted scapegoat. Even so, the rationale is also senseless:
[neither the 9/11 attacks nor any terrorist or terrorist-inspired attacks on U.S. soil since](http://time.com/4652405/donald-trump-refugee-ban-silver-lining/)
were perpetrated by citizens of any of those seven countries.
Syrian refugees are part of the ban. People who have lost everything that makes a life: their home, their families, their work, their pets, their gardens, their hopes for the future ? have been cast out as fearsome and?untrustworthy. Before and during WWII, the U.S. refused hundreds of thousands?of Jewish refugees fleeing Europe using the rationale that some might be Nazi spies. Most of these people,
[including a young refugee-hopeful named Anne Frank](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2015/11/24/anne-frank-and-her-family-were-also-denied-entry-as-refugees-to-the-u-s/)
,?died in the Holocaust in camps.
Christian Syrian refugees?are excused. While it is nice that a small percentage of war victims are being granted a chance to?escape their slaughter, this distinction of whose life is worth saving, based on religion,?is beyond?loathsome.
Here is what you can do. Choose one or more actions.
General info for talking to elected representatives and your faith communities:
If someone supports the ban or has not yet stated a position, say
: This ban
will not make us safer in any way and is?a dangerous leap into religious and ethnic scapegoating, which has literally never aided the U.S. in its security or prosperity. No decent human with
compassion who pays any attention to history
could ever support these orders.
If?someone is against the ban, say
: T
hank them and ask them what
they are doing to help those affected. If applicable and you have time, ask what you can do to help.
Donate to
[CAIR](https://www.cair.com/donations/general-donation/campaign/#/donation)
,
the Council on American-Islamic Relations
. You can specify that your donation go to their civil rights fund if you wish. You can also donate to the
[ACLU](https://www.aclu.org/blog/speak-freely/aclu-and-other-groups-challenge-trump-immigration-ban-after-refugees-detained)
. Both?organizations are launching?lawsuits against the order and its consequences. If you have more than five minutes and are a lawyer, call them and offer to volunteer.
Donate to the International Refugee Assistance Project
[(IRAP)](https://refugeerights.org)
.?If you have more than five minutes and?are a lawyer or law student, contact IRAP and see what you can do to help people detained at airports or stuck outside the country.
Spread the word that anyone?being detained or otherwise affected by the ban should
[contact CAIR](https://www.cair.com)
. Other legal resources include the
[National Immigration Law Center](https://www.nilc.org/2017/01/27/trump-muslim-ban-affront-to-core-values/)
,
the
[American Immigration Council](https://www.americanimmigrationcouncil.org)
, and the
[National Immigrant Justice Center](https://www.immigrantjustice.org)
, all of which you can volunteer for as well if you have more than five minutes.
Call Paul Ryan, who praised this?action.
[Word has it](http://theslot.jezebel.com/what-the-hell-is-wrong-with-paul-ryans-phones-1791562227)
his phones are?busy/full at all hours of the day at all his offices. I tried the?switchboard and that didn't work either. Try calling, and if VMs are full,?write him at?20 South Main Street?Suite 10?Janesville, WI 53545 or?1233 Longworth HOB?Washington, D.C. 20515.?Say you are
appalled by his support for the ban and that he will be held accountable, and then add using the??applicable script above.
Learn via websites and Facebook pages/tweets?whether?your representatives?have made a statement for or against this move. Then call and leave a VM about how you feel?using the sample script above. You can also leave your opinion on their social media.
Reach out to your faith community. Ask them if they are speaking out against the ban. Depending on their answer, use the applicable script?above. If you have time and they are speaking out or wish to speak out, ask what you can do to help. If you are Jewish,
[HIAS](http://www.hias.org/blog/how-stand-fight-back-refugees)
[has some info](http://www.hias.org/welcome-campaign-congregations)
.
If you have more than five minutes, write a letter to the editor of your local paper about the unAmerican and useless horribleness of this action.
If you live in NYC and have more than five minutes, go to JFK airport right now.
[There is a protest because people are being detained.](http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/01/protest-jfk-airport-trump-refugee-ban-170128193014041.html)
One in Chicago is forming for this evening in Terminal 5 near the McDonalds at 5pm.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 28, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
This week the House passed a bill that makes the Hyde Amendment, which prohibits taxpayer money from??being used for abortion care, permanent. T
he Hyde Amendment
[forces?1 in 4 poor people?seeking an abortion to carry the pregnancy to term](http://www.cosmopolitan.com/politics/a3621396/hyde-amendment/)
. This bill will
[reaffirm that, plus?extend?the polic](http://The Hyde Amendment already forces 1 in 4 poor women seeking an abortion to carry the pregnancy to term; with the extension)
[y](http://www.cosmopolitan.com/politics/a8635781/house-passes-hr7/)
to health insurance plans created under the ACA, affecting millions more people.
[The?bill, HR?7,?will jeopardize abortion coverage](https://www.bustle.com/p/the-house-just-passed-anti-abortion-bill-that-will-badly-hurt-millennials-32827)
even?for people with private health insurance, penalize small businesses that wish to provide this coverage, and block coverage for federal workers, military personnel,
[all?D.C. residents](https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/dc-politics/house-republicans-pass-bill-that-would-block-dc-funding-for-abortion/2017/01/24/be660abe-e27e-11e6-ba11-63c4b4fb5a63_story.html?utm_term=.8c9ae04fae15)
, and low-income people.
Similar bills have?been introduced before and have?never become law. There are?reasons bills like this get introduced over and over ??to normalize extreme positions, to wear down resistance, to keep a?base energized. This year, with a far-right?wing House and Senate and a dead-eyed narcissist?in the White House,* there is a definite chance this could pass.
If you think abortion rights are not important or relevant?to you,
[go back to this letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-15-2017)
.
Men, we need your voices.
Your task
HR 7 has
passed the Hous
e; the next step is the Senate.
Call
[your senators](https://www.senate.gov/senators/contact/)
and say:
I am calling to ask you to vote NO on?HR?7. The bill discriminates against people with low incomes by making??an essential health service too costly to access.
People don't get abortions for fun. They do it because it is the best choice
.
Women vote and women want to be treated as independent adults who can make their own decisions. And by targeting people with low incomes, t
his shameful bill?exploits
people who are already vulnerable.
Addendum to Wednesday's letter
Continuing thoughts about sources to support...
[Teen Vogue is doing amazing work covering Trumpism](http://qz.com/866305/the-true-story-of-how-teen-vogue-got-mad-got-woke-and-began-terrifying-men-like-donald-trump/)
, and
[Cosmopolitan does incredible?work on reproductive rights](http://www.cjr.org/behind_the_news/the_new_feminists_of_joanna_co.php)
. These women's fashion and style mags have?finally gone public with the notion that women and girls want serious coverage about issues that impact their goals as?intelligent independent humans?AND eyelashes that go on for days. Brava, ladies.
Write them a thank you letter if you've got time:?Dear [Teen Vogue / Cosmopolitan],?Thank you for providing serious coverage and opinion about [Trump's intolerable policies /?reproductive health and reproductive rights]. Your work is brave, necessary, and inspiring. It makes a huge difference. Keep writing.
*Trump, who historically has not given a crap about abortion, seems to even more not give a crap about?who is affected when he signs stuff put in front of him. This week?he signed a global gag rule, which?every Republican has reinstated?and every Democrat has?lifted since Reagan, that?withdraws funding?from?N
GOs with family-planning programs that include abortion services or even mention?abortion
. This has had a real effect,
[contributing to 68,000 deaths a year when?women and girls in developing countries try to?end?pregnancies themselves](http://www.newyorker.com/news/daily-comment/trump-makes-the-global-gag-rule-on-abortion-even-worse)
.
Trump
[not only reinstated this rule?but radically expanded?it](http://www.newyorker.com/news/daily-comment/trump-makes-the-global-gag-rule-on-abortion-even-worse)
[](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2017/01/23/trump-reverses-abortion-related-policy-to-ban-funding-to-international-health-groups/?utm_term=.05f78a7cf302)
so it applies to funding from?ALL U.S. agencies, not just USAID and the S
tate D
epartment. This will condemn vastly more girls and women to death or serious disability?? which, guess what, horribly hurts their existing children
.
Other countries know this
[and are speaking out](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/25/politics/netherlands-trump-global-gag-rule/)
.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 27, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Some of you responded yesterday with your own journalistic sources - thanks!
[Here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-dec-3-2016)
is a larger (and still incomplete) list?I made last month.
Senator Jeff Sessions is set to be confirmed early next week for attorney general.
[He has a long history](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/08/us/politics/jeff-sessions-attorney-general.html)
of using his seat in congress and?before that?his position as Alabama attorney general to make it much harder for Black people, immigrants, gay people, and women to access their civil rights and freedoms.
Sessions' record is particularly strong on helping Republicans find ways to suppress voter turnout in minority communities. This is especially timely because this week Trump has been
[repeating the vile lie](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-election-idUSKBN1591FP)
that there is widespread voter fraud, in the millions,?perpetrated mostly by?"illegals" (his most recent rationale was a
[bizarre personal anecdote](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/25/us/politics/trump-bernhard-langer-voting-fraud.html)
about?people waiting to vote who "did not look as if?they should be allowed to vote.") The fear is that these?unfounded accusations?will?pave the way for yet more
[unlawful and?discriminatory?voting restrictions](http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/where-is-voter-discrimination-the-worst/)
in the name of fair elections.*?With Sessions as attorney general, there is significant danger that these restrictions?will be all the stronger.
Please call both of
[your senators](https://www.senate.gov/senators/contact/)
and say:
I am a constituent and I am calling for two related reasons.
First, I am asking Senator _______?to oppose the nomination of Jeff Sessions as Attorney General, using the full 30 hours of debate allotted. Sessions has worked his entire career to make it harder for people to vote. He has consistently enacted and supported discriminatory law and policy.
Secondly, has Senator _______ issued a statement about Donald Trump's repeated lies regarding voter fraud?
If Yes:
Please thank the Senator for me, and ask him/her to continue to speak out loudly against these lies.?They?harm our democracy and make the Jeff Sessions pick even more worrisome.
If No or they don't?know:
I am asking Senator _______ to repeatedly and loudly call Donald Trump out about these lies. They harm our democracy
and make the J
eff Sessions pick even more worrisome.
*(Also that the highest leader of?our land lying constantly about everything is an absurd
[Orwellian?nightmare](http://www.azquotes.com/picture-quotes/quote-the-past-was-erased-the-erasure-was-forgotten-the-lie-became-the-truth-george-orwell-51-25-98.jpg)
.)
THANKS, FIVE-MINUTESERS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Thursday, Jan. 26, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Yesterday was a doozy. A lot of horrible stuff happened,?and, in my first draft of this letter,*?I found I was engaging in the?panic-and-paralysis responses?I advised you against
[in a letter last week](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-20-2017)
. So I took my own advice: I turned away from the letter, took a deep breath, and reminded myself that none of this is a surprise.
We know it's going to be
a fight, and w
e are prepared. We are energized. We are committed.
We know nothing is going to be fixed overnight. We need to keep calling our elected officials, keep cultivating likeminded people to run for office, keep writing letters, keep supporting causes we care about, keep supporting responsible journalism, keep remembering what is normal and what is not, keep supporting other resisters, both?those around us and those in the public eye.
Your tasks today
You have two.
Task 1
If you are not already subscribing to a reliable news outlet,
do it
.?It is absolutely essential. The moves toward authoritarianism
[are real](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/24/opinion/the-banal-belligerence-of-donald-trump.html)
and
[are happening](https://newrepublic.com/article/140040/donald-trump-becoming-authoritarian-leader-eyes)
.
Even if you are already a subscriber
, please donate a small amount or subscribe to an?additional news source. Our democracy depends on it.
Much of the media has really stepped up.
[They are learning to pivot](http://www.niemanlab.org/2017/01/newsonomics-trump-may-be-the-news-industrys-greatest-opportunity-to-build-a-sustainable-model/)
around Trump's attempts to manipulate them, calling out his lies, avoiding his traps, ignoring his threats, finding alternative sources for verifying the truth;?and we, the public, are finally (re)learning their value.
Subscribe to
[The New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/subscriptions/Multiproduct/lp8K6QF.html?campaignId=6K4LR)
Subscribe to
[theWashington Post](https://subscribe.washingtonpost.com/acqbeta/?nid=top_pb_subscribe&promo=digital04_header_default&oscode=RPWH&wpsrc=CM0000447&destination=http://www.washingtonpost.com/pb/homepage/#/offers/promo/digital04_header_default/oscode/RPWH?nid=top_pb_subscribe&wpsrc=CM0000447&destination=http:%2F%2Fwww.washingtonpost.com%2Fpb%2Fhomepage%2F)
Donate monthly to watchdog
[Pro publica](https://www.propublica.org/donate/)
Donate monthly to
[Columbia Journalism Review](http://www.cjr.org/contact/donate.php)
Donate monthly to your local public radio station. Do it.
Donate monthly to your local public?television station. Do it.?Quality programming, no commercials, responsible investigation.
Task 2:
Email one of the organizations above?and say:
Thank you for covering the
Trump administration in such a way that makes it clear
when he and his supporters make claims without evidence,
lie outright, and seek to eliminate accountability and?transparency
.?Your critical?coverage?is essential and you are brave for insisting on the truth. Please continue to find ways around Trump's attempts to silence you. We are relying on you to help us help ourselves out of this mess. You are a keystone in our democracy. I have subscribed [donated] in gratitude.
Or email
[CNN](http://www.cnn.com/feedback)
,
[Time](mailto:letters@time.com)
, or
[USA Today](http://marketing.usatoday.com/contact)
, which, surprisingly to me,?have all been pretty admirably reflecting reality.
Say something like:
Thank you for your recent coverage stating clearly that Sean Spicer and Kellyanne Conway were?stating falsehoods ? lies ? in their inauguration comments?and that Trump is repeating the clearly false claim?? lies ? about voter fraud. Your coverage is?brave and it matters.?You are a keystone in our democracy. Please keep insisting on telling the truth.
(You can also subscribe to
Time
.)
THANK YOU, FIVE-MINUTESERS!
*I still have this draft, and if you're?craving?a challenge to your sense of peace?I can send it to you.
Just let me know.
On the plus side, it includes some encouraging acts of resistance.
NAME: Your five-minute action-item today: Jan. 25, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Tom Price, the nominee for Health and Human Services, is having a hearing with?the Senate Finance Committee today (he had his hearing with the health committee last week). There are
[many](http://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/hhs-nominee-tom-price-backed-extreme-anti-choice-personhood-bills/)
[many](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2016/11/28/trump-to-name-rep-tom-price-as-next-hhs-secretary/?utm_term=.b2305591b2f2)
reasons to resist Tom Price's appointment, but the salient one today is that he has
[ethical conflicts](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/16/health/tom-price-health-secretary.html)
;?he has heavy investments in the health industry, and as a Congressional rep?he has proposed legislation to benefit the companies that benefit him. How can we have confidence that his interests as Secretary of Health and Human Services are people and not his portfolio?
Task 1
Call a finance committee member
.?Look at the?members
[here](https://www.finance.senate.gov/about/membership)
.?If you live in or have close ties to one of their states, call that senator.?If not, call the chair, Orrin Hatch [
(202) 224-5251 or more numbers
[here](http://www.hatch.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/email-orrin)
],
and/or the ranking Democrat Ron Wyden [(
202) 224-5244
or more numbers
[here](https://www.wyden.senate.gov/contact)
].
Task 2
Call your own Senators and your governor.*
You have their numbers in your phone, riiiiight? If not, put them there now. It really helps make calling easier.
Script
In all cases, say:
I am calling Senator ______ [in his/her capacity on the Senate Finance Committee /?as his/her constituent]. I am
very?concerned about Tom Price's conflicts of interest
. His investments in the health industry and his efforts to help those same industries?through his legislation?conflict?with his potential role as Secretary of Health and Human Services. Thank you.
If you get a busy signal or full VM,?try a different office number. Their lines are very very busy, which is a GOOD thing, but it does mean it might take more than one try.
When you call your senators and governor, if you have a personal story about how the ACA, Planned Parenthood, Medicare and/or Medicaid saved you or?a family member's health/life,
share it
. Ask the governor's office if they have a plan for paying for people's health needs?if Price guts these programs.
Reminder
CALLS WORK. The GOP's first agenda item of gutting their own ethics office
[failed](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/03/us/politics/trump-house-ethics-office.html)
.?McConnell's strategy of clustering a bunch of hearings?all at once to avoid transparency
[faltered](https://www.bostonglobe.com/news/nation/2017/01/10/gop-plan-quickly-confirm-trump-nominees-hits-snags/1FZ9RTpx0OSaI7xE7rjLJM/story.html)
.?The decision on?Betsy DeVos
[has been delayed](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/grade-point/wp/2017/01/20/the-ethics-review-for-trumps-education-pick-betsy-devos-is-complete-clearing-the-way-for-a-confirmation-vote/?utm_term=.f8fda6bc41ab)
. All these have been targets of constituent phone calls. Power to the people! Please keep the faith that your efforts work.
*
Why call elected officials who aren't on the committee hearing Price today??Your senators need to know they are accountable to you, and they are going to vote on these nominees later?? and they talk with their fellow members of Congress.?Why the gov?
[The states are going to bear the brunt](http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/11/29/503720671/5-things-to-know-about-rep-tom-prices-health-care-ideas)
of uninsured and underinsured people if
the ACA, Medicaid, and Medicare are?gutted, which is
[what Tom Price wants](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2016/11/28/trump-to-name-rep-tom-price-as-next-hhs-secretary/?utm_term=.c3ae914c0cb4)
. His record has also?shown hostility
toward women's?health and
he spent a lot of time fighting for the?very unmedical and politically aggressive
[personhood](http://www.cosmopolitan.com/politics/news/a31309/personhood-reproductive-rights/)
movement?specifically to try to make an end-run around Roe v. Wade.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 24, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello again,
My, but things move fast. So sorry or the additional interruption today.
[Marco Rubio hasjustpledged his support](https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-01-23/rubio-backs-rex-tillerson-s-nomination-for-secretary-of-state)
for Tillerson.
[With, he says "concerns."](http://time.com/4643365/marco-rubio-rex-tillerson-support/?xid=homepage)
Since he has reservations, please STILL PHONE HIM. Say:
I am disappointed in the vote for Rex Tillerson.?We deserve a Secretary of State who will defend our values, not Russia's. Our national security and future influence could be compromised with this appointment. I am asking Senator Rubio to hold Tilleron closely accountable for his actions throughout the tenure of his appointment.
If you are asked if you are a constituent, say you are calling Senator Rubio in his capacity on the Foreign Relations Committee. If you have a relative/friend in FL, you can also say you have close friends/family who are voters there. (But please don't claim this if it is untrue.)
Phone numbers:
DC (202)?224-3041,?Orlando?(407) 254-2573, Miami?(305) 418-8553, Palm Beach?(561) 775 3360, Tampa?(813) 287-5035, Tallahassee?(850) 599-9100, Pensacola?(850) 433-2603, Jacksonville?(904) 398-8586.
Or, if you must, tweet:?@marcorubio, Disappointed in your?#Tillerson vote. The American people want a Secretary of State who will?defend our values, not Russia's.
Here's that handy list I included in the first email:
In the wake of the historic?Women's March, a lot of people are asking "What can I do now? You have already started by subscribing to this letter.?This letter focuses on?five?minute actions you can do over your lunch break or while waiting to pick up your kids, but of course there are many actions of greater than five minutes to?take. Below your task today?are some other ideas of varying commitment level to check out.
Places to start
If you are still in D.C. from the March,?go to your?congresspeople's?office, introduce yourself, and politely advise them you'll be watching everything they do.
Download the Indivisible Guide at
[indivisibleguide.com](http://indivisibleguide.com/)
right now. Seriously. Right now. It is an excellent, easy-to-read guide for changing the behavior of our elected officials.
Download Call the Halls at
[callthehallsguide.com](http://callthehallsguide.com/)
. This guide offers ?best practices in talking with your elected official to ensure you get your message across.
[This post](https://medium.com/@georgia_10/you-marched-now-what-cd3334c4f373#.setn4b92g)
, written by the leader of Illinois' very well organized?Action for a Better Tomorrow group, is an excellent set of beginning steps.
Regular action items
My favorite regular action sites/newsletters?(besides my own :) ) are
[wall-of-us.org](http://wall-of-us.org/)
,
[reactletter.com](http://reactletter.com/)
, and
[mycivicworkout.org](http://reactletter.com/)
.
[Daily Action](https://www.facebook.com/YourDailyAction/?)
on Facebook is also good but there are a lot of other postings, such as memes and articles,?as well as just action items, which I find distracting (down the Facebook rabbit hole we go..!). The Womens March organizers have a
[10 Actions in 100 Days](https://www.womensmarch.com/)
campaign that you can sign up for. In fact, we will be doing their first action together some time in the next week!
Make America Blue Again
The Democrats lost 900 seats during the Obama years. Two thirds of our states have Republican governors and many of those also have Republican majorities in their state houses.?Flipping seats?from red to blue in 2018 and 2020?is crucial. Flipping?STATE congressional seats?is as important as flipping?U.S. Congress seats, and your state politics are going to become more and more important as the extremist Republican Congress and Trump cabinet in Washington decimate federal agencies. Because the census is done every ten years, the party in power in 2020 in the various states gets to redraw the districting map. The DNC/Obama's biggest mistake of his administration was to look the other way when the Republicans redrew our U.S. Congressional districts. They drew it in such as way that they?created a few deep deep blue districts and many safely red districts, thus ensuring big GOP?wins no matter how unpopular their ideas. Fact: There are more people who vote democrat in the US than who vote Republican. Fact: Dems?are so steamrolled right now.
So! What does all that mean? It means you need to find a way that works for you to support winnable Democratic candidates in state and US seats and you must pay close attention to your governor as well.
[Flippable.org](http://flippable.org/)
,
[s](http://swingleft.org/)
[wingleft.org](http://swingleft.org/)
, and
[sisterdistrict.com](http://sisterdistrict.com/)
are?dedicated to flipping districts with a strategy of directing resources from voters in deep blue districts toward candidates in flippable red districts. ?CHECK THEM OUT. A great workaround for the Republicans' frankly should-be-unconstitutional redistricting.
[Countable](https://www.countable.us/)
is an great app that makes it easy to stay up to date on what your elected representatives are voting on and how they are voting. Its "social" function creeps me out a little, but others seem super pleased by this app. There are other apps on the market as well;
[here](http://www.businessinsider.com/11-surprisingly-useful-apps-for-political-junkies-2014-8#)
is a list.
[Govtrack.us](http://govtrack.us/)
is a website that does the same; I'm looking forward to also?checking out
[megavote](http://www.congress.org/congressorg/megavote/%E2%80%8B.)
.
You are all in different states so I can't provide direct links. But please find some active groups working toward change in your area. Effective change really really does start locally.
Go to indivisibleguide.com?and check their map for Indivisible groups in your area.
Poke around on Everyblock, Facebook, your local co-op's message board for community groups and attend some meetings. Even if they are not an exact fit, you will quickly meet people who can point you in the direction you are most comfortable with.
Use?Facebook to find groups that have emerged out of Pantsuit Nation. Many well-organized and effective newly minted organizations exist now.
On the less grassroots tip, attend a community action?meeting of your local Democratic party and/or a strong Democratic elected official. Don't be shy. Just go!
Supporting responsible media?is extremely important, as are supporting issues,?but those ideas?will have to be left?for another day.
Sources
[https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-01-23/rubio-backs-rex-tillerson-s-nomination-for-secretary-of-state](https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-01-23/rubio-backs-rex-tillerson-s-nomination-for-secretary-of-state)

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 23, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
Welcome, new subscribers!
As you probably know, the turnout for the Women's Marches were historic in their numbers and spread. They were also beautiful in their positive hopeful energy and their community spirit. And
[the signs were really great](http://people.com/politics/womens-march-on-washington-best-signs/)
.
Yesterday, Trump's first day in office,
[Press Secretary Sean Spicer gathered media](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/21/politics/sean-spicer-fact-check/index.html)
,?not to lay out plans for the first 100 days, not to deliver a message of getting to work, not even to brag about the inauguration, but to complain bitterly about media coverage of?inauguration attendance. It is alarming enough that Trump's choice of subject matter for this very first press briefing was the size of his inauguration. But, worse, Spicer backed up his assertions with lies: his claims that the numbers were larger than any other inauguration can be
[proven verifiably false](http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2017/jan/21/sean-spicer/trump-had-biggest-inaugural-crowd-ever-metrics-don/)
through?photographs and video, metro ticket sales, and other incontrovertible evidence. Spicer then ended the briefing without taking?questions.
Attendance size is trivial, but Spicer's?treatment of the media?dressing them down with?repeated?mantras of their dishonesty,?insisting that untruths are truths, and then leaving?is not trivial. Whitehouse "counselor" Kellyanne Conway said today that
[Spicer was not lying, but telling "alternative facts.](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/22/politics/kellyanne-conway-alternative-facts/index.html)
Your task is to thank those media outlets that reported his lies as lies and her defense as lies, and/or to ask those that didn't why not.
First, check your local paper and see if their coverage includes not only?the fact that the briefing happened, but that?Spicer lied and Conway called his lies "alternative facts." Email to thank them or correct their oversight accordingly.
If you have another few minutes, send a letter or tweet to a few others:
Chuck Todd on NBC's Meet the Press
[would not let Kellyanne?Conway get away](http://www.nbcnews.com/meet-the-press/wh-spokesman-gave-alternative-facts-inauguration-crowd-n710466)
with calling Spicer's lies "alternate facts."
[Email](mailto:contact.nbcnews@nbcuni.com)
or
[tweet](http://twitter.com/MEETTHEPRESS)
to thank him.
CNN declined to air the briefing live, choosing instead to continue their coverage of the women's marches, and has written extensively about
[Spicer's and Conway's lies](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/22/politics/kellyanne-conway-alternative-facts/index.html)
.
[Email](http://www.cnn.com/feedback)
or
[tweet](http://twitter.com/CNN)
and thank them.
Fox News Politics
[did not note](http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/21/spicer-accuses-media-false-reporting-in-fiery-briefing.html)
that Spicer's assertions were lies.
[Email](mailto:newsmanager@foxnews.com)
or
[tweet](http://twitter.com/foxnewspolitics)
them?and correct their oversight.
Fox News Sunday with
[Chris Wallace did ask White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus](http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/fox-news-sunday-chris-wallace/)
about both issues: the stupid nature of the briefing and the lies.
[Email Chris Wallace](http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/fox-news-sunday-chris-wallace/)
to thank him (click the little envelope to the right of the video window).
You could also tweet Spicer, Conway, and/or Trump.
Sample communications
Please modify to suit yourself so each message received will be slightly different.
Emails:
I am disappointed in your coverage of Sean Spicer's press briefing
[and Kellyanne Conway's defense of it]
. Spicer told several blatant, easily disprovable untruths and then left the briefing without answering questions. I did not see that information in your coverage. Trump is our president now and is therefore accountable to the American people. His press arm's assertion of these falsehoods and unwillingness to engage are troubling and it was your responsibility to cover them as such.
Thank you for your coverage of Sean Spicer's press briefing [and Kellyanne Conway's defense of it].
Spicer told several blatant, easily disprovable untruths and then left the briefing without answering questions. Trump is our president now and is therefore accountable to the American people. His press arm's?assertion of these falsehoods and unwillingness to engage are troubling and I appreciate your covering them as such.
Thank you for not backing down in your questioning of [Reince Priebus/Kellyanne Conway]. Sean Spicer told several blatant, easily disprovably untruths at his press briefing before leaving without taking questions.?Trump is our president now and is therefore accountable to the American people.?His press arm's?assertion of these falsehoods and unwillingness to engage are troubling and it is essential to have journalists like you push back.
Tweets:
@PressSec do your job. Don't lie, don't flee pressrooms. I'll give you your job isn't easy - @POTUS 's #inauguration envy is astounding.
@KellyannePolls Are you seriously going full #GeorgeOrwell? Please stop disrespecting the American people with your #AlternativeFacts.
@[insert person here]Thank you for pushing @PressSec
@KellyannePolls and @POTUS on that joke of a press briefing.
@[insert person here] Your forgot to mention in your @POTUS press briefing coverage that @PressSec and @KellyannePolls lied. #FixedIt
Sources
http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/21/politics/sean-spicer-fact-check/index.html
http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/22/politics/kellyanne-conway-alternative-facts/index.html
http://www.nbcnews.com/meet-the-press/wh-spokesman-gave-alternative-facts-inauguration-crowd-n710466
www.cnn.com/2017/01/22/politics/kellyanne-conway-alternative-facts/index.html
http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/21/spicer-accuses-media-false-reporting-in-fiery-briefing.html
http://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/2017/01/21/in-challenge-to-trump-women-protesters-swarm-streets-across-u-s.html
And more
http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/01/the-trump-white-house-is-already-disseminating-propaganda.html?mid=facebook_nymag
http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2017/0122/What-Sean-Spicer-s-first-news-conference-tells-us-about-White-House-press-relations-under-Trump
http://variety.com/2017/tv/news/cnn-white-house-press-conference-sean-spicer-donald-trump-1201966230/
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 22, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
I've written quite a bit this week?about today's march and accompanying feelings of solidarity and hope and?I don't want to overdo it,?so?you can look at
[this letter](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-14-2017)
if you want to learn ways to help marchers and
[this](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-19-2017)
or
[this one](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-20-2017)
if you're freaking out about what's to come.?If you're looking for a sister march, womensmarch.com has a list
[here](https://www.womensmarch.com/sisters)
. The?livestream for the march is
[here](https://www.facebook.com/womensmarchonwash/)
.
For today, given the number of new subscribers (welcome!), let's go back to basics:
Your task
Go
[here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members/map)
and find out who your U.S. House representative and senators are. Then go to their websites.
Go to your governor's website.
Put all four people's?phone numbers in your phone (for the congress people, put in the D.C. office and a local office or two, so you have alternatives if their VMs are filled). With ease of contacting them right at your fingertips, the barrier for making that call will be a lot lower.
Sign up to receive their e-newsletters. It's important to know what's going on in their offices and when they're having town halls and such, and it's important that they know you know.
Be safe.
THANK YOU FIVE MINUTESERS!
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 21, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening!
I'm really sorry for the very late letter today.
Your task for what's left of today?is to make a note to yourself to?become aware when you start feeling overwhelmed and hopeless about this administration, and to stop doing the thing that makes you feel that way.
Example: People have been posting furious?notifications that this page or that site on whitehouse.gov has been taken down?the climate change site, the LGBTQ ?site. This causes panic to begin to rise in my chest. And then I remember: We already knew this. We already knew the principles and priorities?we've traveled with for eight years?will be turned on their heads. We already know we need to fight to maintain that truth is a thing.?Er, we also know that any incoming administration is going to redo the site of the previous administration?(do you think Obama's administration just used what W?left behind?).
So I stopped paying attention to those posts. Posts like that?whip?up fear, nothing else. They do not lead to action and they do not tell us anything we don't already know.?There is reason to feel?fear,?but there is no reason to dwell in it.
Reading articles that cause you to?cry? If you are mourning, if you are feeling the feels?good. Cry.?But if you sense yourself spiraling into anxiety because of the article?stop. It's not serving you. You're not learning anything.
Tomorrow is the women's march, and I promise we'll get back to concrete actions.?Onward!
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan 20, 2017.
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Strangely, I feel increasingly hopeful and energized. The dread I had been carrying, which peaked at?the New Year?January 2017, the?month of the inauguration, the year of the first 100 days?that dread?has receded.
This is because I see incredible movement all around me. I see groups of thousands, ten thousands,
[hundreds of thousands](https://www.vice.com/en_au/article/can-a-facebook-group-of-120000-lawyers-save-america-from-trump)
of people coalescing and turning energy into action?through phone calls, through rallies,
[through town hall meetings](http://www.denverpost.com/2017/01/14/crowd-mike-coffman-meeting-constituents/)
, through media campaigns,
[through donations](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/inspired-life/wp/2016/11/30/its-unprecedented-in-our-history-after-trumps-election-millions-of-dollars-poured-into-nonprofits/?utm_term=.327653b98dc2)
, through volunteer actions. I see energetic
[new movements](http://www.riseparty.org)
and many weekly action lists in addition to Five Minutes (
[My Civic Workout](https://www.mycivicworkout.com)
,
[Wall of Us](https://www.wall-of-us.org)
,
[Re:Act](https://www.reactletter.com)
, and
[Flippable](https://www.flippable.org)
are my favorite national-issues groups?right now,?and there are plenty of others, as well as great local action groups).?I see arguments about direction or priorities, and that's good and healthy?that's?how movements and people grow. ?And tomorrow and Saturday, and
[today](http://www.resistsymbol.com)
too,?there are going to be protests and rallies and marches and resistance all over the country.
So! We are just getting started. We are seeing the rise of a?progressive movement unlike any seen since the Civil Rights Movement, and you are a part of it.?You are?putting your capable and caring hands on the wheel, alongside millions of others,?to take this?dangerous curve in the road and turn it firmly toward greater justice and equity.
Your task
Today, let's catch up on an action that might have slipped through the cracks this week. If you did all the actions, you are a rock star; pick the one you hold closest?and reinforce it with more phone calls/action!
[Support the women's march](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-14-2017)
and its sister marches even if you can't go to one.
[Wrap your head around threats to reproductive rights](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-15-2017)
.
Men, you too.
[Like having an environment and drinkable water?](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-jan-16-2017)
Call Senate Committee leads and/or your own senators
re
Interior Secretary and EPA hearings
:
(Pruitt for EPA is especially outrageous).
[Like having?public schools? Dislike infusing public?education with conservative Christianity?](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-17-2017)
Call Senate Committee leads and/or your own senators re Education Secretary hearings.
[Think poor people deserve access to?health care?](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-jan-18-2017)
Call Senate Committee leads and/or your own senators re Health and Human Services?hearings.
Tomorrow we're moving forward so catch up now!
THANKS, FIVE-MINUTESERS!
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 19, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
More senate hearings this week! Sorry this week is so repetitious with our action items, but that's what happens when your nation's congressional leaders shove a whole bunch of important actions into a few days in order to escape scrutiny and transparency.
Task 1
If you have not yet called to protest the nomination of Scott "Abolish the EPA" Priutt to lead the EPA, please do so.
[Here](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-jan-16-2017)
is the script. If you like
[mercury-free water](http://time.com/4635162/scott-pruitt-science-denial/)
and breathable air,?please. Do this action. His hearing is today. John Barrasso Repub. chair (202) 224-6441 or (307) 362-5012; Tom Carper ranking Dem:?(202) 224-2441?or??(302) 573-6291; and/or
[choose senators](http://www.epw.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/members)
on the committee.
Task 2
The Committee on Health, Education, Labor and Pensions (HELP) held Betsy DeVos' hearing yesterday and
[she did not know basic education terminology and policies](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/17/us/politics/betsy-devos-education-senate-hearing.html)
. She has literally zero professional or even personal experience in public education. However, against normal protocol, Republican Committee chair Lamar Alexander allowed each senator only one round of questioning rather than two, and she was given her hearing before her ethics check was completed. This is a clear attempt to dodge scrutiny of a weak candidate.
AAAANNDDD,
Tom Price is also having his hearing today.
[You might recall](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-december-8-2016)
he is the guy who fought to institute personhood, the belief that fertilized eggs have rights, and who wants to replace the ACA, who is now poised to become our Health and Human Services lead. He also has significant
[conflicts of interest](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2017/01/18/facing-the-senate-wednesday-hhs-nominee-price-will-defend-gops-health-care-overhaul/)
in his investments with the health sector.
SOOOOO,
[call the two senators](http://www.help.senate.gov/)
on the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions committee that you called yesterday (leads: Repub Chair
[Lamar Alexander](http://www.alexander.senate.gov/)
, (202) 224-4944 or (865) 545-4253 and ranking Dem
[Patty Murry](http://www.murray.senate.gov/)
(202) 224-2621 or (253) 572-3636. They have additional offices if you can't get through on those numbers.
SAY:
I am calling for two reasons. First, I am very disappointed in committee chair's decision to allow only one round of questioning of Betsy DeVos and to allow her hearing to go ahead before the ethics investigation was concluded. Both of these actions look like clear attempts to avoid scrutiny. Our nation's children deserve a well vetted and well qualified Secretary of Education.
Secondly, I? am extremely concerned about Tom Price's appointment to head Health and Human Services. He supports the dismantling of the ACA without replacement. He holds extremist, medically ignorant views around "personhood." He holds personal investments in the health care sector. He is a troubling candidate that I and my family and associates do not want to see in this position.
Bonus
Tweet Lamar Alexander:?Not cool to limit #DeVos questions, blow past ethics check, @SenAlexander. Not cool at all. Sure looks like you know she's a weak candidate.

NAME: Your five-minute action item: Jan. 16, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon,
Among the things the Republican Congress is preparing, in anticipation of Trump's entry into office, is the roll-back of
[reproductive health](http://mediamatters.org/research/2016/11/29/media-fail-explain-impact-hhs-nominee-tom-price-s-health-care-agenda/214650)
and
[choice](http://www.usnews.com/news/articles/2017-01-06/planned-parenthood-met-by-locked-door-at-paul-ryans-office)
policies. Because of the gift and the burden of their biology, women bear the brunt of these roll backs.
It is almost impossible for me to express how upsetting and terrifying these rollbacks are for me. Many of you might feel the same.
If you are a man
, gay or straight, and you have not thought much about reproductive choice,
please start thinking about it.
A sicker, less educated society that has less control over when and how it wants to start families
[affects every single person in the country](http://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2014/07/the-broader-benefits-of-contraception/373856/)
, men too.
[This is a worldwide fact](http://www.who.int/reproductivehealth/publications/general/lancet_3.pdf)
.
I don't know why this is not part of the conversation.
Your task
Your task today is to spend a few minutes writing down why reproductive choice is important to you?
men, this task is even more important for you
.
Write about how the ability to have a family (or not) when and how worked best for you has helped you and/or people you love. Think about the entities that have helped you stay reproductively healthy and informed throughout your reproductive life. Save what you write down; you will be calling members of Congress in the days and weeks to come.
If you cannot think of any experiences with the above, ask a female friend or family member what she thinks.
Here are my general thoughts on the matter, if it helps:
Women-controlled birth control such as the pill is responsible for advances for women in their careers. Period.
Reproductive rights are responsible for advances for women in their personal freedom
and safety
since the '70s. Period. It is vastly easier to get out of an abusive or simply bad situation when your capacity as a mother cannot be manipulated or forced on you.
Reproductive rights are responsible for advances for women in their personal finances. Period. Women have far greater ability to plan and control their own lives, and therefore can make relationship choices that aren't related to their basic survival and comfort.
Eliminating access to reproductive health care would cause hardships for family units, not just the women in them. It would change
[the economic, educational, and social balances](https://economix.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/03/06/the-economic-impact-of-the-pill/)
we've attained in the past few generations.
Eliminating access to reproductive health care implies that there is shame, caprice, or frivolousness?or all three?in needing reproductive health care. Women's bodies are not shameful. Women needing care for their bodies is not capricious. Wanting birth control is not frivolous.
Maybe you don't like abortion. No one
likes
abortion. Abortion is one end of the reproductive health spectrum, and it's needed. The choice of whether to get an abortion is complex and painful?the very choice that it is cruel, ignorant, and oppressive to legislate. Reproduction takes two, but anti-choice policy puts the entire cause, effect, and burden of sexuality on women.
[As fake Arianna Huffington said on SNL's Weekend Update](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/35/f0/74/35f074bc1708a4b3cd568ca1b20d4d34.jpg)
, if men could have babies abortions would be available on every corner like Starbucks. Anti-choice policy forces an uninformed decision on people who are perfectly capable of making the ?decision themselves and who know much, much more about their specific situation. Anti-choice policy is cruelest and most oppressive to poor people most of all, as poverty strips one of the means, time, and control to seek out barely accessible or illegal options. Making abortion illegal or inaccessible doesn't stop abortions. It just stops legal ones.
Cited Sources

letter from a couple days ago, and http://mediamatters.org/research/2016/11/29/media-fail-explain-impact-hhs-nominee-tom-price-s-health-care-agenda/214650

ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning! Two tasks today. It should still take just a few minutes. The ACA, which has provided imperfect but crucial health coverage for millions of people, is being dismantled, with glee, by the Republican Congress. They have no replacement.
Task 1
This week, Mitch McConnell led his Republican Senate to
[begin repeal of the ACA in a middle-of-the-night vote](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/12/us/politics/health-care-congress-vote-a-rama.html)
.?Look at
[this helpful infographic](http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/12/03/us/politics/why-it-will-be-hard-to-repeal-obamacare.html?ref=politics)
to better understand how the Senate dismantled the ACA, which is a complicated measure; note, though, that even the things not immediately in filibuster-proof danger, such as coverage for contraception and pre-existing conditions,
[are still on the chopping block](http://nymag.com/thecut/2017/01/the-senate-just-voted-to-roll-back-womens-healthcare.html)
. The Senate Democrats
[fought back](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/11/politics/senate-obamacare-repeal/)
, repeatedly interrupting votes and putting forth amendments designed to highlight just what the Republicans were trashing (they amendments all failed).
[Write](http://www.mcconnell.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/officelocations)
or
[email](https://www.mcconnell.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/contactform)
McConnell and say something like:
I am disgusted with your practice of holding important votes in the middle of the night, such as the one to repeal the ACA. Your complete disrespect for transparency, decency, and integrity will be remembered.
(You'll have to shorten it if you tweet.)
Aw, hell.
Let's all tweet
* too/instead,?if you have Twitter. Vary it a little, if you can, so it doesn't look canned. AND! Let's all please
retweet and like
each other. Scan for similar tweets and show support.
Tweet and like/retweet:
[@SenateMajLdr](https://twitter.com/SenateMajLdr)
Why hold crucial votes in the dead of night, such as the #ACArepeal? Your dodging and disrespect will be remembered.
Task 2
Some Republicans are concerned about repealing without replacing because
[repealing the ACA will be very costly](http://www.cnbc.com/2017/01/04/heres-how-gop-repeal-of-obamacare-would-swell-the-federal-deficit.html)
.** Your task is to call some of those on the fence.?I'm going to mostly borrow
[Daily Action](https://www.facebook.com/YourDailyAction)
's awesome to-do info today, which I've put on
[this Google Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GUGOpoozk5Eda80NF27mRdNZ5BHI9Bw9cdC_hvo52ok/edit?usp=sharing)
to spare you the black-hole time-suck that is Facebook.
So go
[here](http://docs.google.com/document/d/1GUGOpoozk5Eda80NF27mRdNZ5BHI9Bw9cdC_hvo52ok/edit?usp=sharing)
and make a call or two.
*I'm generally not keen on tweeting my civic participation because a) Twitter does not take harassment issues seriously enough for me to feel comfortable tweeting and asking you to tweet, and b) in the past tweeting has been largely ineffective; but
[apparently that second point is changing](http://www.dailydot.com/layer8/congress-30-tweets-study-pay-attention/)
.?I will occasionally recommend tweeting now, with my point (a) in mind in re: the issue at hand.
**The House
[passed a measure](http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/05/republicans-agree-on-obamacare-repeal-replacement-is-tricky-part.html)
first thing this year though to hide those costs, though, so, you know, out of sight out of mind. Accountability is so last year!

Now we need to keep up the pressure, not get distracted by comedy-spy movie hijinks.
(There are serious charges as well as titillating ones and?we will address conflicts of interest and um collusion with a hostile foreign power later. Meanwhile,?hearings are happening as we speak.)
Your task
Rex Tillerson is being vetted today;
[read about it and watch it live](http://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/hearings)
.

;
@SenBobCorker

;
@marcorubio

I have serious concerns about the Rex?Tillerson in the role of Secretary of State given his

This is unfair and gross, but I'd expect nothing less of McConnell's senate, and since?we are being forced to pick battles, Tillerson is?the more concerning.

by the NAACP and people from all sides of the political spectrum have grave concerns about his civil forfeiture and?prosecutorial misconduct practices.
If you are calling the committee office or a senator who is not on the committee, replace that first sentence with:
I am calling to say I do not support the nomination of?Jeff Sessions for attorney general.
Throughout his career...
Background
Thanks to the
[Re:Act letter](http://us14.campaign-archive2.com/?u=34bf9c62b5c76a26e2e6e912d&id=e6221b4dc5)
for much of?this info. When Jeff Sessions?was attorney general of Alabama in the '80s he was
[denied a federal judgeship](http://www.cnn.com/2016/11/17/politics/jeff-sessions-racism-allegations/)
being too racist?in 1986, by a?Republican-led Judiciary?Committee?to do the job fairly (he then ran for Senate instead, won, and became a ranking member of that very Judiciary Committee. America!). He has voted against measures meant to protect voting rights as well as the rights and liberties of Black people
, gay people, and?women
[at every turn](http://www.naacpldf.org/press-release/what-you-need-know-about-sen-jeff-sessions)
.
He has been rebuked for
["pronounced and persistent"?prosecutorial misconduct](http://www.latimes.com/opinion/op-ed/la-oe-oppenheimer-sessions-prosecutor-20170105-story.html)
. And he
supported the
seizure of?property without due process
?for example,
[a family's?home?was seized](http://wapo.st/2j3Ocyv)
because their son had sold drugs elsewhere. Even conservatives
[voice](http://www.wsj.com/articles/jeff-sessions-and-civil-forfeiture-1482793299)
[d concern](http://www.wsj.com/articles/jeff-sessions-and-civil-forfeiture-1482793299)
about that.
Two Updates
I am part of
We The Free?(WTF)
, a collective of writer-activists who have started a
new column
on
[she said, Elaine Sir's excellent blog](http://elainesir.com/we-the-free/)
. Give my introductory post a read, and follow the blog for incredible interviews and posts?about life, family, art, and activism. (p.s. If you
recognize that penlight metaphor in the blog post it's because I first explored it
[in this](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-action-item-today-sunday-dec-11)
[very forum](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-action-item-today-sunday-dec-11)
.)
?
?
?
The Republican-led
repeal-and-don't-replace-the-ACA
push which,
[as noted the other day](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-sunday-jan-8)
, is a terrible idea,
[looks like it might be faltering](http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/01/obamacare-repeal-might-have-just-died-tonight.html)
. I am reluctant to say something like this because it's not down yet and?we must keep pushing and the Republican Congress will definitely look for another way to destroy the ACA. The fight is not over, 'kay? That said,
Good work, team
!
