NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 10, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
The Republican Senate, led by Mitch McConnell, is barreling through with?vetting up to nine cabinet picks this week. Many of these cabinet picks have not yet been fully?vetted for conflicts of interest, integrity with tax records, and other common procedures that every single cabinet pick has been vetted for in living memory.
The head of the Office of Government Ethics,?a nonpartisan federal watchdog,
[said in a letter](http://thehill.com/homenews/senate/313175-ethics-office-accuses-gop-of-rushing-trump-cabinet-confirmations)
that "the announced hearing schedule for several nominees who have not completed the ethics review process is of great concern to me...I am not aware of any occasion in the four decades since OGE was established when the Senate held a confirmation hearing before the nominee had completed the ethics review process.?
The purpose is to?flood the news media with so much information that they cannot focus on one candidate's qualifications (and
[make a big show of dominance](http://www.theonion.com/graphic/mitch-mcconnell-inflates-throat-pouch-in-show-of-d-34747)
, no doubt). Any one of these candidates might be a full-blown story with a lot of controversy, but when there are five or six in a day, those stories can't happen.
In 2009,
[McConnell demanded the cabinet procedure he is now ignoring](https://twitter.com/brianklaas/status/818115535523246081)
.
Call Mitch McConnell.
(202) 224-2541,
(
502) 582-6304,?(859) 224-8286,?(859) 578-0188,?(606) 864-2026,?(270) 781-1673,?(270) 442-4554.
If you can't get a hold of someone at any of his offices, email
[here](https://www.mcconnell.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/contactform)
.
Say:
I am extremely concerned that the cabinet nominees slated for hearings this week?have not been fully vetted and are being jammed through all at once. This standard vetting procedure is not a partisan issue and in fact it is one Senator McConnell has insisted on in the past. Why is he holding himself to a different standard than others in regards to holding hearings??Moreover, what if something turns up later that Congress and the American people?could have learned of now had the candidates?gone through the proper procedure? Senator McConnell and his supporters?will be held responsible for that. I am calling to demand these hearings be conducted at a reasonable pace that allows the proper ethics checks?and allows Senator McConnell's?colleagues and the American people to have a chance to learn about each nominee.
If you are asked if you are a constituent, say you are?calling McConnell in his capacity as Senate Majority Leader, an important position that holds responsibility to all Americans.
Then call your own Senators and say the same. For Democratic Senators skip the bit about Senator McConnell's supporters being held responsible.
Sources
http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2017/jan/08/cory-booker/booker-mcconnell-full-ethics-review-obama-nominees/
http://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/07/us/politics/senate-confirmation-hearings-background-checks.html
http://www.politico.com/story/2017/01/senate-mcconnell-cabinet-confirm-233330
NAME: Your  five-minute action item today: Monday, Jan. 9, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
[The ACA (Affordable Care Act) definitely needs some adjustments](http://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/26/upshot/rising-obamacare-rates-what-you-need-to-know.html)
, which makes sense for a large and complex program that's been around for only a few years. But, in case you missed it, um, t
he Republican Congress is planning an immediate repeal of the ACA.
They have no replacement.
Even if they delay implementation of the repeal-without-replacement,
[costs and availability will become chaotic in the meantime because of the uncertainty this will create](http://bigstory.ap.org/article/7d537123c57c4ad4a7b5d28cfed397f8/republicans-ready-dismantle-aca-insurers-likely-bolt)
.
Medicaid was expanded under the ACA in many states, and
[the eleven million people covered under this program will lose their care](http://kff.org/medicaid/press-release/whats-at-stake-in-a-potential-repeal-of-the-aca-medicaid-expansion/)
under the Republican not-plan.
?Your task
Today, your task is to write Mitch McConnell your ACA story, if you have one. Strangely,
[he's asking](http://www.mcconnell.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=share-your-obamacare-story)
.
Go
[here](http://www.mcconnell.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=share-your-obamacare-story)
and tell your compelling story about how the ACA saved your health/life/family/house/job whatever.
If you don't have an ACA story, please don't make one up; forward this link to someone you think might.
And if you have another thirty seconds, copy and paste your story to your own elected officials.
Let's flood McConnell and the rest of 'em with good reasons not to take away people's health care without any sort of plan!
Note:
The Republicans plan to
[defund Planned Parenthood as part and parcel of the ACA repeal](http://www.cnn.com/2017/01/05/politics/paul-ryan-planned-parenthood-obamacare/)
.
Public funding has not paid for abortion services?since 1976?due to the
[Hyde Amendment](https://www.aclu.org/other/public-funding-abortion)
, so defunding?Planned Parenthood means gutting ONLY?the many other health care services Planned Parenthood provides to tens of millions of women: cancer screenings, check-ups, contraception and education,?nutritional services,
prenatal care,
and STD testing.
Providing contraception?and family-planning?education
[greatly reduces unplanned pregnancies and thus abortions](http://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/06/science/colorados-push-against-teenage-pregnancies-is-a-startling-success.html)
.
We'll deal with this later.
Sources (I'll put only the ones I haven't already linked to from now on)

http://www.latimes.com/science/sciencenow/la-sci-sn-planned-parenthood-texas-births-20160203-story.html
http://www.politifact.com/texas/statements/2015/sep/13/greg-abbott/greg-abbott-defunding-planned-parenthood-preceded-/
http://cohealthinitiative.org/blog/2016-04-13/colorado-legislature-rights-its-wrong-funds-family-planning-initiative
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Sunday, Jan. 8
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
TinyLetter fills in that silly subject line you received earlier if people forget to put one in themselves...well, it's the first but probably not the last time?THAT happens. Moving on...
To our new subscribers, Welcome! Imagine if you did some small action every day to resist the dismantling of our country and reinforce the arc of progress. You will have performed 365 small steps by the end of the year! Now imagine how far we could go if those 365 steps were multiplied by ten, a hundred, a thousand, a million people. Positive change is inevitable?IF we stay focused and persistent.
To everyone, let's make sure we have all our basics covered today. Do any of the following you have not yet done:
Put your U.S. elected officials' phone numbers in your phone. Put both D.C. and local offices and in general favor calling the local offices (though this past week, with all these votes happening right now, I've been calling D.C.). You can find your House rep and your two Senators
[here](http://mail01.tinyletterapp.com/FiveMinutes/friends-romans-countrymen-lend-me-your-ears-2/7177929-www.govtrack.us/congress/members?c=b96f190b-c092-4e68-9f46-8212471bbd38)
.
Subscribe to the mailing list for each of your three elected U.S. officials. Communication must be established in order for them to feel accountable to you.
Put your state elected officials' phone numbers in your phone, too. You have two, a state rep and a state senator. Find them
[here](http://mail01.tinyletterapp.com/FiveMinutes/friends-romans-countrymen-lend-me-your-ears-2/7177933-openstates.org/find_your_legislator/?c=b96f190b-c092-4e68-9f46-8212471bbd38)
(note, the search box seems to get confused by periods and commas, so type your address without them).
Subscribe to their mailing list, too.
?THANKS!

NAME: Friends, Romans, countrymen, lend me your ears
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Hey! Big thanks to Nancy Rosenthal for the shout-out
[on Medium.com](http://bit.ly/2jjGO2z)
. Right on!
So, what fresh skullduggery do we have today? So much. SO MUCH.
The initiatives the Republicans are excitedly lining up and the cabinet?Trump has selected are horrible, but maybe even more bloodcurdling is the manner in which?Republican Congress is breaking the back of ethics and?procedure along the way.?I've listed some examples below the task.
Your task: call your elected officials
Call your Senators and say:
I am calling because I am alarmed about the many measures being proposed and passed by the Republican Congress that limit transparency, reduce the ability for vital government agencies to function, and undo important safeguards, such as the REINS Act, the RAA, new rules packages, and the Midnight Rules bill. I am also gravely concerned and unnerved by the
way
these measures are being brought up and passed. A good example is the decision to review six cabinet appointees in one day. This makes transparency and proper vetting impossible. It
shows a lack of regard for the American people and a tolerance for deceptive practices.
Please do everything you can to slow or stop these destructive measures and shady procedures, and please vote NO on REINS, RAA, and the Midnight Rules.
If you have time, call Mitch McConnell. Or write him. I've never been able to get through to his phone line. I am beginning to suspect it's not even staffed.
Call your House rep and say:
I am calling because I am alarmed about the many measures being proposed and passed by the Republican Congress that limit transparency, reduce the ability for vital government agencies to function, and undo important safeguards, such as the REINS Act, the RAA, new rules packages, and the Midnight Rules bill. I am also gravely concerned and unnerved by the
way
these measures are being brought up and passed. They are being discussed and decided on behind closed doors and very quickly. This makes transparency and proper vetting impossible. It
shows a lack of regard for the American people and a tolerance for deceptive practices.?Please do everything you can to slow or stop these destructive measures and shady procedures and please vote NO on the RAA.
If you have time, call Paul Ryan. His line is usually open for VM, at least, though I got a busy signal today (haven't heard THAT noise in a couple decades!). Busy busy!
A general strategy note
If you only have time to call one person, choose the Republican. If you don't have a Republican elected official, choose the Democrat who is less likely to already be pushing back. But try to call all of 'em.
Background
The Republicans have begun
[an assault of regulatory changes](http://bit.ly/2iQsQEy)
that are designed to make it easier for them to trash regulations that keep us safe,
[target](http://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/312797-house-gop-revive-rule-that-lets-lawmakers-slash-gov-employees)
and
[intimidate people](https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2017-01-04/house-gop-gives-staff-broader-new-powers-to-grill-witnesses)
they disagree with,
[dodge transparency and accountability](http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2017/01/03/house-votes-fine-members-up-2500-if-they-take-videos-chamber/96120998/)
, and
[undo basically everything Obama recently?did to protect people and places without considering the individual merits of any](http://thehill.com/homenews/house/312730-house-passes-bill-to-overturn-midnight-regulations-en-masse)
. These are small regulatory things, not big splashy bills, and they all are getting passed in a big hurry this week,?so it's just a blitz.
Speaking of a blitz,
[the Republicans are planning to vote on six of Trump's cabinet appointees at once](http://wapo.st/2hV1JbU)
. This means that there will not be proper time to vet them and no one horrible, awful, no-good candidate will dominate the news cycle; it protects the?candidates, almost to a one of which are laughably inappropriate for their position. It is thought that all of the candidates will get appointed. Yes, the avowed racist to determine who gets prosecuted and punished, and why (Jeff Sessions for Attorney General).?Yes, the creationist who wants to dismantle public schools?to run our public education system (billionaire Betsy DeVos). Yes, the oil tycoon with strong and friendly ties to Putin and business dealings around the world to manage our international relationships (former Exxon CEO Rex Tillerson).
The Republicans are toying with
[getting rid of the filibuster](http://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/04/opinion/why-republicans-shouldnt-weaken-the-filibuster.html)
, currently the Democrats' only procedural tool.
Mitch McConnell
[actually literally said](http://www.thenewcivilrightsmovement.com/davidbadash/mitch_mcconnell_the_american_people_simply_will_not_tolerate_blocking_a_supreme_court_nominee_video)
"The American people will not tolerate" blocking a Supreme Court nominee. The guy who has blocked Merrick Garland since February.
Sources
http://bit.ly/2iQsQEy
(this is my Storify from an NRDC lawyer who sums up the regulatory changes nicely)
The Hill:?http://bit.ly/2iHHOtP
Bloomberg:?http://bloom.bg/2hQcsUZ
USA Today: http://usat.ly/2iMPv1I
The Hill again:?http://bit.ly/2j7an31
Washington Post: http://wapo.st/2hV1JbU
NYT:?http://nyti.ms/2ik8Dn2
http://nbcnews.to/2hUi1QH;?and, more editorialized but also more accurate in reflecting Biden's initial intention and in calling McConnell's lies out as lies, from the New Civil Rights Movement:?http://bit.ly/2iJzcFG
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 6, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
The House is voting today,?not the Senate. Corrections below.
Good morning!
The Republican led Congress is NOT wasting any time serving up everything they've been brewing for the past eight years and more. They've tried?to get the REINS Act passed at least four times before, and it always failed. Now is their chance?the vote in the House?on REINS is scheduled for today at noon.
It is important to call before noon eastern.
Say:
Republicans: I
am calling to ask Rep. ______ to please, please not vote for the REINS Act.?Food safety, worker safety, air pollution, water contamination, are all at risk.?Ignoring matters that are concerning or complex will not make the issues go away. Asserting that we don't need to listen to people who know a lot about these matters and who have spent years and taxpayers' money developing solutions is not?wise.?I am watching, and if Rep. ______ votes for this bill, I will know that that means (s)he cares more about party than people and is voting against the health and safety of our people and our land and water.
Democrats:
I am calling to ask Rep _____ to please fight hard and loud against the REINS Act. There is a reason this Act didn't pass four times before. I value our worker safety and clean air and water, and I respect the work done by experts in the fields targeted by the REINS Act. I want Rep.?______ to make his/her constituents' voices heard.
Rationale
To quote from
[ombwatch.org](http://www.ombwatch.org/three-reasons-reins-act-must-be-stopped-again)
:?"The bill would require that Congress approve standards and safeguards within 70 legislative days.? If both chambers fail to meet this deadline, the rules in question would be 'tabled,'?essentially killing them.
"Under the REINS Act, Congress would second-guess agency expertise and science on food safety, worker safety, air pollution, water contamination, and a host of other issues.? When developing protective rules, agencies already go through a lengthy, multifaceted process that includes several layers of study, review, and public comment.? Politicizing agency science and the rulemaking process at the behest of special interests is indefensible."
The REINS Act was devised by a
[78-year-old Tea Party Activist](http://www.jacksonsun.com/story/opinion/columnists/2017/01/04/we-were-never-closer-seeing-reins-act-become-law/96090608/)
, which confirms my suspicion that this act sounds like it was written by someone who doesn't understand how government works and who doesn't respect that others may know things that he himself doesn't. We have regulations for a reason. People who hate regulations remind me of anti-vaxxers. They forget the reason they don't have to worry about a horrible ill
is because people worked hard to eliminate it, whether that's water quality or smallpox.
Sources
http://content.sierraclub.org/press-releases/2017/01/americans-did-not-vote-dirty-air-and-polluted-water-congress-isn-t-listening
http://www.ombwatch.org/three-reasons-reins-act-must-be-stopped-again
http://www.jacksonsun.com/story/opinion/columnists/2017/01/04/we-were-never-closer-seeing-reins-act-become-law/96090608/

NAME: Your five-minute action item THIS MORNING, RIGHT NOW: Jan. 5, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello!
Thanks to yours and thousands of others' phone calls, the Republican-led House of Representatives dumped their plan to gut their own ethics office. Yes, Trump tweeted a rebuke to them as well...but
[the word on the Floor](http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2017/01/03/reps_say_phone_calls_prompted_ethics_reversal.html)
is that it was all your angry calls that caused them to ditch the idea.*
For now. While we have
[every reason to celebrate?our power of the people](http://preview.mailerlite.com/l3w0h5/532489737068352055/b4v5/)
, you can bet that this proposed rule change will come back up as soon as they think no one is looking. To that end, and because
[some other stupid stuff passed in the rules package yesterday](http://www.apnewsarchive.com/2017/The-House-is-establishing-new-rules-for-the-115th-Congress/id-f035046abb0a4354bf0eb7840a4312dc)
, we are going to call our reps again today.
Your task
Call and say:
I am calling to say I am really glad the House listened to its constituents and eliminated the proposed rule change to gut the Office of Congressional Ethics. However, I am disappointed that two other awful rules changes were passed, namely making it
[easier for Congress to sell or give away federal land](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/energy-environment/wp/2017/01/03/house-gop-rules-change-would-make-it-easier-to-sell-off-federal-land/?utm_term=.e33945bb4e07)
, and empowering Republican leaders?to
[fine members who take pictures or video on the House floor](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-dec-30-2016)
. Our public lands are for all of us, and it is Congress' responsibility to protect these lands, not put them up for grabs. And the measure to fine people for recording is a cynical way to reduce transparency and accountability.
[For Democrats:]
I want Representative ______ to keep fighting against measures such as these. This rules package is not acceptable.
[For Republicans:]
I am extremely disappointed that the Republicans continue to put their own power before the good of the American people. Representative _______ was hired to represent us, not his/her party.
If you have a few more minutes
Call Ryan (202-225-0600) and say the above.
Call Nancy Pelosi (202-225-0100),?who was quite vocal against this rules package, and thank her. Make sure to mention how important the land-grab thing is to you -- her protest focused mostly on the ethics office thing and the fining-members-who-record thing.
THANKS!
Note: Since the Republicans gathered in secret?Monday night to vote include the failed measure, we don't know which Republican voted No and which voted Yes.
[This article](http://www.politico.com/story/2017/01/house-republicans-gut-their-own-oversight-233111)
lists a few Ayes and Nays, and
[this one](https://sunlightfoundation.com/public-whip-count-for-vote-on-changes-to-office-of-congressional-ethics/)
shows some additional info, so?if you are in a Republican district please do take a moment to look at these, and if your rep was one of the Nos, thank him/her.
*
(Trump might have tweeted this as a way to steal the spotlight away from Democratic/progressive house members and constituents like you, who were energetically opposing the rules change...it's pretty certain, imo, he didn't do it because of some ethical stance, since he has demonstrated an inhuman absence of ethics.)
Sources

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 4, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Sigh.
The Republican House's very first point of action upon being seated, yesterday,?was?to
[gut?its own independent investigation body](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/house-republicans-vote-eviscerate-office-congressional-ethics/?utm_source=facebook&utm_medium=pbsofficial&utm_campaign=newshour)
. The?non-partisan Office of Congressional Ethics?was set up in 2008 to reduce corruption in Congress?and has since investigated and referred for justice actions?Congressional members from both parties who were engaging in bribery and other corruption. Led by Bob Goodlatte (R-Va), the Republican majority added this measure with no warning into a rules package on?Monday, Jan. 2.?So we know what priorities are for the 2017 House: ignore looming national issues, and clear the way for themselves to engage in whatever unlawful kleptocratic behavior they want.
Included in this package is also
[the measure you called about on Friday](http://tinyletter.com/FiveMinutes/letters/your-five-minute-action-item-today-dec-30-2016)
, which will further muzzle transparency and accountability. You can mention that as well.
The House will vote on this?package TODAY. Please call?House Speaker Paul Ryan and your own House?Rep TODAY, THIS MORNING, and say:
I urge Representative ________?to speak out forcefully against the change of the non-partisan Office of Congressional ethics to the Office of Congressional Complain Review. This change effectively guts this office. At a time when transparency and ethics are more important than ever, this is a highly suspect and deeply disappointing move. The measure Paul Ryan introduced to fine members of Congress who film proceedings seems to be in the same vein?of reducing transparency and accountability. Please actively fight these measures.
I am paying attention and I want to hear Rep. ______ actively working against the passage of this move. Thank you.
If you have a Republican representative and they push back against either, you can say "I'm telling you how this looks to your constituents. For your first acts to be to enforce ways to escape accountability does not look good, and I am watching."
Sources
http://www.npr.org/2017/01/02/507955013/house-gop-votes-to-strip-independence-from-congressional-ethics-office
http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/house-republicans-vote-eviscerate-office-congressional-ethics/
NAME: Your Five-Minute Action Item Today: Jan 3. 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Happy New Year!
I forgot to advise you on the 30th there'd be no letter the 31st or the 1st. Sorry. Welcome to Jan. 2.
I think today is still an office holiday so we'll start phone calls tomorrow. Today, let's continue to work on flipping state seats from red to blue?you may recall that the Democrats?lost NINE HUNDRED state seats during Obama's term. Many thanks to
[flippable.org](http://flippable.org)
for this info in this letter.
Virginia has
[a couple of flippable seats up for special election](http://bluevirginia.us/2016/12/quick-take-upcoming-virginia-special-elections)
. On the down side, the reason these seats are empty is?because the?Republicans holding them won U.S. Congressional seats. On the up side, this gives the Democrats a chance to fill them. Special elections are great opportunities to flip seats because of (the rather deflating?reason of) low voter turnout?a concerted effort on the part of one party or another can really make a difference.
Give $2 or $3 to each of these candidates?and help make a difference. Their elections are January 10.
[Cheryl Turpin](https://cherylturpinforvb.com)
is a public school teacher who is?running for the House District?85?vacant seat (Va. Beach).?This district is very "purple" and she has a decent chance of winning.
Donate to Cheryl Turpin's campaign
[here](https://secure.actblue.com/contribute/page/flippable)
.
[Ryant Washington](http://www.washington4senate.com)
is a progressive-minded former sheriff and law enforcement advisor?who is running for the Senate District 22 vacant seat.?This is a very red district, BUT?
[slow and steady wins the race, right?](https://youtu.be/ySODaealPIQ)
We keep showing up, we keep resisting, and things will change. And even if the Republican wins, it will be clear he does not have anything like a mandate if there is a strong Democratic showing. We have to keep trying.
Donate to Ryant Washington's campaign
[here](https://secure.actblue.com/contribute/page/flippableryant#11)
.
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Jan. 2, 2017
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
[Good mooorning](https://youtu.be/GB2yiIoEtXw)
!
Reminder: tomorrow is your last day to make donations in the 2016 year.
But today!
Today is a work day, and we will be calling your representative on a draft bill that will be discussed and voted
on Jan 3?that's right after the holiday
,?which is why we are calling TODAY.
Paul Ryan is supporting a bill drafted by House Republicans to?fine members of the House for filming or taking photos from the floor of Congress. This is an obvious reaction to the Democrats' using their cellphones to post photos and video of their protest on the floor last July when Republicans, AGAIN, shut down discussion of?sensible gun laws?just ten days after the Pulse Nightclub shooting. The House Democrats were obliged to?use?their own devices because the Republicans had
ordered the House?s C-SPAN camera and microphone turned off.
Your task
[Call your Rep](http://www.house.gov/representatives/find/)
TODAY,
NOW
, and say:
"I am calling about the Republican-led bill to fine members of the House who film or take photos while on the floor. This clearly?stems from the Democrats' using their personal devices to film their gun-laws protest in July after the Republicans forced the C-SPAN camera and mic off, and
is a total affront to the transparency and honesty that American people deserve. I urge you to roundly reject this bill and to implore all your colleagues to do the same. We are counting on you to maintain our democracy."
If the office responds by saying the law?enforces rules of decorum that already exist (or if you anticipate that will be their argument and you get VM), say:
"The Democrats were obliged to use their own?devices because the Republicans shut down the session rather than talk about the?vitally important issue of sensible gun laws. I would be glad to?talk to you about decorum when it's clear the House Republicans are willing and able to play by the rules and make good policy happen. I and many other constituents have had enough of dodging crucial issues needing attention and making excuses for it, and we are paying attention."
If there is a VM message, leave a VM. If the box is full, try another of your rep's offices?there are generally three or ?four, one in Washington and a few around your state. If?all those are full, write a letter or email.
Sources
http://www.newsweek.com/house-republicans-fine-recording-536721
http://www.cnn.com/2016/12/28/politics/house-gop-fines-democrats-gun-sit-in/
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 30, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good evening, Five-Minuters!
Today's task riffed off of?Green Action Together's
[call to action](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pU_KF8GGnJGAHfe40CiOwyWdcK1KfbQpoe1JXIUtYDQ/edit)
. Thanks, GAT!
The senate confirms cabinet picks. ?It takes 51 votes to confirm Trump?s picks. There are 48 Democrats in Senate and 52 Repubs. We need to sway a few Republicans to deny Trump?s anti-environment cabinet picks!
Print out the letter below, or use information from it to write your own letter, and snail-mail it, or phone, or email?it if you must,?to your Senators (contact info
[here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Dqgdi1vJFRS0PpPP_KO-afjUJOpxc72RNEO1d9_5NSQ/edit#gid=0)
). Consider modifying/customizing so there is variety in what they receive.
Um, also, I haven't proofread so please do that before printing and sending kaythanks.
Dear (Senator Name):
I am contacting you to request that you vote AGAINST the confirmation of Trump?s anti-environment cabinet picks:
Scott Pruitt to lead the EPA: He is a climate change denier and he is suing the?EPA, the very agency he's been selected to head. He is a foe?of the Clean Power Plan and a strong supporter of?Oklahoma oil and gas companies, in conflict with the position he is nominated for.
Rick Perry for Energy Secretary: He is a climate change denier who?wanted to abolish the Department of Energy, the very agency he's been selected?to head.
Rex Tillerson for Secretary of State: He is?the former CEO of Exxon Mobile and a long-time friend and business associate of Putin.
Ryan Zinke for Secretary of Interior: While he wants to protect lands for hunters and sportsmen, he is a climate-change skeptic and a fracking apologist and has low?regard for the protection of?endangered species.
All four are terrible?picks for agencies designed to protect the environment and defend against climate change, for four?main reasons:
1. ?Lack of Expertise: None of them have any scientific expertise and are therefore not qualified to oversee agencies responsible for protecting our air, water, land, climate, and clean energy future. (Zinke comes closest, with an undergraduate degree in geology from 1984)
2. ?Climate Change Denial: Despite their lack of expertise, Pruitt and?Perry?deny that human-made climate change is real and Zinke questions it. An overwhelming majority of the scientific community believe there is a preponderance of evidence that climate change is human-made, and urgent problem, and can be mitigated by human activity (
[NASA](http://climate.nasa.gov/scientific-consensus/)
).?The vast majority of the rest of the world are concerned (
[Pew](http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2016/04/18/what-the-world-thinks-about-climate-change-in-7-charts/)
), and a majority if Americans are concerned about climate change (
[Gallup](http://www.gallup.com/poll/190010/concern-global-warming-eight-year-high.aspx)
). It would be extremely irresponsible and either willfully, dangerously ignorant or willfully, dangerously malevolent?to appoint people whose beliefs are utterly odds with both scientific conclusiveness?and public opinion.
3. ?Opposition to Clean Energy: All have?made it clear that they do not support a clean energy economy, despite the fact that solar and wind power are the fastest-growing energy sources in the U.S. (
[Telegraph.co.uk](http://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2016/10/25/global-renewable-power-capacity-overtakes-coal-as-500000-solar-p/)
), and despite the fact that even 75% of voters who chose Trump support a clean energy economy (
[CEN Poll](http://www.conservativeenergynetwork.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/Clean-Energy-Survey4.pdf)
)! ?Their ideas are antiquated and counter-intuitive. ?Let?s not destroy all the progress we?ve made ensuring our economic stability and a livable future for our children and grandchildren!
4. ?Ties to Fossil Fuel Industries: All four nominees?have strong ties to the fossil fuel industry. This ?represents a complete conflict of interest, directly counter to?their appointed positions.
Three quarters of animals in the planet are in grave?danger of extinction
(
[USA Today](http://www.usnews.com/news/blogs/data-mine/2015/06/19/75-percent-of-animal-species-to-be-wiped-out-in-sixth-mass-extinction)
). Three quarters!! As I'm sure you know, when that much of the world's biodiversity topples, many many things topple after it?species work together to create balance in our system of breathable air, drinkable water, and food. Moreover, we simply must prepare ourselves for the climate change effects to come and do out best to mitigate the worst of those changes (
[NASA](http://climate.nasa.gov/effects/)
).?Denial driven by fear and self-interest?must stop!
Pruitt, Perry, Tillerson and Zinke are the wrong people for the job. As your constituent, I strongly urge you to oppose these appointments.?In doing so, you represent the majority of the people in the democracy that you help run. Thank you.
(Name)
Sources (in addition to those listed above)

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 29, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
For the rest of this week we'll go back to some earlier letters, when most of you hadn't yet joined. Today: Supporting reliable news sources!
Your task
Think about a reliable news source you use regularly and subscribe to it.?Journalism is essential to a democracy. We absolutely must find a way to re-center truth in our understandings of reality.
Do you find yourself looking at/listening to articles from any of the following? Pick that one and give it money.
Al-Jazeera
The Atlantic (analysis and opinion)
BBC
Bloomberg
The Center for Public Integrity?(nonprofit with a?mission of truth in reporting)
The Christian?Science Monitor (probably among the best balanced sources)
Columbia Journalism Review (excellent sort of meta-source looking at news and media)
The Economist (probably among the best balanced sources)
Mother Jones (unabashedly left, but solid investigative reporting)
The Nation?(unabashedly left, but solid investigative reporting)
The New York Times (left-leaning if sort of old-school editorial voice, reliable reporting)
The New Yorker?(left-leaning and?urbane but excellent?analysis and opinion)
NPR (your local?station)
PBS (your local?station)
ProPublica (nonprofit with a?mission of truth in reporting)
Reuters
The Washington Post (left-leaning editorial voice, reliable reporting)
The L.A. Times
The Wall Street Journal (right-leaning in the sense of being business/finance?oriented)
The Week (Left leaning, I think)
A local independent paper (
[do some research](https://www.americanpressinstitute.org/publications/six-critical-questions-can-use-evaluate-media-content/)
to determine its reliability)*
(You'll note my sources in these letters are sometimes things like CNN and USA Today. This is because I want to include sources?that your Trumpist relatives won't immediately dismiss if you share the informtion with them, as they might a Washington Post article.?I never use click-baity, screamy?sites as sources such as
[these](http://www.patheos.com/blogs/dispatches/2016/09/18/please-stop-sharing-links-to-these-sites/)
, and no one else should. Those are bad for journalism.)
If you have another five minutes
Pick one from the list above that?you've never heard of or heard of but don't know well and check it out.
Caveat
This is an incomplete list that is rife with my own interests and preferences.?I've found it?pretty?impossible to locate or compile a completely crisp bias-free list.?If you feel there are any glaring omissions shoot?me an email with your reasons.
*In Chicago the?Chicago Reporter?and the?Catalyst?have solid reporting on issues related to poverty and the Black community (Chicago Reporter) and education (Catalyst). They are both owned by the Society for?Community Renewal.?Crain's?is?a good Chicago business-focused?source.
Sources
https://mic.com/articles/24721/15-news-organizations-worthy-of-respect#.LwCnEDvaU
http://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2014/10/30/which-news-organization-is-the-most-trusted-the-answer-is-complicated/
http://www.cjr.org/criticism/journalist_election_trump_failure.php
THANKS!

[here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members)
and then put em in there!)?Today, go to your representatives' Facebook pages or Twitter feeds and find an issue or stance they?are posting about that you agree with?DACA, Aleppo refugees, reproductive rights, concern about?conflcts of interest,?white nationalism, or press freedom. NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 22, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Happy Winter Solstice! There's a lot of darkness now, but darkness is needed for growth and?regeneration.?It?will only get lighter from now on.
If you're heading home to A Divided House for?the holidays you might want some ideas about how not to have the worst time ever, and possibly how to address some common nail-on-chalkboard Trumpist arguments.
1) This
[livescience](http://www.livescience.com/56949-how-to-survive-thanksgiving-after-the-election.html)
article and this
[L.A. Times](http://www.latimes.com/home/garden/la-hm-political-thanksgiving-survival-guide-politics-20161114-story.html)
article have solid advice about dealing with political disagreement over the holidays
; both
are from Thanksgiving but of course they still apply.
2) On the other hand, it's everyone's responsibility to combat authoritarianism by insisting on truth.?These links should help you with the most common Trumpist arguments:
Family member talks about what a corrupt?liar?Hillary is?
[corrupt.af](http://corrupt.af)
lists all of the outrageous conflicts of interest Trump is engaging in in real time. See also the reddit link below.
Family member claims they haven't seen bigotry/white nationalism/lying/criminal behavior/lots of other horrors?
[This reddit link](https://m.reddit.com/r/EnoughTrumpSpam/comments/4uabwt/final_response_megathread/)
lists every disturbing feature?Trump brings with him to office?and links to sourced examples.
Family member claims we are being overrun by immigrants and refugees?
[ThisTimearticle](http://time.com/4116619/syrian-refugees-screening-process/)
explains the extremely rigorous refugee vetting process and the tiny number of Syrian refugees we actually have in our country.
Family member claims Trump has already started saving jobs?
[ThisIndy Stararticle](http://www.indystar.com/story/news/politics/2016/12/08/trump-saved-800-jobs-indiana-but-least-2100-still-leaving/95034326/)
points out that intervening with individual companies to retain some percentage of jobs in exchange for huge benefits to that company is not a sustainable practice. Don't forget too Trump
[Tweet-tantrumed](http://www.cnbc.com/2016/12/07/trumps-latest-tweet-attacks-union-chief-at-indianapolis-carrier-plant.html)
at the union guy who pointed out his self-congratulatory exaggerations on?the issue.
Family member claims our economy has gone to hell and only Trump can save it?
[Here from MediaMatters](http://mediamatters.org/research/2016/09/23/myths-facts-debate-guide-donald-trump-s-most-common-lies-about-economy/213284)
are myths and facts from several months ago in re Trump's false claims about the U.S.?jobless rate and such.
Take a few minutes to pull a couple examples that you anticipate might be relevant to your particular family's Trumpsession.
Good luck!
p.s. If you or a family member wants an in-depth look into all of the kleptocratic and unseemly mixings of Trump interests? and our country's well-being, take a look at this
[Atlantic](http://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2016/12/donald-trump-conflicts-of-interests/508382/)

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 21, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
As I might have mentioned thousands of times, it's important to
[resist, resist, resist](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2016/nov/11/how-to-survive-and-resist-in-the-trump-era-practical-things-you-can-do-now)
. The elector effort was an important piece of that even though it didn't succeed in changing the election results (it was not reasonably expected to do so). It contributes to the long view of keeping the president-elect's conflicts of interest and poor judgment top of mind. In the next several years, we will have to get used to delayed gratification, putting a lot of effort into things that look like they've sunk like rocks, but are in fact underwater stepping stones.
Most of our fight is going to be on the state and local levels, not the national level. It disgusts me to say it, but the Tea Party and the dreaded Koch brothers took this tack and have been unbelievably successful. Did you know
[more than 900 state seats throughout the country have flipped](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2016/11/12/these-3-maps-show-just-how-dominant-republicans-are-in-america-after-tuesday/?utm_term=.27e8be04f21f)
from Democratic to Republican over the course of Obama's two terms?? And that even
[local library bond measures in small towns are being defeated](http://everylibrary.org/koch-brothers-funded-anti-library-robo-calls-plainfield-il/)
(having a public good like a library is a ?part of "big government," you see)?
Your task
So, today's five-minute action item:
1)?Locate your local legislators?you have one state representative and one state senator and
[here](http://openstates.org/find_your_legislator/)
is a good place to find them (note, the search box seems to get confused by commas, so type your address without them).
2) Sign up to receive their newsletters. You will probably receive an email between one and four times a month. When you receive them, don't trash them without taking a couple minutes to skim them; they're not long.
THANKS!
NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 20, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello,
One of the things we want to guard against is the normalizing of extreme and unacceptable?stances. Recently the American Medical Association announced its support for Tom Price as the head of Health and Human Services. You might recall Tom Price has fought for years to a) gut the ACA, Medicare and other policies that help vulnerable patients get medical care, and b) curtail reproductive rights in any way possible, up to and including helping lead the charge for personhood, the idea that fertilized eggs are people. (Imagine the havoc such legislation would have on couples doing IVF treatment and on the great many people who miscarry. It is absolutely nonsensical.) He has expressed disdain for women's need for accessible birth control.
A large and growing group of doctors have rejected the AMA's support and joined a new alternative medical association, the Clinician's Access Network.
[CAN representatives' words](http://www.cbsnews.com/news/doctors-protest-ama-backs-donald-trump-hhs-nominee-tom-price/)
: "We believe that in issuing this statement of support for Dr. Price, the AMA has reneged on a fundamental pledge that we as physicians have taken ? to protect and advance care for our patients." And in an interview, "We are not partisan. We don?t identify with Republicans or Democrats. We identify with patients. If patients will benefit we are in full support of that. Anyone forwarding policies harmful to patients, we will fight vehemently.?
Write to the AMA at
https://www.ama-assn.org/eform/submit/contact-us .
Say:
I am extremely disappointed by the AMA's endorsement of Donald Trump's nominee for Secretary of Health and Human Services, Dr. Tom Price. Dr. Price's enthusiastic opposition to the Affordable Care Act and efforts to curtail women's access to basic health care show that he is guided by something other than medical knowledge or scientific thinking. Dr. Price's lack of consideration for those patients who are already the most vulnerable in our society is incredibly unprofessional and will hurt a great many patients. I am mystified by your endorsement. You have lost a good deal of esteem in my eyes. What could your justification possibly be? I would appreciate a response.?Thank you.
Sources
https://www.ama-assn.org/ama-statement-nomination-rep-tom-price-be-hhs-secretary
http://www.cbsnews.com/news/doctors-protest-ama-backs-donald-trump-hhs-nominee-tom-price/
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/28/us/politics/tom-price-secretary-health-and-human-services.html?_r=0

NAME: Your five-minute action items today: Dec. 19, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Today, take five minutes to?write down on a piece of paper?the actions you've taken in the past week or so.?Include calls and emails. Include your talks with?others about what you or they can do?and about your?concerns and hopes. Include deliberate?changes you've made in your?media consumption and other habits. Look at this letter's archive to help jog your memory (tinyletter.com/fiveminutes/archive).
Check off each thing after you've completed the list -- so satisfying! Thank yourself with a small pleasure -- a cup of hot chocolate, an extra?minute?browsing a shop or standing with your face to the sun -- a pause?that you alone know is a thank you. With a prayer, a gesture, or the act of kind conduct today, ?thank?the hundreds of thousands of?others who are also making a regular practice of resistance, small or large.?You are not alone.
THANKS!

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 17, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Happy Friday!
Your action today, the last day before the holiday break for Congress, is to call Harry Reid, who is retiring, to thank him for continuing to speak out bravely against Trump's dangerous plans and even worse conflicts of interest, against FBI Director Comey's unprecedented partisan actions during the election, and against the benefits Trump gained from Russian interference with the election. If you get this after his NV office closes oh, ok, fine, go ahead and email or tweet him.
Harry Reid, ?202-224-3542 (D.C.); 775-686-5750 (Reno, NV); webform for email
[here](http://www.reid.senate.gov/contact)
; @SenatorReid
Say:
I am calling to thank Mr. Reid for continuing to speak plainly and strongly about the dangers the country faces because of Donald Trump. Trump's many conflicts and his refusal to acknowledge them, as well as his clearly benefiting from Russian interference, are serious threats to our national security and our democracy. I also want to thank Mr. Reid for speaking out against the outrageous partisan actions of James Comey. It is unbelievable that the Director of the FBI would act to sway a presidential election. I really appreciate Mr. Reid's words and hope he will continue to speak out even after his retirement. And finally, I'd like to thank Mr. Reid for his service and wish him a happy retirement!
Sources
http://www.cnn.com/2016/12/12/politics/harry-reid-james-comey-election/
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/harry-reid-russia-donald-trump_us_584f0df0e4b0e05aded537cd [note: while I avoid citing the Huffington Post whenever possible as a screamy clickbait machine, in this case it has primary-source video of Harry Reid talking.]
http://www.reid.senate.gov/press_releases/2016-11-11-reid-statement-on-the-election-of-donald-trump#.WFRSXcdh2Rs
An unrelated screed you can ignore if you wish because there's nothing we can do about it and it might make you want to run out of the house screaming
I was going to make today's email all about Merrick Garland, the Supreme Court nominee thwarted by the, I'm sorry, unmitigated conniving evil embodied in Mitch McConnell, combined with the tragic and increasingly infuriating menschiness of Obama. There is nothing we can do about the ninth Supreme Court seat now going to Donald Trump and a deep red GOP.
It makes me sick with fury and fear, but I couldn't find any action to do around this. Obama
[seems to have signaled that he will not make a controversial recess appointment](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2016/12/14/is-obama-throwing-in-the-towel-on-merrick-garland/?utm_term=.da141271d363)
. The following actions will take more than five minutes and won't actually do anything, so I am not centering them, but please: feel free to write Obama an enraged letter about how he is throwing us all to the wolves with this SCOTUS issue as well as with his having known full well months ago that Russia was gaming the election for Trump. I am. Also feel free to write McConnell a letter. I am not doing that, because I dislike him so much that it feels like hate and I'm a little scared to go there. But that's all the more reason you should take one for the team and do it.
NAME: Your five-minute action item: Dec. 16, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morn...er, afternoon!
This past week over here at FiveMinutes has been a doozy, hasn't it? Lots of calling, lots of letter writing. I wanted today's action to be a nice easy fill-out-a-webform type. Unfortunately, this Russian hacking stuff keeps getting more crazy. So?here we go.
McConnell and Ryan now claim they support an investigation into the Russian hacking that successfully hurt Democrats and benefited Republicans
[from the presidential ticket on down](http://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/13/us/politics/house-democrats-hacking-dccc.html?_r=0)
. Ryan and McConnell, who with a select few others learned of the CIA's conclusions in September, have done nothing but
[bury, then discredit, then diminish the findings](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/obama-orders-review-of-russian-hacking-during-presidential-campaign/2016/12/09/31d6b300-be2a-11e6-94ac-3d324840106c_story.html?utm_term=.bb5efdde81a6)
. Do you have faith that they will conduct a rigorous, honest investigation? I don't. This issue needs to be investigated
independently
of Republican-led Congressional committees.
Your tasks
Call any
Republican
that represents you, be that your governor, U.S. senators, or House rep, and say:
I am gravely concerned about the Russian hacks that led to both state races and the presidential race being compromised. This is WAY bigger than any partisan concerns and an investigation must not be subject to that possibility. I implore you to support an
independent
investigation. This is not a game. Our national security, our standing in the world, and our democracy are threatened. I feel personally threatened and want to see that _______ has his/her constituents' best interests on the agenda.
Call your
Democratic
representatives ? if you want to choose for the sake of time, let's go with the House, because we've focused a lot on the Senate in our calling ? and say:
I am gravely concerned about the Russian hacks that led to both state races and the presidential race being compromised. I implore you to support an
independent
investigation. Because of the hyper-partisan atmosphere of Congress these past several years, I don't trust these committees to investigate this issue honestly or reliably. Our national security, our standing in the world, and our democracy are threatened. I am asking ______ to please push for an
independent
investigation.
Note, some are already asking for an independent investigation, including Sens. Durbin, Pelosi, and Boxer ? so, instead of the above, call them to thank them and urge them to get their colleagues on board. If you don't know where one of your reps stands, go to their website and look for a statement or press release on the subject to see whether you need to urge them to take a stand or thank them for doing so.

NAME: Your five-minute action item: Dec. 15, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
I initially was against this faithless elector thing ? that's where GOP electors in the electoral college go against expectations and cast their vote for a candidate other than Trump. It seemed reckless and and reflexive, propelled by the "denial" stage of grief. But, as Trump has given us more and more-clear reasons to be gravely concerned about his suitability, I have come to agree that this is exactly what the electoral college was for. Some electors have already pledged to vote for someone besides Trump; thirty-seven more are needed. That will then throw the vote to the House of Representatives, who will then, one would hope,?choose someone more responsible. (I
t won't be Clinton; these are GOP electors and a GOP-led House.)?Some electors face minor penalties?for voting with their conscience but
[lawyers have offered to defend them pro bono](http://Some face minor penalties for voting with their conscience but lawyers have offered to defend them pro bono.)
.
Your task is to write to some or all of the voters in the electoral college. Or rather, print out what's already written! See? Five minutes! You gotta find the envelope and stamp yourself. Or you can email, but they might have blocked unknown addresses by now. But you can try.
Go to
[this site](http://directelection.org)
, directelection.org?and just print out a letter this guy has already written for you. He even made mailing labels! Done!
Republican-elector?states (no sense writing the Democratic-elector states as they are obviously not casting their vote for Trump) are
: Alabama Alaska Arizona Arkansas Florida Georgia Idaho Indiana Iowa Kansas Kentucky Louisiana Maine (3 Dems and?1 Republican, Richard Bennet. Whatever, Maine) Michigan Mississippi Missouri Montana Nebraska North Carolina North Dakota Ohio Oklahoma Pennsylvania South Carolina South Dakota Tennessee Texas Utah West Virginia Wisconsin Wyoming
Or
Go to
[this site](http://asktheelectors.org)
, asktheelectors.org, to compose your thoughts. Click the red button?and it'll create an email from what you wrote in your own email program, populated with electors' email addresses. Done!
Or
Go to
[this site](https://makedemocracymatter.org)
, makedemocracymatter.org,?and get information by state for where to mail, call, or tweet. Done! This site is all about that Clinton won the popular vote which is not a valid argument given the way our system is currently set up and which is not nearly as convincing for a GOP electoral voter as pointing out the ways another Republican would be more fit than Trump. So I would recommend using the arguments below rather than the argument that Clinton won the popular vote.
Every act of resistance against Trump?is necessary. This is a powerful act of resistance.
Here is my letter:
Dear _______:
I am writing to implore you to cast your electoral vote for a Republican other than Donald Trump. The Federalist Papers say electors can judge the fitness of a president in three ways: by his qualifications or lack thereof, by whether he is a demagogue?or charlatan, and by whether he is influenced by foreign powers. Donald Trump is unfit?by these standards.
As to his qualifications,?Mr. Trump's?phone calls and tweets to and?about foreign leaders with whom we have delicate relationships
show dangerously poor judgment,
as does his lack of interest in daily?intel briefings and his baseless rejection of the work of the CIA, an institution whose job it is to keep us safe.
As to demagoguery,
Donald Trump is?the very definition of a demagogue, "a leader who makes use of popular prejudices and false claims and promises in order to gain power." His lies about himself and others?are many, and hate crimes against immigrants, Muslims, women, and other groups targeted by Mr. Trump have risen dramatically along with his rise.
Mr. Trump has impugned the press, political opponents, and indeed political friends by casting an abhorrent?mix of?lies, threats, and juvenile name-calling.
As to influence by foreign powers,?Mr. Trump is defiant about?his domestic and international?business interests, refusing to set them aside in any meaningful and binding way, and?there is already evidence that?because of this he will be enriched personally through his office of president. Dignitaries wish to stay at his hotels, for example, and real estate interests are discussed during diplomatic calls.
His children are involved with his political dealings and his business dealings both, a concerning and unprecedented conflict of interest. And finally, his admiration for Vladimir Putin and the connections to Putin both in his proposed cabinet and throughout the campaign all cause grave concern about our national security and?our very democracy.
There is no longer time to "wait and see." Mr. Trump has shown us amply who he is and how he would govern. The Founding Fathers would find him utterly unfit, the exact type of candidate they created the electoral college to guard?against.?I really appreciate your role in our democracy and know this must be a terribly difficult?decision. I hope you will consider taking the opportunity you have to elect a more fit person to be president. If you wish to?do so but are uncertain about any potential consequences to you, I recommend looking into the Electors' Trust,?electorstrust.org, which provides free and confidential legal support to any elector wishing to vote?their conscience.
Thank?you.
Sincerely,
Sources

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 13, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Today, the first day of the last week of Congress before their holiday break, let's implore our Senators?to speak out against Trump's ghastly cabinet picks. He?literally could not have chosen?more destructive people for these cabinets. It is beyond?belief. Take a look at the Sources section for more info on each of these people.
Call both of your U.S. senators and say the following. Remember at the end to appeal to them:
I'm scared. These choices are dangerous. We are relying on you as our voice in the government.
Call and say:
"Good morning! I am calling because I am gravely concerned about the?proposed Trump Administration cabinet. Almost to a one, the people selected are bent on destroying?the?very structures they are supposed to steward. The number of billionaires in this cabinet makes it look like a Monopoly Game.?These picks look like satire. I cannot believe they are real. I'd like to give you my reasons for opposing some of the choices, but the theme here is I feel like I and my family are hens in a henhouse and Trump is introducing hungry foxes.
"The chosen head of the treasury [Steve Mnuchin]?is a Wall Street banker who was?with Goldman Sachs?for 17 years.?I can't think of a better definition of a fox in the henhouse than that.?And the guy chosen to be?Secretary of Commerce [Wilbur Ross, Jr.]?is a billionaire investor. We are back to the robber baron days.
"The expected choice for?Secretary of State, a guy who will be leading our foreign policy, is a super-rich oil man with ties to Putin?[Exxon Mobile CEO?Rex Tillerson]. This sounds made-up.
"Jeff Sessions was too racist to be appointed a judge.?He will now be attorney general, in charge of prosecutions and sentencing.
"A guy who traffics heavily in off-the-wall conspiracy theories?has been chosen as head of national security [Michael Flynn]. If any position needs?a level-headed person who can tell fact from fiction, it is the head of our national security. I understand this position is not voted on, but Senator _____'s voice?matters.?It is the only thing we have.
"The guy chosen to lead the EPA [Scott Pruitt]?is currently suing the EPA. He doesn't believe in climate change and is a champion of fossil fuels. And he will be in charge of the
environmental protection agency
.
The person chosen to protect our national parks and other natural areas is a dedicated?drilling, logging, and mining advocate [Cathy McMorris Rodgers, chosen for Secretary of Interior...She is also a climate change denier, natch].
"The proposed secretary of education [Betsy DeVos]?is a billionaire who has spent gigantic sums of money to push for a voucher system and has never taught, studied education, or even sent her kids to public school. She is a huge advocate of providing public money for Christian schools. And she is in charge of our
public school system
.
"For Health and Human Services we have a guy who hates the ACA and holds interests in pharmaceutical, medical device,?and health insurance companies, the very companies he will be charged with overseeing.?This is an untenable conflict of interest. Tom Price is also key player in the unscientific and bizarre personhood?movement.
"The person chosen to protect the rights and opportunities of workers and job-seekers [Andy Puzder as Secretary of Labor]?has violated employment and hourly laws at half of his restaurants and spoken out against basic workers' rights such as sick leave.
"Please. These choices defy reason. This cabinet will be playing with hundreds of millions of people's lives, here and abroad. What unifies these choices is a frankly cruel disregard for everyday Americans like me. We have no voice except through our elected representatives, so, please, I am imploring Senator _____ to do everything (s)he can to mitigate these crazy fox-in-the-henhouse choices. We are counting on him/her and we are scared."

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 12, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good afternoon!
A pep talk: a million bitty flashlights
If you are like me, you sometimes struggle with believing that your small actions are actually
doing
anything. What difference does one phone call or one lousy entry on a website make? Sometimes I feel like I'm struggling to light an endless fall down Alice's rabbit hole with a bitty little pen flashlight.
But we must keep faith, and we must keep paying attention.?Each of us has a bitty little flashlight to shine. If there are thousands, hundreds of thousands, millions of us all shining our bitty little flashlights together, the dangerous nonsense that has seized our democracy will wither and fade under the light.
Of course, if you want to wield a bigger flashlight, there are many opportunities to get involved in politics and/or activism in increments greater than five minutes. This newsletter is focused on small actions, so I don't touch on those here. But if you email me I can suggest some ideas to research.
So! Your task.
It's Sunday evening. Focus your thoughts for the week ahead by going to the website of an organization you already support and doing one of their online action items, such as sharing your story or signing an online petition. If you don't know where to go, here are some ideas:
ACLU, the American Civil Liberties Union: https://www.aclu.org/action
Earthjustice, defending the environment: http://earthjustice.org/action
Electronic Frontier Foundation,?defending civil liberties in the digital world:?https://act.eff.org
Planned Parenthood Action, defending reproductive rights and access to reproductive health care: https://www.plannedparenthoodaction.org/act
Onward!
NAME: Your action item today: Sunday Dec. 11
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Happy Saturday!
You may recall calling?Lamar Smith, the head of the House Science Committee who doesn't believe in science. One glaring example is his active work against acknowledging and?addressing climate change (see sources). ?Here are two two-minute things you can do on the weekend:
Task 1
Thank meteorologist?Danielle Banks and?the?Weather Channel for publicly?rebuking Breitbart?when Breitbart?misused Weather Channel graphics?in a story falsely?denying climate change.
[Watch their video and read their article](https://weather.com/news/news/breitbart-misleads-americans-climate-change)

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 10, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Today's task is a bit different. I was reminded yesterday during my call to outgoing Senator Kirk (R-IL) that positive reinforcement is powerful. I began my call by thanking Sen. Kirk for his service, saying I often did not agree with him on policy but that I appreciated his efforts and his integrity. The aide was super thankful.?When I mentioned the second reason for my call - to express my grave concern about Tom Price - the aide enthusiastically noted my concerns and asked if I had concerns about other picks. Did I ever!! I went down the list and he noted them all. He thanked me and?talked?about the importance calling, saying otherwise the Senator and his staff don't know what people are thinking and they really want to know, etc.?I was?not meaning to?butter anyone up - thanking Kirk?was one of the talking points on my agenda. But it certainly seemed helpful!
Your task
Let's wait til Monday or Tuesday to call about the dangerous unsuitability of most of Trump's cabinet picks (we don't want your words forgotten over the weekend). But today, let's pause to develop our calling game. Your task is to call your U.S. House and Senate reps and get to know how we can best communicate with them.
Get some paper and pencil or its digital equivalent. When the person answers, note their name. Then say:
Hi, ____. My name is _____. In the wake of this election, I've decided to get more involved in the democratic process. You'll be hearing from me a lot - in fact you already have - so I thought I'd call to introduce myself, and learn from you how I can be a good constituent.
Is there a best day or time to call _______'s office to give my thoughts on a particular issue or bill? Is there a day or time to avoid?
What can I do to make sure my opinion is?heard? What are some things I should avoid?
How do you process these calls? Do you tally pro/con, deliver a daily or weekly summary, or something else? What if I'm the only person who is calling about an issue?
What are some other ways I can engage besides calling?
Thanks so much! Have a great weekend.
Sources
http://lifehacker.com/the-best-ways-to-contact-your-congress-people-from-a-f-1788990839
Emily Ellsworth, who created the powerful series of tweets in the Lifehacker link above about the best way to communicate with your rep, expanded on the notion and created a really useful handbook:?http://callthehallsguide.com
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/174f0WBSVNSdcQ5_S6rWPGB3pNCsruyyM_ZRQ6QUhGmo/htmlview?usp=embed_facebook&sle=true

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Dec. 9, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Your task
Trump has named as his choice for Secretary of Health and Human Services Tom Price, an orthopedic surgeon whose major priorities are restricting reproductive health choices and dismantling the ACA, or Affordable Care Act (Obamacare). More details below "How to call." Your task is to ask your senators to represent their constituents by speaking out against this appointment and working to keep this extreme ideologue out of the cabinet.
How to call
If you don't have your reps' numbers in your phone,
[find 'em](http://www.pbs.org/newshour/updates/trumps-vow-repeal-obamacare-spurs-womens-rush-get-birth-control/)
and put 'em in now once and for all.
Please call your Senators and tell them:
[If they are Democrats] I am extremely concerned about Tom Price's appointment as head of Health and Human Services. His strong support of the fringe notion of personhood and 0% rating from Planned Parenthood are horrifying. I am also concerned about his enthusiasm for repealing the ACA, health care that millions and millions of Americans rely on. I am relying on Senator ______ to stand strong with his/her constituents by calling Tom Price out as an extreme and damaging choice and, when the time comes, by voting against his appointment. I want to hear and see Senator ____ actively fighting to keep ideologues like Tom Price out of this administration. Can I count on him/her?
[If they are Republicans]
I am extremely concerned about Tom Price's appointment to head Health and Human Services. His extremist views around personhood simply do not represent how most Americans feel. I am also concerned about his enthusiasm for repealing the ACA, health care that millions and millions of Americans rely on. The ACA needs to be shored up, not destroyed. Even many Republican-led states now see how valuable the ACA has been. It is very important for Republicans to push back on extremists in the Trump cabinet. Can I count on Senator ______ to speak out against Tom Price, and when the time comes, to vote against his appointment?
More information
Tom Price was a key figure in the "personhood" movement, in which people tried to get fertilized eggs legally declared humans. It didn't work, naturally, since this stance is total nonsense (what do couples doing IVF do with multiple fertilized eggs? How will we know if a woman is experiencing a period or a blastocyst's suicide?) and utterly unscientific. His was an ideological, medically irresponsible push meant to punish people seeking abortions. And now he's going to head all health care initiatives for the U.S.
Price is also hell-bent on repealing the ACA. The ACA needs changes, mostly because insurance companies have done their best to make things difficult for it and us. But eliminating the ACA will cause medical suffering and economic panic. For example, patients needing a lot of care will likely end up in "high-risk" pools, which have a dismal record in states that tried it, and?it will likely get much more difficult for many people to access or afford birth control.
So Tom Price has something for everyone, if by "everyone" you mean white supremacists, men's rights jerks, Pence, and Trump. Trump has mentioned at some points he wants to make changes to the ACA and at other points that he wants to repeal it entirely; his choice of HHS Secretary reveals his con.
[Editorial note: The same people who say the ACA, and regulations of any kind, are Big Government are the very people who want to legislate people's reproductive rights out of existence.]
Sources
I'm warning you, take some cleansing breaths before and after consulting these.
http://www.pbs.org/newshour/updates/trumps-vow-repeal-obamacare-spurs-womens-rush-get-birth-control/
[http://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/hhs-nominee-tom-price-backed-extreme-anti-choice-personhood-bills/](http://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/hhs-nominee-tom-price-backed-extreme-anti-choice-personhood-bills/)
[http://nymag.com/thecut/2016/11/health-secretary-pick-tom-price-on-abortion-birth-control.html](http://nymag.com/thecut/2016/11/health-secretary-pick-tom-price-on-abortion-birth-control.html)
[https://rewire.news/article/2016/12/01/trumps-hhs-pick-member-group-falsely-linking-abortion-cancer/](https://rewire.news/article/2016/12/01/trumps-hhs-pick-member-group-falsely-linking-abortion-cancer/)
http://money.cnn.com/2016/11/15/news/economy/trump-pre-existing-conditions/
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/11/upshot/no-birth-control-coverage-wont-go-away.html?_r=0
THANKS!

Remind your friends, family, coworkers, and clients that today is #GivingTuesday; make it a norm in your circle to give and to share where you gave.
Where to give
Here are a few ideas...
Give locally. Change starts at home. Think about the issues and practices you feel are most threatened by Trumpism and find your local?equivalent: a neighborhood women's health clinic; a group that helps settle refugees; a local Muslim community center; your region's wetlands?protection group.
[This website](http://www.givethefuture.org)
, #GiveTheFuture, has some great resources on a comprehensive group of issues. Take a look.
The U.S.'s current stance regarding Syrian and other Muslim refugees reminds me of the U.S.'s stance in 1942 on Jewish refugees, when we
[turned away a boatload of?thousands, claiming they may be Nazi spies](http://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/us-government-turned-away-thousands-jewish-refugees-fearing-they-were-nazi-spies-180957324/)
.
(This policy stood until the end of the War and untold numbers?perished because of it.)

Stand up for the dignity and safety of?human beings and the environment?by

.

NAME: Your  five-minute action item today: Nov. 29, 2016

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning! It's the Monday after Thanksgiving and everyone's back to work?including our representatives. Time to get to calling!
Today, your task is to raise your voice about the gross conflicts of interest in which Trump is engaging freely. This task and its links many thanks to?wall-of-us.org!
Your task
Senator Ben Cardin (D-MD), ranking member of the Senate Foreign Relations committee, has put together a
[Senate resolution](https://www.cardin.senate.gov/newsroom/press/release/cardin-to-introduce-senate-resolution-asking-trump-to-ensure-foreign-dealings-do-not-violate-us-constitution)
asking Trump to ensure his foreign dealings do not violate the U.S. Constitution. Please call Foreign Relations Committee members and tell them:
I am calling ____ in his/her?capacity as member of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. I am calling because I?support Senator Cardin's resolution ensuring the president-elect does not violate the Constitution through his foreign dealings. Mixing private and public holdings compromises our national security and is a threat to our Democracy. Can I count on Senator _______ to support this resolution?
How to call
[Here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pyVktQXCDsWyUacw1Gv6wlG5eMRfdOO5joOrHv7QO0I/edit)
is a list of the Committee members wall-of-us.org put together. Following?are some ideas for who to call, since the list of members is long:
Your own senator, if he or she is on the Committee; or
A couple Republicans in deep-red states such as Jeff Sessions and David Perdue; or
A couple Republicans in swing states such as Marco Rubio and Cory Gardner; or
A couple Committee ranking members and/or?the chair, Chuck Grassley; or
Lindsey Graham, Jeff Flake, and/or Rand Paul, who are all Republicans who have expressed grave concern about Trump's conflicts of interest and other Trumpist outrages. Make sure to thank them for their integrit
y; and
Ben Cardin, to thank him
?
If you have another second
Retweet Cardin's
[tweet](https://twitter.com/SenatorCardin/status/801180111852552192)
about the resolution.
Forward this email to friends who might be interested.
More info and sources
Trump is freely mixing his private business holdings with his responsibilities as a public officer. For example, Ivanka Trump, who is also deeply involved in the Trump family business holdings, attended meetings with foreign leaders alongside her father, a wholly unprecedented action that has no reasonable rationale. Foreign dignitaries are staying at Trump hotels in order to curry favor with him. Trump has asked Brexit leader Nigel Farage to oppose proposed windmills in Scotland because Trump feels they will mar one of his golf properties.
It is completely unethical and, well, kleptocratic to personally enrich oneself through one's public office of president.
Unfortunately, these conflicts are not specifically illegal (though the foreign dealings could be argued to violate the
[Emoluments Clause](http://time.com/4579979/emoluments-clause-constitution-donald-trump/)
of the Constitution).
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/25/opinion/donald-trumps-caldron-of-conflicts.html
http://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2016/11/donald-trump-conflicts-of-interests/508382/
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/11/26/us/politics/donald-trump-international-business.html

Trump also has a lot of distressing domestic conflicts of interest?and that's a call for another day!
THANKS FOR YOUR FIVE!

NAME: Your five-minute action today: November 23, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
Background
Trump has chosen Steve Bannon to be his chief White House strategist. Steve Bannon is the executive chair of Breitbart, an online media outlet beloved by white supremacists. Under Bannon's direction, Breitbart's content went from merely conservative to being a mouthpiece of the fringe ultra-right-wing (the "alt-right"). (Sources and some chilling video?below.)
Your task
Don't worry?FiveMinutes won't ask you to call your reps
every
day. But yes, today is another rep-calling day.
Call your U.S. senator and representative and ask if they have denounced Steve Bannon as the president-elect's pick for his chief strategist.
If they have, thank them
for standing up for American values.
If they have not, demand
they do so. Trump could not have picked a stronger signal that his America is a white Christian America led by men alone.
This appointment is not normal.
This America that Trump and Bannon want must not take seed.

NAME: Your five-minute action step today: November 22, 2016
