DESCRIPTION:
Good morning!
ACTION #1
Background
Trump has made clear through his choice?of EPA transition lead that he was not just trying to grab attention?when he denounced climate change as a hoax. The person who will lead the development of?Trump's EPA administration is?Myron Ebell (pronounced "Ee-bul"), one of the world's most prominent and outspoken climate-change critics. (More information sources are?at the end of this email.)
Your task
Call your representatives?and ask?them if you can count on them to?denounce the appointment of Myron?Ebell as Trump's EPA transition lead.
Use some or all of these talking points:
Climate change is an imminent threat to the world's people, as well as the plants, animals, and atmosphere we all rely on to live. The entire world has recognized this threat and is taking steps together to face it.
Wishing something weren't true doesn't make it go away. Playing with this threat as a political issue?is incredibly dangerous and inappropriate; insisting it doesn't exist shows an absence of leadership.
This is not a Democratic or Republican issue. This is an?issue that will greatly?affect your children and mine?and it is real.
We will emerge stronger if we accept the challenge of climate change and meet it. Jobs and whole industries can be developed in environmental and energy-conservation technology fields.
This is not something Congress?votes on, but we need to hear their voices insisting on reason and reality.
How to call
Don't have your reps' info in your phone yet? Find them
[here](https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members)
.
Hint: Call your U.S.?reps at their offices in your state, not their D.C. offices.
Please consider contacting the house and senate leaders, too, in their capacity as representatives for all Americans.
House speaker Paul Ryan: (202) 226-0600
Senate Majority leader Mitch McConnell: (202) 224-2541
Incoming Senate Minority Leader?Chuck Schumer:?(202) 224-6542
Outgoing Senate Minority Leader?Harry Reid: (202)?224-3542
House Minority Leader?Nancy Pelosi:?(202) 225-0100
This brings us to...
ACTION #2
If you haven't already, put all those phone numbers you just called in your contacts list. They're already in your phone log...easy!
Action #1: More information and sources
Myron Ebell believes the threat of climate change is massively exaggerated,?that the Obama administration's?Clean Power Plan for greenhouse gases is illegal, and that Obama's?participation in the Paris climate agreement
is unconstitutional. He helped destroy Congress's?2009 attempt to create cap-and-trade legislation (sources below).
If you wish,?sign this Sierra Club petition as well. But calling your own representatives, and then spreading the word, is probably more effective, so steel yourself and make the call. It will just take a few minutes and the person you speak to will be very nice.?Petition:?https://sierra.secure.force.com/actions/National?actionId=AR0060378&id=70131000001iOuIAAU
Sources:
https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition/
http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/meet-myron-ebell-the-climate-contrarian-leading-trumps-epa-transition/
And if you want to read something that reveals a complete lack of understanding of all the ways climate change will make life difficult,?read
[this article](http://www.forbes.com/forbes/2006/1225/038.html)
by Ebell in
Forbes
in 2006 (
forbes.com/forbes/2006/1225/038.html).
He says here that?warmer temperatures will make colder regions more habitable and that hot weather will only kill people who are close to death already. This?unbelievably?simplistic?understanding of climate change does not take into account how ecosystem collapses and changes in landforms and waterways?will affect our safety, food, and water supply, and will create social upheavals as?populations?become climate refugees through loss of land, food, and?water sources.

NAME: Your five-minute action item today: Nov. 20, 2016
ORGANIZER: Small Steps for a Big Impact

DESCRIPTION:
Hello! Today's five-minute agenda:
1) It's widely understood that overly partisan "news" and outright fake "news" swayed this election a great deal.* Look at
[this article](http://www.latimes.com/nation/politics/trailguide/la-na-trailguide-updates-want-to-keep-fake-news-out-of-your-1479260297-htmlstory.html)
from the L.A. Times and purge these clickbait-driven, sensationalist, ?and full-on fake news sites from your life. (Note, there are some satirical sites listed as well?these aren't intended to be taken seriously, but, unfortunately, some people do.)
*Background info, for those who have time:
http://graphics.wsj.com/blue-feed-red-feed/#/president-trump
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-intersect/wp/2016/11/17/facebook-fake-news-writer-i-think-donald-trump-is-in-the-white-house-because-of-me/
https://www.cnet.com/how-to/how-to-avoid-getting-conned-by-fake-news-sites/
Check
[this article](http://reason.com/blog/2016/11/17/this-professors-list-of-fake-news-sites)
out for a different opinion. On that, though, my take is that, while there is a difference between heavily slanted and sensationalist "news" and actual fake news, this distinction is not hugely important when it comes to getting our deeply divided two realities to merge. In fact, heavily slanted news is insidious and harder to call out; it's harder to get people to see they are not getting the full picture.
